story:
Short Summary

Do you remember the “kids table”?  That out-of-the-way table in the corner where you couldn’t bother the adults with your noise or your mess?  Though, like many, I have fond memories of the “kids table”, I longed to be old enough, or important enough, to contribute to adult conversation.  To me, the “kids table” can serve as a metaphor for how structures designed to assist those who hold less power, can actually silence.  Like the “big” table, when it comes to hospitality, it is the host who holds the power.  Though it is nice to be a guest, no one wants to be the guest on a permanent basis. 

  So what if kids were to host a dinner party?  How would they make their guests feel welcome?  What would they do with their power as “host”?  This project will do just that.  Working collaboratively with 10-14 year-olds of the Appleby Drive Kids Club, many of whom are newcomers to Canada, we plan to facilitate an installation based upon the themes of hospitality and power.  This installation with draw upon objects and imagery generated from a weekly art workshop based out of the Appleby Kid's Club space.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise 500.00 for material costs.  This includes art and installation supplies so that our work is gallery quality!  

If you donate to our cause you will receive a personal invitation to our opening on May 19th at the Snelgrove Gallery on the University of Saskatchewan Campus.  You will also have the opportunity to support budding artists from the vibrant community of Appleby Drive.

The Impact

Though this project we hope to build and facilitate relationships in the Appleby community, encourage creative engagement in the arts, introduce and practice collaborative installation, and encourage kids to become life-long creators!  

We also have hopes that through this project, kids would find that their creative contributions matter. We also hope to foster understanding, collaboration, and friendship in the process.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We are also looking for the following donations:

- old cookbooks and magazines 

- colourful yarn or string

- a wooden dining room table (poor condition is fine - we will be painting it)

- plastic fruit and vegatables 

- old picture frames without glass and backing

- provide snack for our Monday night meetings

story:
Short Summary

Moviehouse’s The Circle Bridge is a new site-specific video performance that combines live choreography of Mayuna Shimizu's Blue Muse Dance and large-scale animated projections of Nathan Punwar to tell a story of interconnectivity, travel and history. Audience members follow their own distinct narrative as they walk the span of the 2810 foot Pulaski Bridge that connects Greenpoint, Brooklyn with Long Island City, Queens across the Newtown Creek. Along their walk they encounter four separate projections and two unique performances that each tell a distinct part of their tale. Each element is integrally designed to give each viewer a unique all-encompassing visual, audio and physical experience.

The Circle Bridge is structured by six overlapping stories that are grounded in the history of the bridge, the neighborhoods that surround it and the communities that live and work there. The audience meets six distinct characters and they traverse time and space in interconnected  loops. Projected photographs morph into large animations on warehouses then come to life as dancers on the bridge itself. The Circle Bridge takes place over six weekend nights in September 2013.

What We Need & What You Get

To bring this piece to life, we need your help. The Circle Bridge is our most ambitious project to date. We are combining our creative experiences in dance, video and public art to create a massive and impactful piece. We need to raise $4,000 to rent the 4 10,000 lumen projectors required to transform warehouse walls into animated stories. Work of this scale is impossible without the extremely bright projectors. If we exceed our goals we will be able to add more shows.

As thanks we're giving you exclusive access to The Circle Bridge through preview content, signed show posters, free access to rehearsal, conversations and even historical tours with the directors, designers and performers. 

With this performance we are excited to be collaborating with an undeniably incredible group of creative colleagues and friends including Choreographer Mayuna Shimizu of Blue Muse Dance, animator and filmmaker Nathan Punwar, performers Hazuki Homma, Matthew Roberts, Femi Olagoke, Malin Barr, Robin Johnson, and Megan Nordle, local historian Mitch Waxman, the North Brooklyn Boat Club, Broadway Stages, friends in the neighborhood like Evelyn Matuszak, Heather Letzkus, and Rami Metal and of course our own braintrust at Moviehouse.

Moviehouse is an interactive video project led by director Chris Henderson that creates site-specific work in alternative locations. Our main purpose is to connect audiences and artists with impactful and relevant experiences that push video out of two-dimensional space.

story:
Hi! My name is Alicia Obermeyer, and I am a professional artist. I make work from found materials, inspired by jerry-rigged contraptions (see artist statement). My current body of work is a series of experiments with the visual qualities of household items. I have exhibited extensively in the Midwest, and my work is included in several permanent collections.

After moving to Chicago in 2012, I established a relationship with Art on Armitage, a gallery that annually participates in an independent art fair in Stockholm, Sweden. This year, I was invited to exhibit as one of the artists representing the gallery, it will be my first international show! It is very important that I be present to talk about my work with artists and patrons of the art fair. As an installation artist, it is my responsibility to show my work and talk about how it might function in other spaces.

The Supermarket Art Fair is an alternative to commercial art fairs.  It is an international exchange between artists and artist-run spaces from more than 35 countries. Your contribution will help put my artwork in dialogue with an international community!

So, you are probably
wondering:


Where is the money

going?


  • Participation fee: $200

  • Airfare: $850

  • Lodging: $250(one week)
If the goal is not reached, I will use any contributions to cover these expenses. If my goal is exceeded, I will use additional funds for future national/international exhibitions.

 

What do I get?

 

  • $10-Your name will be listed in a thank you drawing made in Stockholm

  • $25- A limited edition print

  • $100- A tree planted in your name


  • $500-an original watercolor


If you're like me and don't have money, you can still help! Share my campaign!

 

Why?

  • You will help an artist share her work with a global audience

  • You will support an artist that is socially and environmentally responsible

  • You will support an event that is focused on the artistic creation of new experiences
  • Read my artist statement, it tells you why I make art the way I do!

Artist Statement

I am interested in the innovative, yet humble process of Jerry-rigging. When I was 11, I locked myself in my room with my Walkman headphones and a piece of chewing gum. Not to sulk, although that would be a fair guess. The left speaker was out, and I took the whole thing apart and discovered that the wires were not making a good connection. I was accustomed to this kind of problem solving, growing up in a family of bohemian mechanical engineers. After twisting the wires together, I took a tiny piece of the chewing gum and coated the wires, keeping them somewhat held together. This patch worked for a good hour before it started crackling again, but I felt proud of my first Jerry-rig.

The process of taking something apart, reevaluating each individual component, and putting it all back is how I approach making installations.  My sculptures and installations are made of familiar, gently used materials. I use forms to play with the balance between chaos and control. Each assemblage is a humble tribute for our current era. 


Links:
http://aliciaobermeyer.com/
http://www.supermarketartfair.com/
http://artonarmitage.com/

story:
Volcano Highline at Burning Man

This project is being built by the Slackline Oasis crew.  We are a group of slackliners and highliners with the ambition to create a Highline between 2 Volcanos.  The Volcanos will be built out of Scaffolding, Guy-wires, and Burlap sacks from coffee bean bags.  We will be connecting the highline between the two volcanos to create Burning Mans First ever!

The intention is to provide a safe and spectacular interactive art that allows performers and amateurs alike to test their skills and face their fear on one of the most amazing balance tools, the Slackline!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need funds to purchase the scaffolding and guywires and the rental truck to bring it all out to Black Rock City, Nevada.  So far we have aquired most of what we need, but the rental vehicle (Uhaul Cargo Van) as well as renting the scaffolding will cost us about $1000.  We have realized that we need the support of the crowds to make this happen and we are turning to you guys!

So far we have 1 Volcano done (scaffolding, guy wires, burlap) and we are trying to build the second one to make the highline work.

If you help us support this project then you will be helping bring an amazing art project ot the playa and helping promote the sport of slacklining.  Please donate to this cause and in return, you will receive gratitude, thanks, and lots of love!!!  Also I will print some stickers and magnets and make a really cool video with all the slackline oasis crew and put your name in the video as being a contributor to making this project happen!!

 

Much Love from the Slackline Oasis crew!

 

Ray Marceau

Scott Rogers

Amber Taxiera

Logan Scholfield

Brian Mosbaugh

Andy Lewis

Hayley Ashburn

Kiel Kohler

Vince Turner

Molly Gaeb

Anya German

Brent Cain

Benjamin Cole

story:
Yangdaora Art Therapy Project for Children from Fukushima

  • The Yangdaora Project is about offering a residential art therapy retreat for Fukushima's children in Singapore, working in partnership with The Red Pencil Foundation. Based in Singapore, this humanitarian charity provides Art Therapy for children who are experiencing overwhelming situations, worldwide. 

  • Evacuation from the contaminated land is essential for those children to lead a healthy life, but many families are struggling to do so due to a lack of financial and emotional resources. Our long-term goal is to provide this retreat to as many Fukushima children as possible. We are determined to do so by involving the community in Fukushima and supporters around the world, throughout the project. By doing so, we can help connect Fukushima with the world and raise global awareness of this devastating situation. It is our hope that this will also help them to get enough support for relocation to a safe environment, before its too late. 

Benefit Art Auction by TODAY IS THE DAY Foundation

November 24, 2013 at the JANE Hotel, NYC   6:00 - 9:30pm

  • TODAY IS THE DAY Foundation is organizing a benefit to raise funds for the Yandaora Project. Everyone who contributes beyond $350 will be able to participate in the benefit auction on November 24, 2013 at The JANE Hotel in New York City. Even if you can't participate in the live auction, you can still bid on the auction online at Paddle8:
    http://paddle8.com/auctions/todayistheday

  • TODAY IS THE DAY is a visionary foundation based in Hiroshima, Japan, New York, and Singapore. Through a variety of artistic activities, TODAY IS THE DAY strives to instigate a new system of personal and collective thoughts and actions, which will gradually counteract phenomena that are harmful to the quality of life on earth. 

  • This year's benefit art auction will include works by: Luc Tuymans, Les Levine, Kiki Smith, Odili Odita, Henk Visch, Paul Pagk, Hye Rim Lee, Janine Gordon, Jean-Luc Vilmouth, Ben Buchanan, David Reed, Paul Pagk, and others.

Funds Raised will Cover:

  • Art Therapy sessions - to help release their stress and enhance their inner strength. 
  • Outdoor activities - to provide time to play outside without fear of radiation and offer educational opportunities to learn about nature, which has been forcefully disconnected from their lives. 
  • Cultural exchange events - with local children in Singapore, that can help them expand their perception and foster positive directions for their future. 
  • Memorable leisure outings - that they can enjoy and treasure for life. 
  • Home-staying with Japanese speaking residents in Singapore – to offer a homely experience whilst away from their own families. 
  • Online broadcasting opportunity - to report the children’s discoveries and progress during the retreat to their families, community and the world. 
  • Skill exchange and Networking opportunities for Art Therapists based in Singapore and Japan - to further develop its clinical excellence. 
  • Conference by an Internist and Head of Kosugi Medical Clinic, Dr. Junro Fuse to share expert knowledge about radiation issues to our health
  • Some of the administrative costs of running the program.

The Impact

  • Our partner, Kodomo Mirai Association will provide follow-up work once the children have returned to Japan. We are determined to provide a well-rounded package that can ensure the children’s well-being after the retreat. 

  • We are also planning to provide projects after the retreat, so that the children can keep embracing what they gained during the retreat. This includes exhibitions of their artwork based on their experience of the trip and continuous support on the friendship exchange with Singaporean children. 

  • Why Singapore? - Singapore is a country renowned for its safety, high standard of life and quality of medical treatment. Our primary concern during this retreat is the safety and well-being of the participating children. The country possesses a firm support network to welcome those Japanese children and offer a home like environment whilst they are abroad. Singapore also possesses a wide range of leisure facilities, all within easy access, that the children could treasure for life. There are many places that can offer outdoor activities and cultural and educational facilities.

Current Situation in Fukushima

  • On 11th March 2011 the most powerful earthquake ever recorded in Japan hit Fukushima. The earthquake triggered a devastating Tsunami (over 40.5m high) and swept away several towns and villages full of life, in a matter of few minutes. Over 15,883 people were reported to have lost their lives and 2,656 people are still missing. 

    The power of the Tsunami also destroyed the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power plants. This caused the release of highly toxic radiation into the air and sea, threatening the lives of people in Fukushima, especially children. Prolonged exposure to radiation can cause cancer and other life threatening conditions, such as Leukemia. Children are considerably more vulnerable to radiation exposure than adults. Reports show that Thyroid cancers amongst Fukushima children have already risen significantly*, with 44.2% reported to have Thyroid abnormality.** This number is only expected to increase as time progresses. 

    To minimize the risk of radiation exposure, children in Fukushima are not allowed to play outside. They carry radiation measures to check the level of radiation they have been exposed to everyday. The radiation has no boundaries. Contaminated food and drink can also harm their body from inside. Many children are now suffering from obesity due to lack of exercise. Others have been suffering from emotional and behavioral difficulties due to extreme stress. 

    *Russian Times 08.21.2013 
    ** The Tenth Report of Fukushima Prefecture Health Management Survey 02.13.2013


Thank you very much for your interest in The Yangdaora Project. 

Together we can make a life long difference for the children in Fukushima.

story:
Hello, in case you didn't watch the video well, I'll just write it down here, My credit card was stolen. The bank chargeback a few things and what not, but the most import thing was my steam account that had chargebacks from months before also adding up to 5,000 dollars. I know some of you are going to say "Its just a video game get over it". Well to me it means more than that, I've had depression for 5 years now and I use video games as a way to cope when life gets me. I'm hoping you kind people out there will help with rasing money!
I'm also going to try by working it off with commissions, The prices listed are the following.

All Commissions
1$ Sketch
3$ Avatar/Icon
5$ Inked
10$ coloured
15$ coloured w/background
25$ Wallpaper for your computer

I think these prices are fair, of course adding extra to a picture will cost more so contact me to discuss prices.

Please leave what you'll like in a comment here and I'll upload it when its done here too or add me for fast respones.

 


Here are links to some of my art

http://missvisaloser.tumblr.com/tagged/my%20art

http://speedninja2.deviantart.com/

Here is my contact info if you would like to talk to me.

Skype: speedninja2 <- I'm always on this

Email: speed.ninja@hotmail.com <-Only for messaging.


Paypal email: miss.v2@hotmail.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jamaica Osorio, and I am a world-renowned poet and activist from Honolulu, Hawaii. Upon graduating from Stanford University this July, I will be attempting to attend the Masters in Arts and Politics program at New York University, where I will start and complete a manuscript devoted to Hawaiian stories. My campaign is designed to get me to New York, where I will be able to continue developing as an artist.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I have decided that if I can raise half of the money I need to pay for my dream-program at NYU, I will attend in the fall. Without your donations, I will not be able to afford tuition, and will not be able to continue my work on the mainland.

All of the perks offered as rewards for your contributions are exclusive; featuring hand-written notes, brand-new poems, and revised edditions of old chapbooks. 

If I don't reach my full goal, Donors will have the option of recinding their sponsorship and the remaining funds will go towards paying off the student-loans I've already accumulated, and towards paying for tuition at the University of Hawai'i

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that some people just can’t contribute, but there are other ways to help out. Please take the time to spread the word about this project to family and friends. Sharing on Facebook and Twitter is greatly appreciated, and an awesome way to show your support!

 

More Information

Aloha My name is Jamaica Heolimeleikalani Osorio

Some of you know me as Mary and Jon’s Daughter

Some of you know me as your teammate, your classmate, or friend

Some of you know me as the grown up version of a 3 year old terror running and dancing throughout your church services

And maybe more of you know me as the internationally recognized poet/performer

I am coming to you today to invite you to be a part of a movement that will allow me to grow and transform from those things to become a masters student and future graduate from the Tisch School of the Arts and NYU. This past Winter I was accepted to Tisch based not only on my academic record and artistic excellence at Stanford University, but because of my commitment to engaging in dialogue and transformative artistic projects. Supporting this campaign will not only award you several artistic pieces and opportunities it will also enable me to study at  the program of my dreams in the one year Art Politics Masters program at Tisch .

The full cost of my program and expenses hovers around 70 K. Initially I wrote off the program and opportunity because of the steep cost and the unreasonable financial burden it would create. Recently, however, I have decided that if I find enough money to cover tuition (44K) I will follow my dreams and find a way to make it. I have applied to almost every scholarship I could find and am waiting to be notified. I was offered a 10K award with the invitation to Tisch. Any amount that you could share will help me make it the rest of the way. Even better, send this link and opportunity along to your friends to make your impact reach even further; it could make a huge difference.

In addition to supporting a young rising artist and academic donating to this campaign will provide you as the donor tangible benefits as well. Before I get into the specifics of what you will be funding and what benefits are being offered I would like to personally thank you for taking the time to even consider giving to this cause. It means the world to me.

In order to make this endeavor worth your while I have decided to compound two of my greatest interests into one project: Furthering myself as an artist scholar and exposing the power of Hawaiian literature. I have spent the last year researching and writing an honors thesis focused on the way a specific moÊ»olelo[1], HiÊ»iakaikapoliopele, was informative of a very specific female identity before missionary contact. Additionally the thesis examined the relationship between two female lovers and friends, HiÊ»iaka and HÅpoe, and the way their relationship seems to have been erased from the native and national consciousness. It is through that work that I have become increasingly interested in developing a manuscript of poems and stories written either through the voice of the two lovers or in honor of their story. Finally this art project will culminate in the publishing of the manuscript and the development of the script into a theatrical piece, likely a one or two woman show.

Depending on the amount of your contribution you could receive anything from my revised poetry chapbooks, new (previously unpublished) chapbooks, pieces of my upcoming manuscript, VIP tickets to a benefit concerts featuring myself, my father and other artists. The largest donations will afford the sponsor a voucher for free performances/concerts nearly anywhere in the world.  To learn more about these benefits scowl down and take a look at the panel on your right. In addition to these gifts you will gain the good fortune of supporting the dream of a young capable artist and academic in her search to expand her horizons and share Hawai’i’s story across the globe.

I am  deeply passionate about this project and the Tisch program because I believe it is the best way to strengthen the identity of my people by  returning to our traditional stories as representation of our tremendous strength, intelligence and creativity. So much of who we are has been lost in the way we have been turned away from our history and stories. I want to be a leader in a growing movement of artist/scholars who use traditional work and art to inspire their own contemporary art and activism.

I applied to Tisch’s Masters in Arts Politics program at NYU to provide myself a venue in which to create and collaborate with artists of different disciplines and to share this traditional story with artists and activists from around the world. Supporting this journey will allow me to attend Tisch and will support my work as I attempt to broaden my scholarly and artistic horizons. Additionally it is my most humble belief that supporting this artistic endeavor is also sustaining the long history of kanaka maoli (native Hawaiian) artists and scholars and will have a tremendous impact on the way we teach our children to preserve and value our stories in the future.

 

If you have any question please feel free to email me at jamaicaosorio@gmail.com

story:
ART SAVES PEOPLE IS COMING TO A CITY NEAR YOU!

ASP is going on the road! What does that mean exactly? It means that we've bought a van and are traveling to different art shows and helping with different art projects across the country all of August! We already have shows lined up in Philadelphia, PA and Orange County, CA with more in the works!  


What is Art Saves People?

Igniting the senses by capturing the essence of our human condition

"Art Saves People" was originally an idea that Lauren created her art by.  It has since become a network of creative individuals that have a common connection of art touching their lives in one form or another.

Art Saves People is the mission of creating art to express yourself without judgement or censorship and to find beauty in the complexities of the human condition and how we experience the world around us.  We all have a different story - Accept who you are and accept others.  We suffer when we don't accept things and when we can't relate to others.

We want to create art that can teach, relate, empower, move and free people.  This is where "Art Saves People" comes from.  Without darkness, there can be no distinction of light.  Exposing and observing artwork that encompasses emotion or experience can help others to empathize and enter a world that can be humbling.  It can help people to celebrate and explore different subcultures and lifestyles, and to gain depth and appreciation for one another.

Art can make you feel alive when you're feeling robotic by helping to reveal your feelings, desires, repulsions and your overall human condition.  

"Screaming my story, releasing emotions, healing my pain and escaping into a world where I am validated and free is a way in which I have chosen to live.  The most exceptional way to respect myself and honor this life is to create art.  Art saved my life.  Everyday, Art Saves People." - Lauren Koger

Why a road trip?

We decided to head out on the open road after hearing from people all over the country how they believe in what ASP stands for and is trying to accomplish. Countless individuals have reached out to our founder Lauren Koger, and the rest of the ASP staff, to share their stories of how art has changed their lives and perception of the world around them, and we want to hear more of those stories! This is an opportunity to not only hear the stories and share art with those that have been blessed enough to be inspired by it and helped through it, but also to hopefully bring art to someone who hasn't had access to it before or maybe just to change one persons perception of it through our mission.

We need as much help as possible!

A road trip these days is unbelievably expensive, not to mention art is expensive on it's own, so we need some help!

  • All funds will be used toward gas, tolls, road expenses, and all new materials to continue to create art and do what we normally do!
  • We're forever needing new materials!  If you can't donate funds, but have some canvases, old art supplies, hanging wire(anything really) we'll take it!!!! We use so many materials for one show or one project we're always needing more.
  • Time is also always appreciated! We are going to need a lot of help on the road with packing up vehicles, helping at different art shows, giving us a place to stay, or just a simple tour of a town, we need it all!
If you have any materials to donate or would like to attend one of the shows, or help out in any way, please contact us!  Email artsavespeopleteam@gmail.com or visit  ArtSavesPeople.com to shoot us a msg on our contact page.

Not only do we share our work, but we want to share yours too!

Here at Art Saves People, one of our main missions is to get artwork out to touch more peoples lives, and this doesn't include just our own work. We have a brothers and sisters artist page where different artists from all over the world, with all different types of mediums, come to display their portfolios and embrace one another and their work! We will gladly display yours as well! Please visit our ASP Brothers & Sister Artist Page for more information.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Donate your time!  We always need extra help for events and photo shoots
  • Purchase a ticket for either one of our upcoming RAW shows in either Philadelphia 7/23, or Orange County 8/14.
  • Invite your friends to Join and Like our Facebook Pages
Regardless if you can help in any other way, we need EVERYONE to just spread the word about ASP; Like our facebook, tell your friends, share our website, share our stories, join the movement!

We work very hard to get our mission out there and are doing everything we can to accomplish it, because the fact is, it's what helped us and we want to help others. We are who we are today because of everything we've each been through, and art has been the one common denominator with a lot of us... it's a common connection that we all share as people and ASP just wants to continue to share that beauty and power with everyone around the country.

story:
I am thrilled to have the fantastic opportunity to exhibit my photographs at the French Consulate in San Francisco--the first time EVER that I will be able to share my photographs in public!

I moved to San Francisco from France two years ago and immediately fell in love with  the city, through the lens of my Canon. I aspire to make a living as a photographer--but at the moment I live on a student's budget to make ends meet and continue to live in this beautiful city.

In order to show my photographs in the exhibit, I have to pay to print and frame my photographs--which will cost about $700. If you can contribute even a tiny amount to make this exhibit possible for me to do, I would be incredibly grateful!

Thank you so much for your generosity!

Anne-Sophie

story:
WHAT DOES BEING PRETTY MEAN TO YOU?

Does it mean fitting in to a social order? Does it mean looking a certain way to please others – your friends, your family, perhaps even your partners?

Make-up was at one time considered a luxury commodity available only to the wealthy. Today, however, women have more products available to them than ever before, but increasingly less choice in how to wear it.

From billboards, commercials and consumer magazines, to all aspects of mainstream entertainment (films, music, even video games), we are all bombarded daily with rigid stereotypes of how women should look, without ever stopping to question where such narrow ideas come from and why we should conform to them.

PRETTY will be a solo exhibition made up of 14 mixed media artworks.

PRETTY WILL HAPPEN! This is your chance to become part of something that challenges assumptions, breaks down barriers, provoke debate and has the potential to really change things.

Art can make the world a better place and with PRETTY I want to inspire people to open up and start talking about how we as a society have created a world in where the way a women should look gets decided by everyone except the women herself.

Each of us can be pretty in any way we choose.

BUT

For that to happen and for this show to get the attention that it deserves, I am going to need YOUR HELP!

FUNDING BREAKDOWN

Gallery Hire:

I need £1800 for a 2 week hire of a prime gallery space in east London. The venue is part of a close-knit network of galleries, easily accessible, in an area of high footfall. This means PRETTY has the chance to be seen by a lot of people and that the show can really make a difference in shaping people’s views on what it means to be pretty.

Framing:

With each artwork comprising of mixed media I have been in negotiations with framers and for £700 I could get strong, decorative frames for each piece, along with high quality UV protective glass so that none of the detail is lost or the different mediums affected.

Marketing:

£2,500 will fund an advertising campaign on the London Underground, giving the show maximum exposure, as well as the printing of promotional material such as flyers, posters and large-scale banners for both the art exhibition and the performance night.

Transport:

I estimate I’ll need £115 for safe transportation of all 14 of the art works to and from the gallery space.

Fees:

I’ll need another £385 for a 4% fee payable to indiegogo for letting me use their platform as well as a third party 3% fee for Paypal.

So all together the amount I need to raise comes to £5,500.   


Since we all know you don’t get something for nothing, I have created a HUGE amount of perks for all of your support, ranging from a genuinely loving, HUGE Thank You, to limited edition prints, custom portraits, entry to the private view and performance night, all the way up to first pick of any one of the 14 exclusive artworks!

I am extremely excited and confident about this art show and the difference it can make, and promise I will do everything I can to make this show the best it can be, and will use every penny of funding to make this show a huge success!

So I hope you will support and share this campaign with as many people as you possibly can, because remember –  every little bit helps and I have just three months to make this show a reality!

Thank you for taking time to read this and I hope you will become a part of PRETTY!

Arcane Sin

story:
i recognize the sacred power in live performances; in that they have the potential to invite others into a world they may have not experienced before. ONION + BANANA JUICE is a journey through the 7 main energy centres [chakras] that you will experience through the performance of live music, live overhead projections, illustrations, colours, costumes, movements, textures and unspoken energetic languages. it's important to me that i acknowledge all the support i have around me in sharing space, creation + abundance with those i have chosen to work with leading up to this event because i recognize that such an experience involves much more than myself. your contributions will be supporting the importance in compensating 20+ artists who are involved and allow us to create this experience into it's full potential. 

 

 


 

    

$3,100.00 || band + dj + dancers compensation for rehearsals + performance

$348.00 || The Xove rehearsal space rental [10 rehearsals]

$600.00 || food + transportation for rehearsals

$150.00 || equipment rentals

$500.00-$700.00 || venue rental

$1400.00 || costumes + set design budget + artist fees

$850.00 || merchandise materials budget + artist fees

$800.00 || projector materials + artist fees

$300.00 || lighting + tech fees

$878.00 || documentation (video + photo) + editing fees

$950.00 || promotion budget + flyers + cards + campaign video + artist fees

 

 

besides the experience itself in August, being offered with any donation above $25 are perks that you will receive depending on the amount donated. each perk comes with a full download of 7 + bonus track. 

a full download of 7 to now carry with you + bonus live off the floor analog recording of "incense" performed by Dan McLay on upright bass, Bentzen Takyi on drums + my self on guitar, vocals.

:::

i've chosen 3 items i enjoy making by hand and that have been sown into my life that encourage [flow + processing + channelling] our experiences, feelings and creativity from within.

:::

honour spirit within during creative processes, in need of cleansing, protecting or to remain still. smoke is described as the communication between beings and spirit 

::: lavender for calm // sage for protection :::

 

process emotions + experiences through writing. write what you're grateful for, what you hate, what you love, what fuels your fire, what made you cry, what your last shroom trip offered you, these pages are yours.

::: blank // grid :::

 

"cry- when you hold in your tears, you drown your heart, when you cry, you water the earth" - [elder Willie Nolan comforting a sister] one thing i've learned the most in the creation of 7 is how important my tears were. my tears showed me how passionate, hurt and full of love i am and when i didn't allow myself to cry, i allowed myself to forget. water is healing. i honour all of the cry babies to cry, baby. made from the ramie plant, indigenous to Eastern Asia are these heart shaped leaves turned into the strongest natural fibre. does not rot or mold and is stronger when wet. hand embroidered "cry, baby" to remind you it's encouraged to feel what you feel and cry.

::: sand // earth // rose :::

 

 

+++ a fully produced cover of your choice will be offered to you for sharing your abundance of $205.00 or more. comment with your donation what song of any genre you'd like to hear my rendition of +++

 

financial abundance is something that has not always come easy for me to receive, to give. but it's something that i want to learn how to have a good relationship with. simply asking for the help of friends who are willing to put their time, talents and support into me and my visions is something that was hard to do at first because i felt i didn't have the money to have them involved. i have to be honest and let you know that these artists are more than willing to do this work just to simply support me. i want these same artists to know that i appreciate them as we can share our abundance together in spending time and working with each other. skipping out on compensation for artists is not something that i am willing to allow. too many curators drive their visions before paying respects to the artists involved in their plans. i recognize that i need to authentically give what i'd like to receive for my self- im wanting to end the idea that artists don't need to get paid. finding this abundance is not easy. the work is not easy. but i'm learning where i am powerful in doing the work, where i am already supported and where i need support. 

 

this idea will grow as it multiplies. sharing this campaign is already appreciated <3 if you know me and have a way of contacting me, words of encouragement mean a lot to me and as i take more action into this event, i know i will need such words. i also like back rubs. 

thank you for reading in on this vision i've been daydreaming about all while creating "7". all the daydreaming that has transformed into plans and now into action has me feeling excited to finally be here at this time and cycle. we've already started band rehearsals, plotting and gathering materials! all of your support will allow this process to flow leading up to ONION + BANANA JUICE. 

::: i trust all that needs to happen for my greater learning. i know i'm doing my best. i know i have the work ethic. i know this is my time to share. i know that i have the support and ability and resources to make this happen :::

thank you for reading my story + i'll see you in August!

love always

byi
story_txt:
i recognize the sacred power in live performances; in that they have the potential to invite others into a world they may have not experienced before. ONION + BANANA JUICE is a journey through the 7 main energy centres [chakras] that you will experience through the performance of live music, live overhead projections, illustrations, colours, costumes, movements, textures and unspoken energetic languages. it's important to me that i acknowledge all the support i have around me in sharing space, creation + abundance with those i have chosen to work with leading up to this event because i recognize that such an experience involves much more than myself. your contributions will be supporting the importance in compensating 20+ artists who are involved and allow us to create this experience into it's full potential. 

 



 


 
    
$3,100.00 || band + dj + dancers compensation for rehearsals + performance
$348.00 || The Xove rehearsal space rental [10 rehearsals]
$600.00 || food + transportation for rehearsals
$150.00 || equipment rentals
$500.00-$700.00 || venue rental
$1400.00 || costumes + set design budget + artist fees
$850.00 || merchandise materials budget + artist fees
$800.00 || projector materials + artist fees
$300.00 || lighting + tech fees
$878.00 || documentation (video + photo) + editing fees
$950.00 || promotion budget + flyers + cards + campaign video + artist fees
 



 

besides the experience itself in August, being offered with any donation above $25 are perks that you will receive depending on the amount donated. each perk comes with a full download of 7 + bonus track. 


a full download of 7 to now carry with you + bonus live off the floor analog recording of "incense" performed by Dan McLay on upright bass, Bentzen Takyi on drums + my self on guitar, vocals.
:::
i've chosen 3 items i enjoy making by hand and that have been sown into my life that encourage [flow + processing + channelling] our experiences, feelings and creativity from within.
:::


honour spirit within during creative processes, in need of cleansing, protecting or to remain still. smoke is described as the communication between beings and spirit 
::: lavender for calm // sage for protection :::
 


process emotions + experiences through writing. write what you're grateful for, what you hate, what you love, what fuels your fire, what made you cry, what your last shroom trip offered you, these pages are yours.
::: blank // grid :::
 


"cry- when you hold in your tears, you drown your heart, when you cry, you water the earth" - [elder Willie Nolan comforting a sister] one thing i've learned the most in the creation of 7 is how important my tears were. my tears showed me how passionate, hurt and full of love i am and when i didn't allow myself to cry, i allowed myself to forget. water is healing. i honour all of the cry babies to cry, baby. made from the ramie plant, indigenous to Eastern Asia are these heart shaped leaves turned into the strongest natural fibre. does not rot or mold and is stronger when wet. hand embroidered "cry, baby" to remind you it's encouraged to feel what you feel and cry.
::: sand // earth // rose :::

story:
What we will do:

Gabby Gilmore and Rachael Minott will be taking part in the Ghetto Biennale, KREYÒL, VODOU and the LAKOU: forms of resistance, in December. 

It is an exciting opportunity for us, as artists, to work in an international environment, greatly differing from our own. The highly successful concept of the Ghetto Biennale allows academic expansion for practicing Haitian artists and creates economic resilience for Haiti. In its fourth year the artists involved will be looking at how aspects of Haitian culture can be seen as tools of empowerment, and to ask our self: what can the world learn from Haiti?

We wish to hold a conference in the UK after the Biennale, during which, we will share what we have learnt from our experiences in Haiti and examine how this knowledge could be applied to Resilience funding in the UK heritage sector. This conference is a separate undertaking outside of the Ghetto Biennale as a means of reflecting on our experience.


Speakers would hopefully include:

Representatives from UK institutions currently receiving resilience funding

Participants in the Ghetto Biennale: past and current

Academic researchers and

UK funding body representatives.

 

The next steps

We need support! Artists who take part in the Ghetto Biennale are entirely self-funded - with no space in the programme to offer bursaries - and all artworks must be created on site.

We have submitted a proposal, which requires us to conduct research as well as build a large-scale installation on site, and therefore we will need to be in Haiti for approximately 16 days. This is not a holiday and we will be working, doing extremely physical jobs almost every day while on site.

Hosting a conference is also a rather expensive endeavour, and though we have been fortunate enough to receive great support we still have to pay for a number of things such as venue costs, speakers fees, promotional material, refreshments and documentation.

 

The £2000 we are trying to fund will not completely cover the costs of these activities and so we are also submitting official funding applications. But one of the most important aspects of a funding application is to show that there is support for our activity; that other people think it’s a good idea worth investing in!

 

In recognition of your support all donors will receive free updates on future project developments and  

donations of £50 will receive a hand made thank you card.

donations of £100 will receive a handmade thank you card and a small original work of art from either artist.

donations of £200 will receive a handmade thank you card and a small original work of art from both artists.

donations of £500 will receive a handmade thank you card, an original work of art from both artists, and personal updates on progress of Biennale from Haiti.

and donations of £1000 will receive a handmade thank you card, an original work of art from both artists, personal updates on progress of the Biennale from Haiti and personal acknowledgment of support in promotional material from the conference.

If you are unable to support finically but would like to help in some other way then please do contact us, we will be in need of volunteers to support us leading up to and during the conference in various roles.

Any help you can provide would mean the world to us, so,

Thank you for your support!

The next on my List are: 
Ako Tamaki - Netoge no yome wa Onnanoko ja nai to Omotta? 
D.Va - Overwatch
Momo Deviluke - To Love-Ru
Rei Miyamoto - Highschool of the Dead
Hakufu Sonsaku - Ikki Tousen
Morrigan Aensland - Darkstalkers

What you get?
Of course you get something if you supported me. There are Perks with Prints, Fansign, Videos and more!!! <3
For what is the money?
Its for the Cosplaysthat I will do. (Ako Tamaki, D.Va, Momo Deviluke, Rei Miyamoto, Hakufu Sonsaku, Morrigan Aensland etc.) 
Thanks~

story:
Giới thiệu về dự án

     When The Birds Fly Home là một dự án nhiếp ảnh kể chuyện với mục đích tìm hiểu về cuộc sống của các du học sinh Việt Nam sau khi về nước sinh sống và làm việc. Dự án bao gồm một triển lãm ảnh và một buổi toạ đàm nhằm trả lời những câu hỏi mà mỗi du học sinh Việt Nam, hay sinh viên quốc tế từ bất cứ nơi nào trên thế giới, đều trăn trở: Ở hay về? Nếu trở về, chúng ta sẽ thuộc về đâu? Tái hoà nhập khó khăn như thế nào? Liệu cái giá phải trả có xứng đáng hay không?

     Triển lãm sẽ trưng bày 35 bức ảnh và câu chuyện của 35 nhân vật là du học sinh đã về nước, đóng vai trò là một bức tranh toàn cảnh về chủ đề này. Còn buổi toạ đàm sẽ khai thác sâu hơn câu chuyện của 5 vị diễn giả là cựu du học sinh có tên tuổi trong nước để truyền cảm hứng cho những thế hệ sau. Sau khi triển lãm kết thúc, các bức ảnh và câu chuyện được thu thập trong suốt dự án sẽ được đăng tải trên trang Facebook chính thức của dự án để chạm được đến nhiều người hơn.


Mục đích

     Bằng cách khai thác và tập hợp những câu chuyện của các du học sinh hiện tại đã về nước sinh sống và làm việc, When The Birds Fly Home mong muốn đưa ra một góc nhìn chân thật và đa chiều xung quanh chủ đề này với hi vọng qua các câu chuyện, người tham dự sẽ:

1. Hiểu thêm về cuộc sống của những du học sinh trở về, gồm tất cả những niềm vui, nỗi buồn, khó khăn và định kiến trong quá trình tái hoà nhập.

2. Nhận được một thông điệp rằng mỗi người có một câu chuyện khác nhau, vì thế thay vì phán xét và rập khuôn nhau, chúng ta hãy học cách nhìn nhận mỗi người bằng một cái đầu cởi mở và một góc nhìn công bằng hơn.


Thời gian và Địa điểm tổ chức

Triển lãm ảnh 

➤  Khai mạc: 17h–19h ngày thứ Bảy, 16/07/2016

➤  Thời gian triển lãm: 8h–17h tất cả các ngày trong tuần, 17-30/07/2016

➤  Địa điểm: MAM Art Projects | Tầng 5, Bảo tàng Phụ Nữ Việt Nam, 36 Lý Thường Kiệt, Hà Nội

Tọa đàm 

➤  Thời gian: 2h-5h chiều ngày thứ Bảy, 23/07/2016

➤  Địa điểm: nest by AIA - Tầng 4, Vincom Toà B, 191 Bà Triệu, Hà Nội


Kinh phí

     Hiện tại, When The Birds Fly Home vẫn đang tìm kiếm sự hỗ trợ từ các công ty, tổ chức, cũng như phụ huynh và các bạn trẻ quan tâm tới dự án để trang trải những chi phí sau đây:

➤  In ấn: ảnh trưng bày triển lãm, photobook, zine

➤  Công tác chuẩn bị: chi phí đi lại, tiền thuê studio, máy chiếu

➤  Hậu cần: trang trí địa điểm triển lãm và tọa đàm, vận chuyển ảnh

 ➤  Truyền thông: các ấn phẩm truyền thông như poster, standee, brochure…

Đây sẽ là nguồn kinh phí để chúng tôi duy trì hoạt động và chuẩn bị cho các sự kiện quan trọng diễn ra trong tháng 7 tới.


Phương thức đóng góp

     Hệ thống gây quỹ của When The Birds Fly Home nhận ủng hộ qua trang Indiegogo này với hình thức sử dụng thẻ tín dụng/ATM và hệ thống Paypal.

     Bên cạnh đó, BTC cũng nhận chuyển khoản ngân hàng qua tài khoản chính thức sau:

Ngân hàng Vietcombank
Chủ tài khoản: Kiều Thúy An
Số tài khoản: 0451000298263
Chi nhánh Láng Hạ, Hà Nội

   

Các mốc đóng góp

➤   100,000VND: Email cảm ơn từ  BTC

➤   250,000VND: BTC sẽ gửi lời cảm ơn và nhắc đến tên bạn trên Facebook Page của dự án.

➤   500,000VND: Email cảm ơn và móc chìa khóa với logo của dự án.

➤   1,000,000VND: Email cảm ơn cùng với ảnh của bạn được BTC chụp theo concept của triển lãm.

➤   2,000,000VND:  Email cảm ơn và một quyển Photobook với những hình ảnh và câu chuyện của các nhân vật trưng bày trong triển lãm.

Bên cạnh đó, tên của tất cả những người đóng góp đều sẽ được nhắc tới với lời cảm ơn trong quyển Photobook của dự án.


Các câu hỏi thường gặp 

1.  Ai là người thực hiện dự án này?

Dự án When The Birds Fly Home được thực hiện bởi hơn 20 thành viên là học sinh, sinh viên đã và đang theo học tại khắp nơi trên thế giới, trong đó Trưởng BTC là Trần Khánh Linh, sinh viên năm ba ĐH Oberlin, Mỹ.

2.  Những nhân vật nào sẽ xuất hiện trong triển lãm?

35 nhân vật xuất hiện trong triển lãm không những từng du học ở nhiều nước khác nhau, mà còn có sự đa dạng về độ tuổi, góc nhìn và ngành nghề. Trong số các nhân vật, có những cái tên không hề xa lạ với chúng ta như Tiến sĩ và Tác giả Đặng Hoàng Giang, MC và Biên tập viên Diễm Quỳnh, Youtuber Huyme và D-Crown Nguyen. Hẹn gặp các bạn tại triển lãm và toạ đàm để lắng nghe câu chuyện của họ và những nhân vật đặc biệt khác nhé!

3.  Nếu dự án gây quỹ được nhiều hơn cần thiết, số tiền thừa sẽ được dùng vào việc gì?

Khi triển lãm và tọa đàm của When The Birds Fly Home kết thúc, số tiền thừa (nếu có) sẽ được sử dụng cho các hoạt động tiếp theo của dự án. BTC sẽ thông báo cụ thể tới các đơn vị và cá nhân đã tài trợ cho dự án để đảm bảo thông tin minh bạch.

4. Hệ thống Indiegogo vẫn còn xa lạ với mình. Mình cần làm gì để có thể ủng hộ tiền cho dự án tại đây?

Bạn có thể tham khảo  hướng dẫn chuyển khoản thông qua Indiegogo tại đây nhé ! 


Thông tin liên hệ     

     Mọi thắc mắc về mảng tài chính của dự án, xin vui lòng liên hệ: 

➤  Facebook page: www.facebook.com/wtbfh2016

➤  Hotline: 

    ⭐  098 170 6890   (Kiều Thúy An - câu hỏi về chuyển khoản ngân hàng) 

    ⭐  0165 826 6632 (Nghiêm Phương Hồng Ngọc - câu hỏi về chuyển khoản online thông qua Indiegogo)

     Các thông tin chi tiết hơn về When The Birds Fly Home sẽ được cập nhật thường xuyên trên trang Facebook. BTC hi vọng sẽ nhận được sự quan tâm và ủng hộ của toàn thể xã hội để tạo cơ hội cho các du học sinh về nước cất lên tiếng nói của mình. Hãy like và chia sẻ trang Facebook page của When The Birds Fly Home tới những người bạn của bạn nữa nhé!

Mục đích
     Bằng cách khai thác và tập hợp những câu chuyện
của các du học sinh hiện tại đã về nước sinh sống và làm việc, When
The
Birds Fly Home mong muốn đưa ra một góc nhìn chân thật và đa chiều xung
quanh chủ đề này với hi vọng qua các câu chuyện, người tham dự sẽ:
1. Hiểu thêm về cuộc sống của những du học sinh trở về, gồm tất cả những niềm vui, nỗi buồn, khó khăn và định kiến trong quá trình tái hoà nhập.
2. Nhận được một thông điệp rằng mỗi người có một câu chuyện khác nhau, vì thế thay vì phán xét và rập khuôn nhau, chúng ta hãy học cách nhìn nhận mỗi người bằng một cái đầu cởi mở và một góc nhìn công bằng hơn.
Thời gian và Địa điểm tổ chức
Triển
lãm ảnh ➤  Khai mạc: 17h–19h
ngày thứ Bảy, 16/07/2016➤  Thời gian triển lãm:
8h–17h tất cả các ngày trong tuần, 17-30/07/2016➤  Địa điểm: MAM Art Projects | Tầng 5, Bảo tàng Phụ Nữ Việt Nam, 36 Lý Thường Kiệt, Hà NộiTọa
đàm ➤  Thời gian: 2h-5h chiều ngày thứ Bảy, 23/07/2016➤  Địa điểm: nest by AIA
- Tầng 4, Vincom Toà B, 191 Bà Triệu, Hà NộiKinh phí     Hiện tại, When The Birds Fly Home vẫn đang tìm kiếm sự hỗ trợ từ các công
ty, tổ chức, cũng như phụ huynh và các bạn trẻ quan tâm tới dự án để trang trải
những chi phí sau đây:
➤  In ấn: ảnh trưng bày triển lãm, photobook,
zine 
➤  Công tác chuẩn bị: chi phí đi lại, tiền thuê
studio, máy chiếu
➤  Hậu cần: trang trí địa điểm triển lãm và tọa
đàm, vận chuyển ảnh ➤  Truyền thông: các ấn phẩm truyền thông như
poster, standee, brochure…
Đây sẽ là nguồn kinh
phí để chúng tôi duy trì hoạt động và chuẩn bị cho các sự kiện quan trọng diễn ra
trong tháng 7 tới. 
Phương thức đóng góp
     Hệ
thống gây quỹ của When The Birds Fly Home nhận ủng hộ
qua trang Indiegogo này với hình thức sử dụng thẻ tín dụng/ATM và hệ thống
Paypal.
     Bên cạnh đó, BTC cũng nhận chuyển khoản
ngân hàng qua tài khoản chính thức sau:Ngân hàng Vietcombank
Chủ tài khoản: Kiều Thúy AnSố tài khoản: 0451000298263
Chi nhánh Láng Hạ, Hà Nội

   
Các mốc đóng góp
➤   100,000VND: Email cảm ơn từ  BTC
➤   250,000VND: BTC sẽ gửi lời cảm ơn và nhắc đến tên bạn trên Facebook Page của dự án.
➤   500,000VND: Email cảm ơn và móc chìa khóa với logo của dự án.
➤   1,000,000VND: Email cảm ơn cùng với ảnh của bạn được BTC chụp theo concept của triển lãm.
➤   2,000,000VND:  Email cảm ơn và một quyển
Photobook với những hình ảnh và câu chuyện của các nhân vật trưng bày trong
triển lãm.
Bên cạnh đó, tên của tất cả những người đóng góp đều sẽ được nhắc tới với lời cảm ơn trong quyển Photobook của dự án.

Các câu hỏi thường gặp 
1.  Ai là người thực hiện dự án này?
Dự
án When
The Birds Fly Home được thực hiện bởi hơn 20 thành viên là học sinh,
sinh viên đã và đang theo học tại khắp nơi trên thế giới, trong đó Trưởng BTC
là Trần Khánh Linh, sinh viên năm ba ĐH Oberlin, Mỹ.
2.  Những nhân
vật nào sẽ xuất hiện trong triển lãm?
35 nhân vật xuất hiện
trong triển lãm không những từng du học ở nhiều nước khác nhau, mà còn có sự đa
dạng về độ tuổi, góc nhìn và ngành nghề. Trong số các nhân vật, có những cái tên không hề
xa lạ với chúng ta như Tiến sĩ và Tác giả Đặng Hoàng Giang, MC và Biên
tập viên Diễm Quỳnh, Youtuber Huyme và D-Crown Nguyen. Hẹn gặp các bạn
tại triển lãm và toạ đàm để lắng nghe câu chuyện của họ và những nhân vật đặc biệt khác nhé!
3.  Nếu dự án gây
quỹ được nhiều hơn cần thiết, số tiền thừa sẽ được dùng vào việc gì?
Khi triển lãm và tọa đàm của When The
Birds Fly Home kết thúc, số tiền thừa (nếu có) sẽ được sử dụng cho các
hoạt động tiếp theo của dự án. BTC sẽ thông báo cụ thể tới các đơn vị và cá nhân đã tài trợ cho dự án để đảm bảo thông tin minh bạch.

4. Hệ thống Indiegogo vẫn còn xa lạ với mình. Mình cần làm gì để có thể ủng hộ tiền cho dự án tại đây?
Bạn có thể tham khảo  hướng dẫn chuyển khoản thông qua Indiegogo tại đây nhé ! 


Thông tin liên hệ     

     Mọi thắc mắc về mảng tài chính của dự án, xin vui lòng liên
hệ: 
➤  Facebook page: www.facebook.com/wtbfh2016
➤  Hotline: 
    ⭐  098 170 6890   (Kiều Thúy An - câu hỏi về chuyển khoản ngân hàng) 
    ⭐  0165 826 6632 (Nghiêm Phương Hồng Ngọc - câu hỏi về chuyển khoản online thông qua Indiegogo)
     Các thông tin chi tiết
hơn về When The Birds Fly Home sẽ được cập nhật thường
xuyên trên trang Facebook. BTC hi vọng sẽ nhận được sự quan tâm và ủng hộ của
toàn thể xã hội để tạo cơ hội cho các du học sinh về nước cất lên tiếng nói của
mình. Hãy like và chia sẻ trang Facebook page của When The Birds
Fly Home tới những người bạn của bạn nữa nhé!

story:
A Cosmic Experience...

Imagine 8,000 watts of deep, permeating bass, moving through the entire body like a cosmic wave of sacred acoustics. Laying on the hammock of the Black Rock Bass Chair under the shade of a beautiful canopy, one begins to lose themselves to the sound....and the all-encompassing sensations.
Deep vibrations start off slow, and gradually increase in frequency as they move through the body, right through the internal structures we perceive to be solid. 
Something very magical happens in this state. As the body aligns itself with the frequency of the bass, the mind can join in, and a deep meditation takes place. The mind ceases its usual chatter and joins the rest of the body in this profound phonic experience. 
The theme here is heaviness; absolute gravity  in the auditory perception, taking us on a journey through black, dense places and emerging in the light, having created that extra space to share with the world. Participants will have their eyes covered in black cloth so they may fully merge into this deeply relaxing yet ascending experience. All efforts will be made to black out the outside world and allow the user to go to a more infantile, earthed state. 

How it's Built.

The Black Rock Bass Chair will be made with 8 subwoofers and 2 amplifiers to pound out massive amounts of deep bass. The frame is built out of strong wood and rope to hold participants as they lay just a few inches above the subwoofers. Bass will blast through the body, while participants lay on the rope. A controller will be changing the frequency.


It all started in Australia...

As most stories tend to be, the story of the Bass Chair is essentially... A love story. A love of what though?
((( )))
I first encountered the Bass Chair at a gathering in more or less remote Australia where a friend of mine had brought a curious device. Rattling on a trailer was a beast of wood and wiring and rumbling low bass frequencies. 
((( )))
The Bass Chair MK I!
((( )))
After being absolutely blown away by how it transported people from the present moment into a world of sound and vibration I decided that this gift must be brought to the denizens of Black Rock City. Now four years later and after many discussions with both the Father of BCMKI and my family at Burning Man, it is Time.
((( )))
I have attended 'that thing in the desert' for a some time now and finally am able to bring the Bass Chair MK II to the playa so that any and all may find themselves transported from the churning cacophony that is Burning Man into a world solely their own where nothing exists but the pure physical and aural vibrations of sound infinite.
((( )))
It is my hope that with your help, we can bring this amazing gift to Black Rock City where I believe it craves existence. 

But like so many before it... It moved on...
So, building one of these is an expensive affair. 
We need to buy amplifiers, two or more of them. We also need 8 speakers. 
Then there is the wire... The wood for the frame... The rope for the bodily support... The sound device... 
We are asking for $1111 USD to make this gift a reality for our brothers and, sisters, mothers and fathers and all the children that call BRC home once a year. 
We reckon it is going to exceed that number but feel it is a good figure to aim for to ease the financial burden on our already stretched treasury.
We also have some awesome gifts to give in return for your generosity should you choose to contribute... Please check them out!

And it never moved solely on it's own...

I never have seen this kind of thing before or since a few years ago and I have been very excited to gift it to Burning Man ever since. 
We will do our darndest to make it happen and your contributions will make our job so much easier, at least in financial terms. 
Many people accept that everything in life is a vibration of some sort. We aim to connect people closer to this fundament through sound by creating a sonic gateway to the infinite. Either that or we will have a great time watching people shake to the high heavens!

And the road was never smooth...

It isn't just a matter of money. We actually need to build this thing. This means that any number of things can surprise us along the way which is why we value your consideration to help us out. Say we need to buy more amplifiers at short notice? Or the frame needs redesigning? With financial burdens partially eased on this project, we will be able to more fully focus our energies into the realization of the Chair. 


But when was it ever?

Thank you so much for making it this far and we hope you can spare some of those hard earned dollars to help make our sonic fantastic come to life and spread healing connective frequencies through the trembling bodies of the burners out into the cool desert air...

story:
2 talented artists that have each come a long way to realise their dreams. Yet, here is another obstacle. We have managed , by miracle, to fund the trip of our lives, but there is no place for us to stay once we get there.

So, we think our talents are worth something, otherwise we would not have this opportunity. Now, we are asking for your support. Any help would be highly appreciated. Thank you! We hope you will enjoy following our journey.

story:
Maintain the Crane

Baltimoreans may be familiar with cranes rising into the downtown skyline, but the Baltimore Museum of Industry's 1942 whirley crane once stood above it all.

During World War II, this crane worked in Bethlehem Steel's Fairfield Shipyard, where close to 500 Liberty and Victory ships were built. After the war, it was moved to the Key Highway yard and used to repair ships for another four decades. "The Yards" employed 11,000 workers and was the largest ship repair facility in the United States until its closing in 1982.

Cranes at work in Bethlehem Steel's Key Highway Shipyard.

The former shipyard crane was donated to the Baltimore Museum of Industry in 1989 by Harborview Limited Partnerships then floated just a few hundred feet down the Harbor to its new home at the BMI.

Raising the cab atop the gantry in 1991.

Today, the crane is a local landmark for residents as well as travelers on Interstate 95. After 25 years standing sentinel at BMI, the crane is due for some restoration work.

The crane as seen today from the BMI campus.

We need your help to keep this piece of history standing tall!

We recently received a generous $50,000 challenge grant from the France-Merrick Foundation and your donation today will help us to reach our goal of a match for that grant.  

We have a plan to revitalize the crane and partners ready to get to work; we just need your support to be successful. Our $10,000 budget will support the work necessary for the first stage of restoration, and we've put together a great list of perks to say "Thank You."

Remember, every dollar you donate is very much appreciated and is also tax-deductible. If a financial contribution is difficult right now, you can still help by sharing this campaign with friends and family and encouraging them to donate and to spread the word.

What can your donation do?

Repair

This campaign's goal of $10,000 focuses on the nitty-gritty: the work needed to clean and secure the crane in preparation for painting.

Every $100 that is donated pays for the repair of one of the crane's 110 tons!

  • Structural Inspection  $3,500. Already underway, the report from this inspection will give us the specific steps needed for the continued preservation of the crane.
  • Guano Removal  $2,500. Pigeons have found their way into the cab, depositing years of guano inside. After cleaning, the cab of the crane will be closed to prevent further nesting.
  • Maintenance and Repairs  $4,000. We anticipate making repairs where time and weather have taken their toll, as with any outdoor object. The cab will be sealed to prevent future interior damage.
  • Total  $10,000.

While these amounts are, in some instances, estimates, the work is very real. In fact, we have already begun the inspection and repair process, as BMI is committed to the preservation of this last representative of 200 years of shipbuilding at the foot of Federal Hill.

Repaint

Even after we meet this goal, there is still plenty of work to do! The crane is over 100 feet tall, so there’s a lot of steel to clean and paint. The addition of paint, specialized equipment, and permits—as well as labor—make this the most expensive part of our project, with a tentative budget of $50,000.

If this campaign exceeds our $10,000 goal, additional donations will go towards the repainting stage of our renovation.

Refresh

Beyond just preservation, we want to revitalize the crane and have it once again be a strong presence in South Baltimore, reminding all who see it of the industrial past of our region. Our long-term plans for the crane include LED lighting and new signage and continued donations could help make this possible.

How will we show our thanks?

We have created some great perks, only available to our Indiegogo donors. Here are a few highlights:

$50 Donation - Tweet of Appreciation from @BMIatWork and your name added to our online Wall of Fame at www.thebmi.org AND a handwritten Thank You signed by BMI staff AND a print of the crane from our Archives, matted to fit an 8 by 10 inch frame (limited to just 200 reproductions).

$500 Donation - Tweet of Appreciation from @BMIatWork and your name added to our online Wall of Fame at www.thebmi.org AND an invitation for two to our Renovation Reception (date and time TBA) AND an invitation for two to a museum tour focused on your chosen gallery and led by one of our Senior Educators (date and time TBA).

$2,500 Donation - Tweet of Appreciation from @BMIatWork and your name added to our online Wall of Fame at www.thebmi.org AND an invitation for two to our Renovation Reception (date and time TBA) AND a Golden Ticket pass for three years of admission to all BMI fundraising events such as our March Bull & Oyster Roast, family-friendly Independence Day Celebration, and fall Crab Feast.

Any questions about the crane, this campaign, your donation, or perk details? Contact Melinda at mcane@thebmi.org

story:
Dicks For Donald

Hey guys, how’s it going? We’re just two really good friends living in suburban California, interested in satirizing Donald Trump’s presidential endeavors. Sure, we aren't 100% politically accurate, but all we want is an attempt at some sort of political humor at the expense of the craziest politician there has ever been. We really think Donald Trump is a dick, and that’s where this whole journey begins. Thanks in advance for reading!

Honestly, we think this whole Donald Trump thing is on a whole new level of ridiculousness, so one day we thought to ourselves, “Hey, how can we be as ridiculous as that dick?” Well, fast forward to this past weekend, and all of a sudden, now there’s #DicksForDonald. So here’s the gist of it. Basically we just want to be a pain in the ass to Mr. Donald Trump. The goal is simple, raise enough money to send a case of paper to Trump’s campaign headquarters. That’s 5000 sheets of paper with 5000 hand drawn dicks, on a trip from SF to NY and directly into the mailing room of the Trump Tower in Manhattan. We simply love the idea of being able to even just bother Donald in the slightest bit. And hey, with enough of your help we might be able to start a small movement or something.

The magnitude of this operation is nothing more than the complete satisfaction of being able to potentially send Donald Trump a distraction when he least needs it. The race is nearing the finish line, so let's make something happen! I promise we’ll all get a pretty good laugh out of this if it all works out according to plan.

The needs here are basic. All we need one case of paper, a couple of pens and pencils, a bit of time, and a trip to the nearest post office. Your generous donations will help feed the drive of #DicksForDonald. Without your donations, we wouldn’t have enough money to order pizza every night at 1 a.m. while we draw Dicks for Donald. We think the the small but generous donation of $2 is definitely worth a good laugh and the satisfaction of potentially pissing Donald off, don’t you?. Like we said, we thank you in advance.

The minimal impact of this campaign is a big laugh and a complete feeling of satisfaction. Pretty great, right?  But to be honest, the possibilities are endless. If #DicksForDonalds gets enough traction on the web, we can do much much more. So please donate and please share! 

To add to all the greatness of Dicks For Donald, there is also absolutely no risk here. All you have to do is donate $2 and just sit back and watch the #DicksForDonald campaign take flight. Remember to follow us on Facebook for daily highlights!

Lastly, if you can’t contribute, we understand. Trust us we’re broke too so we feel you. But if you could just take the time share this campaign if it made you laugh, we’d very deeply appreciate it. It’s easy, just click the Indiegogo share tools on your screen and help spread the word. Thank you!

#DicksForDonald
story_txt: Dicks For DonaldHey guys, how’s it going? We’re just two really good friends living in suburban California, interested in satirizing Donald Trump’s presidential endeavors. Sure, we aren't 100% politically accurate, but all we want is an attempt at some sort of political humor at the expense of the craziest politician there has ever been. We really think Donald Trump is a dick, and that’s where this whole journey begins. Thanks in advance for reading!Honestly, we think this whole Donald Trump thing is on a whole new level of ridiculousness, so one day we thought to ourselves, “Hey, how can we be as ridiculous as that dick?” Well, fast forward to this past weekend, and all of a sudden, now there’s #DicksForDonald. So here’s the gist of it. Basically we just want to be a pain in the ass to Mr. Donald Trump. The goal is simple, raise enough money to send a case of paper to Trump’s campaign headquarters. That’s 5000 sheets of paper with 5000 hand drawn dicks, on a trip from SF to NY and directly into the mailing room of the Trump Tower in Manhattan. We simply love the idea of being able to even just bother Donald in the slightest bit. And hey, with enough of your help we might be able to start a small movement or something.The magnitude of this operation is nothing more than the complete satisfaction of being able to potentially send Donald Trump a distraction when he least needs it. The race is nearing the finish line, so let's make something happen! I promise we’ll all get a pretty good laugh out of this if it all works out according to plan.The needs here are basic. Thank you!#DicksForDonald

story:
phin: the exquisite riot

Phin is a company of creators.  We're based in Halifax, Canada, and we create multi-disciplinary performance works that inspire the imaginations of our audience.  Our works have been called "brave", "dynamic and compelling", "touching, subtle, and at times comedic", and have even prompted the statement "Conservationists take note: If you want people to listen, partner with an artist".  Yay!

We want to have even greater impact in our community, and abroad.

Our new creation will premiere in October 2013 at the Sir James Dunn Theatre, Halifax, as part of Live Art Dance Productions' brilliant 2013/14 season.  We've got the bones of it created in the studio but we need your help to bring it to the stage.  We've done a full-scale production like this before and have learned that to make it great we have to spend a good amount of time in the theatre before showing it to an audience.  So, we're finishing this new work during a 9-day residency in the Dunn Theatre where we will experiment with the lighting, sets, sounds, and movement to get the integration just right and make the October performance amazing.  Our goal is to have a fantastic show for our Halifax audience -- so good that people across Canada will want to see it!  Cross-Canada tour here we come.

This residency will cost $30,150.  We have support from the Canada Council for the Arts, Live Art Dance Productions, Arts Nova Scotia, and our current donors, but we still need to raise at least $4500 to fulfil the project.  Your donations will help us pay for the theatre rental.  For every additional $150 raised beyond our target, we'll be able to bring our lighting designer, set designer, composer, or musicians into the theatre one day earlier.  Now THAT would be really fantastic!

And you will get some pretty exciting rewards for your contributions!  We're pleased as punch to offer you a chance to have art created from your very own ideas and inspirations!

With your generous donation, you will be contributing to an up-and-coming organization with incredible potential to offer our community something positive, inspiring, and beautiful in the form of contemporary dance and multi-disciplinary performance work.

Whether you wish to donate or not, please spread the word about our campaign to your friends and help us reach our goal of reaching YOU with our work!

Thank you,

Lisa, Ardath, Peter and Sarah

www.phin.ca

 

Phin is a company of artists – a choreographer, a dancer, a poet and a visual artist.

Our rewards reflect the diversity of our artistic practice. Your choice reflects YOU!

story:
Short Summary

Coming June 5 - June 7, 2015 is the first annual Shasta Yoga Fest in Mount Shasta, California. Produced by the Shasta Yoga Institute and Shasta Yoga Fest founder Amy Cooper, this campaign to raise awareness and funds is motivated by a passion to increase economic vibrancy and cultural diversity to our local community as well as to unite yogis and those interested in the yogic and expressive arts, to come to Mount Shasta for an integrated, expansive learning experience.

Through its annual festival, the Shasta Yoga Fest will bridge communities and join together devotional artists, yoga teachers, audiences and scholars from around the nation to share meaningful experiences, engage conversations, open personal boundaries and enjoy the pure beauty of Mount Shasta through artistic and spiritual discovery and renewal.

Nationally known artists, musicians, and yoga instructors will be participating from   Los Angeles, San Fransisco Bay Area, Arcata up to Seattle, as well as from Pennsylvania and Chicago; all bringing their honed skills and passions to this weekend event.

This festival will also promote opportunities for less-known teachers and artists to be exposed to a larger audience and receive recognition and support for their potential.

See our Music line-up and yoga class schedule: www.shastayogafest.com

Our Campaign

This campaign is important because the financial support will help us with our initial start up costs and set a solid operating foundation for an annual event.

We came up with the idea with only two and a half months to plan, market and implement before the festival start date; therefore ticket sales are just beginning.

Thus far, we have sponsors within our local community from our participating venues: the Shasta Yoga Institute, BerryVale Natural Grocery, Shasta Base Camp and Mount Shasta Quantum Healing Center.

Contributions will assure that our first year start up expenses will be covered. This will enable us to build upon a sound base and plan for future years with more experience and time behind us.

A Yoga festival provides a place to immerse oneself in body, mind and heart, and relax and rejuvenate, devote, connect and expand, have fun and just be. It is an important reminder that we are not islands unto ourselves. Connecting with like-minded people serves a human need that is within us all. The more people practicing yoga, the better off this planet will be!

What We Need

100% of this years proceeds will go directly to operating and start up costs for this year. Any profits will be seed money for 2016.

Already Donated

-Venue use from Shasta Yoga Institute, BerryVale Natural Grocery, Shasta Base Camp and Mount Shasta Quantum Healing Center.
-Local artists & teachers are donating 100% of their time and services.

Breakdown of Costs 

Performers and Instructors: $20,000.
Webpage development: $3,500.
Marketing/Advertising: $2,000.

Security, Safety and Sanitary needs: $ 2,000.

Tent Rental: $1,500.
Insurance & permit Fees: $1,000.
Ticketing: $500.

Clean up: $500.

Total: $ 31,000.

We are campaigning for $20,000. and hoping for ticket sales to cover the remaining.

Amy Cooper, founder of the Shasta Yoga Fest and founding and executive director of the Shasta Yoga Institute, has successfully created a healthy, thriving yoga community in Mount Shasta since 2003. The Shasta Yoga Institute offers yearly Yoga Teacher and Advanced Studies Training programs and serves as a resource center for individuals to be empowered and interested in their physical, mental and spiritual well-being through providing community classes, college curriculum, therapeutic courses, advanced trainings and various expressive arts programs.  See www.shastayogainstitute.com

Thank you, in advance for your financial contributions that will allow the vision of the Shasta Yoga Fest to grow from a seed, to a bud and then blossom into the most fragrant and beautiful of flowers.
"We are very grateful for all of our sponsors and funding supporters. We hope to see you at the Shasta Yoga Fest! "
        --Shasta Yoga Institute Director, Amy Cooper

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funds, you can:

  • Help get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • You can share with friends and through your social media! Thanks!

story:
My name is Gilbert Bernal

I am an artist and film maker from San Fernando California. I have started this campaign to gain your support for art and education. On April 17th and April 25th I plan to conduct an art workshop at Canyon High School and then at the 2015 Summer Meltdown for the Yes I Can organization. The workshop on the 3rd will take place at Canyon High School exclusively for the Yes I Can students to instruct them in my methods of creating "Cigar Box Portraits". To provide a real and fulfilling experience for the students I would like obtain the right materials. The Yes I Can organization has already supplied the basic materials for the workshop. I am asking you the community and supporters of art to help with the remaining materials that will raise the bar for this workshop experience. The cigar boxes which I use as a canvas cost between 3 to 5 dollars and the markers needed for blending cost 5 dollars each. The workshop will service 70 students which deserve to take home their own creation and keep. In order to make this happen I estimate the cost to be approximately 500 dollars for each student to participate. The workshop will take place with or without money, we have done it before. I just feel that for the level of support YES I CAN provides for artist like me the students should get back the energy they put out to the community.

Along with the workshop for the Yes I Can students I will be participating with several artist and performers at the 2015 Summer Meltdown. Any additional funds will go towards my display at the Summer Meltdown that will include an interaction for the festival goers. My booth will contain my art work on display and the "Wall of Support" that will honor the people that donated. The more funds available the better the experience I can provide for everyone. Any funds acquired after I reach the first goal of $500 to conduct the workshop, will go towards the Summer Meltdown display.

Thank you for your support

Sincerely

Gilbert Bernal
