story:
Help kids by bringing Circus Arts to Seattle’s youth!

Many of Seattle’s kids do not have anywhere to go this summer. Due to lack of ability to pay, and/or lack of a positive and productive environment during summertime many kids do not have access to unique artistic opportunities that could enrich their lives.  We all know the trouble that can happen to kids who are idle during the summer.  

Our solution: Circus Camp!

To enlighten and inspire kids we have taken many kids to trips to the famous Cirque du Soleil in the past (see here). We love circus arts. We feel the circus is a great fun way to inspire creativity in kids.  Now in partnership with the City of Seattle’s Parks and Recreation, we want to teach kids circus arts this summer.

But to pull this off successfully we need your help!

My goal is to help kids discover the creativity and gifting they have within so they can learn to express their individual artist and become confident creators.  I believe poverty can be overcome as individuals comes to discover their gifting and learn how to create and share from who they really are.


Our Circus Arts program, which will last about 2 months, will include lessons in juggling, tumbling, hula hoop tricks, clowning, drama, and academics. We have a powerful opportunity to reach many young people in need (1400+) through our partnership with Seattle Parks & Recreation's Arts in the Park program, the Summer Sack Lunch Program, and the Shunpike Arts Collective (our fiscal sponsor!)  It will take place in Judkin's Park in Central Seattle.  Please be a part of it.

How you can help:

Please consider making a cash donation.  

Your contribution will:

  1. Give kids and teens the opportunity to be exposed to unique and positive circus arts, fitness, academics, and healthy eating during out-of-school time.

  2. Create community, better neighborhoods, and positive involvement for children and families.

  3. Help us afford the equipment and supplies we want for the camp.

  4. Help us effectively promote the camp to kids.

  5. Help support the circus arts professionals and trainers who will offer their time and expertise to the young people.

 

 

The Bad News: If we don’t raise the entire amount, we will not be able to create the look and feel of the circus that we want for the kids.  We will also have to cut corners by getting less equipment, and paying our staff next to nothing.  Most of whom can’t afford to spend 2 months working for free.  But let's not think about that. Instead let's focus on...
 

The Good News:  For your generosity, the kids in Seattle say thanks--and they’re so cute, and eager to participate in whatever we offer, and appreciative.  (If I had permission to film them, you would see.  One little boy was so excited today that he wanted to run home with the juggling balls to show his mother!)  And we send you a million thanks too!

We have tried to come up with some unique circus-themed collectibles from our friends at Cirque du Soleil in return for your gifts of kindness.  Choose a perk on the right->

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • TELL YOUR FRIENDS!  Please forward this via email, Facebook and Twitter to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!  You can do it right here on Indiegogo! Let's go viral!

     

  • Donate circus related equipment and supplies.  We still need: Any and all art supplies, circus style hats, costumes and decorations.  Tumbling mats.  Did I say tumbling mats!  Teachers of tumbling, juggling, hula hooping and any other circus related arts.  Snacks!

 

About Roxann Drake:  As a coordinator of arts programs for at-risk youth for over 6 years, I have worked with at-risk teens and children in the areas of film, fitness, academics, and trips to inspiring artistic events such as Cirque du Soleil.  

 

About Dream Power Camps:  Dream Power Camps is a project of the Dream Power Foundation whose mission is to inspire kids and adults with art and creativity.  See our page for more.

 

Rewards and Perks:

 

$10 Entree Level - Help 1 kid go to camp!

We get it! You don't need a perk and you just want to help out. Thank you so much, from the bottom of our hearts!  

 

 

 

$25 Pantomime Level - Help three kids go to camp!

You just made our day! We would like to send you

an old-fashioned thank you - handwritten cards designed and signed by the kids.

 

 

 


$50 Trapeze level - Help seven kids go to camp!

Tax-deductible! In gratitude for your kind gift, please receive via Cirque du Soleil, a cool Black Zarkana Cap

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

$100 Acrobat Level - Help 15 kids go to camp!

Tax-deductible!  Please accept our thanks with a gift via Cirque du Soleil, a Cirque du Soleil - Best Of 20th edition CD: Consists of musical highlights from Cirque du Soleil. This compilation features 12 songs from the successful soundtracks of eight Cirque du Soleil shows that are still active somewhere around the world!

$250 Chapiteau Level - Help 37 kids go to camp!

Tax-deductible! Thank you for being with us! Please accept as a token of our gratitude via Cirque du Soleil, a Cirque du Soleil – Acrobat Mug: Set of 2 mugs. Tumbler: 16 oz. - top stackable mug: 12 oz., with lid. 100% ceramic stoneware. Dimensions (in.): 8 x 3.5

 

 

 

$500  Ring Master Level - Help 75 kids go to camp!

Tax-deductible! To thank you for your amazing gift you will receive, via Cirqu du Soleil, a Calamari Peruvian wool hat:  Size :9.8x9.8x2 Materials :100% wool (corriedale & Merino)

 

 

 

$1000 High Wire Level - Help 150 kids go to camp!
Tax-deductible!  You are really making dreams come true! As a thank you, you will receive via Cirqu du Soleil, a Corteo deluxe print by Ricardo Cavolo:  Ricardo Cavolo fell in love with every character in Corteo from Cirque du Soleil, and he's presenting most of them in this artwork. Cavolo wanted to tell a main story with thousands of little stories inside the angel's dress in millions of colors. A 8-color, hand-pulled screen print on 100% cotton Maidstone 320 gsm. Signed and numbered on 50.
Paper size: 24" x 36".

 

SPONSORS:

story:
Hi There!

My name is Phil Servita, and I build things. I also like elephants, and I've been known to attend Burning Man now and then. In my eveyday life I do custom fabrication, much of which is tailored for the circus industry. Aside from this, Art Cars provide a wonderfully surreal addition to the Black Rock Desert during the event.

Clearly, all of these things must be combined.

The Playa, and Burning Man, need more elephants. Elephants that are OK with people sitting inside their brightly lit and optically pulsating bellies, while jungle sounds, music strangely overcome with tubas (because tubas imply elephants, don't they?), audio collages probably best to not play in the workplace, calming sounds of nature, and occasionally not-so-calming sounds of nature, like that tiger over there that's currently taking out a gazelle for lunch.

The Elephant In The Room may say things everyone knows to be true but wished weren't said.

 

 

Now, in addition to the task of fabrication, bringing an Art Car to Burning Man is a logistical challenge in an of itself. This is where the engineering aspect of the project comes into play. This Elephant Art Car will not only provide surrealist entertainment wherever it wanders but it is designed in such a way such that transporting it can be handled by a single human being. No large crews of 15 people trying to push it up shaky ramps onto a shipping container. This project will completely break down into pieces small enough to be handled by one person, and be easily assembled at Burning Man or any other destination. Space wise, the goal is for the entire art car to be able to be collapsed into the space of a single Boston Burning Truck share. This, for non Boston Burning Man people, is only 100 cubic feet. All parts of the locomotive frame are modular, and being fabricated from scratch, in order to produce a modular  "Art Car Construction Kit"; different engines, front ends, rear ends, etc will be able to be interfaced with the parts made for the Elephant, to produce other kinetic art in the future. The Elephant In The Room is the prototype - the first such piece in the series.


The Elephant In The Room - Burning Man Art Car 2013 Requirements

Building the Elephant will require a fair bill of materials. Your contributions will help defray the costs of the following:

  • Structural Materials - lots of 6061-T6 aluminum tubing and other hardware
  • 208VAC Three-Phase Motors and Variable Frequency Drives
  • LOTS (A kilowatt or more worth) of computer controllable LED lighting
  • power and control hardware for above LED lighting
  • fiberglass rod and semi-transparent fabric
  • Honda EU2000i or equivalent inverter generator
  • transport logistics to ship to the Playa


Progress videos and images will be posted occasionally in the Gallery. First Test Ride of the motive platform is up!

Spread The Word Far And Wide! The Elephant In The Room will be Stomping at Burning Man 2013 - Help Make It Happen!

Thanks For Watching and Reading!

                                                  -Phil Servita

                                                    Elephant Handler At Large

fiberglass rod and semi-transparent fabric
Honda EU2000i or equivalent inverter generator
transport logistics to ship to the Playa

Progress videos and images will be posted occasionally in the Gallery. First Test Ride of the motive platform is up!
Spread The Word Far And Wide! The Elephant In The Room will be Stomping at Burning Man 2013 - Help Make It Happen! 
Thanks For Watching and Reading! 
                                                  -Phil Servita
                                                    Elephant Handler At Large

story:
Our Story           

We are a group of 13 UK artists who have been invited by FLAG STOP, an alternative contemporary art event in LA, to prepare a special exhibition for this landmark event - bringing some of the UK’s most ambitious, emerging artists to LA.

We will exhibit in the London Art Box (or ‘LAB’), a London ‘micro-gallery’ at FLAG STOP. The LAB isn’t your typical tea party gathering - we will be staging impromptu discussions, creating a dialogue about contemporary art, regularly re-arranging the exhibition and inviting visitors to help curate the space. We really want this to be an interactive, engaging, learning experience for visitors.

We are all associated with London’s Debut Contemporary, a unique mentoring & exhibiting platform for emerging artists, who we will be representing at the event.

 

The Impact

This is a very exciting and potentially career expanding opportunity for all the artists that have been selected, and will enable us to help raise support for FLAG STOP’s charitable beneficiary, Switzer Learning Center, a special education school and treatment program. Your contributions, big or small, will be helping on many levels.

We are not just shipping work to LA – we are providing an interactive, performative presence. We will be turning heads! In order to achieve this we are aiming for as many of us as possible to travel to the show.

 

What We Need & What We Have For You!

We would love for you to help make this possible - and as we are an extremely talented bunch of lovely artists we have some incredible "perks" to let you know grateful we are for your help!

 

The artists have kindly donated some stunning art pieces which can be yours if you contribute to this campaign. These artworks are usually at least twice the ‘contribution price’ listed here, so this is really an incredible opportunity to get some original artworks for a fraction of the price – a very rare opportunity with this calibre of artist, and it is only possible for the duration of this campaign. (Any works not claimed will be returning to their original price). More details below.

 

The closer you help us get to our funding target of $10000 the more of us will actually be able to get over there and give a taste of British live art to this awesome LA event as well as showcase the artwork we have produced. 

 

Details: What we need

 

$10000 will make this happen by funding:

 

- Crates constructed to ship artwork to LA

- Shipping costs both to LA and back again for the artwork

- Insurance of artwork in transit and during the event

- Flights to LA 

- Basic accommodation whilst in LA

 

Details:  What we have for you

 

Firstly we are offering artwork postcards signed by the artists. 50 of each design will be created to make up this exclusive collection.

 

Now that's pretty good in itself but we have a really incredible opportunity for you as well: All the artists are offering original works of art! This is a fantastic chance to own artwork from these successful emerging artists –  each very talented and collectable. Currently exhibiting in London and represented by Notting Hill based gallery Debut Contemporary, we have all successfully shown in other locations as well.

A few of the places we have exhibited: The Venice Biennale (Chantal Powell), Tate Britain (Akleriah), Tate Modern (Nicola Anthony), Salzburg (Twinkle Troughton) and Poland (Kimi Wylde). Collectors of their work are in many countries and include Banksy and Bill Woodrow (Tinsel Edwards). They have worked with clients such as Jerry Lewis and Groove Armada (Katrina James) and have had work auctioned by high profile Christies auctioneer Hugh Edmeades. 

 

This is a wonderful way to get a piece of collectable contemporary art whilst supporting the artists in furthering their careers! Its not just a donation to us, it's also an art investment for you!

 

The Artists

As a group artists, our unique practices are diverse - including painters, photographers, artists working in the 3 dimensional arena and performance artists. You can find out more about our individual artwork by looking at the profiles in the "team" section. You will also find links there to our personal websites showing full portfolios of our work. We will also be posting many images in the gallery section of this site so keep looking!

 

 

Spread the Word

Thank you for taking time to read this and if you have been inspired to make a donation then an even bigger thank you to you! You are truly wonderful!

Please spread the word about this campaign by using the sharing links below or emailing it to friends and colleagues. 




--Background Information--

 

FLAG STOP

an alternative contemporary art event

 

Torrance, CA –  FLAG STOP is pleased to announce An Alternative Contemporary Art Event which presents art in unique, unconventional places. The goal of FLAG STOP is to give local art communities and the art world at large a chance to see and experience art where previously not thought possible. Torrance is a community where many local contemporary artists live and work, but is not currently known as an arts destination. FLAG STOP is creating the opportunity for curators, established artists, emerging artists, and local businesses to rethink the possibilities of exhibiting art within the context of a local community. South Bay Lexus in Torrance will be the first stop to present this unique art experience. The event will be held on September 2, 3, & 4, 2011 and is free and open to the public.

 

Mission:

FLAG STOP’s mission is to present new and emerging contemporary art to a larger audience outside the main stream art venues. FLAG STOP is searching for alternative venues in which to present the best curated examples of what, why, and how art is becoming relevant today. Each “STOP” will feature art which has been curated with some of the best examples of contemporary art, brought to you by some of the top professional, emerging curators and artists from Southern California.

 

About FLAG STOP:

FLAG STOP’s committee is a group of South Bay art supporters, promoters, artists, designers, curators, collectors, local businesses and art enthusiasts, working to establish a new destination opportunity to experience local and international contemporary art. FLAG STOP is creating the opportunity for communities to rethink the possibilities of exhibiting art.

 

www.FlagStopArt.com          www.facebook.com/FlagStopArt




DEBUT CONTEMPORARY


DEBUT CONTEMPORARY IS AN INNOVATIVE PLATFORM AIMED AT TALENTED AND AMBITIOUS ARTISTS INTERESTED AND EAGER TO TURN THEIR ART PRACTICE INTO A SUCCESSFUL CAREER AND A VIABLE BUSINESS. DEBUT IS THE ONLY PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND CAREER EMPOWERMENT PLATFORM OF ITS KIND IN THE UK AND FOLLOWS ON FROM THE SUCCESS THE FOUNDERS SAMIR CERIC AND ZOE KNIGHT, HUSBAND AND WIFE DUO, ACHIEVED THROUGH THE LAUNCH OF SALON CONTEMPORARY AND WOLF & BADGER WHICH EARNED THEM THE INDUSTRY TITLES SUCH AS ‘ONE OF THE UK’S MOST POWERFUL COUPLES IN ART & FASHION’ (THE TIMES MAGAZINES), ‘KINGMAKERS OF CREATIVE TALENT’ (INTERNATIONAL LIFE MAGAZINE), ‘LONDON’S TOP TASTEMAKERS’ (TIME OUT LONDON), TO NAME A FEW. 


ARTISTS HAVE HISTORICALLY FOUND IT DIFFICULT TO ACCESS GALLERY SPACE AND PROFESSIONAL INDUSTRY HELP TO ASSIST IN PUSHING THEIR CAREERS IN THE RIGHT DIRECTION. LACK OF PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE INDUSTRY HAS HAD A DEVASTATING AFFECT IN THE RESPECT OF THE LOSS OF CREATIVE TALENT FOR DECADES NOW. DEBUT CONTEMPORARY'S KEY ROLE IS TO CHANGE THAT AS WELL AS GIVE THE RISING TALENT A CHANCE TO SHINE AND GET A NECESSARY EXPOSURE WITHIN THE RIGHT NETWORKS. 
DEBUT CONTEMPORARY NOT ONLY OFFERS EMERGING ARTISTS AN AFFORDABLE OPPORTUNITY TO SUCCEED IN THEIR CREATIVE CAREERS, BUT ALSO LOOKS SET TO DELIVER A DYNAMIC AND STIMULATING GALLERY EXPERIENCE THAT HAS NOT PREVIOUSLY BEEN SEEN, IN THIS PARTICULAR FORMAT. A SERIES OF ART PERFORMANCES IN THE GALLERY WINDOW WILL ENTICE A WIDER AUDIENCE TO BE PART OF THE ART WORLD. 

www.debutcontemporary.com

story:
About Project "White and Red"

Hi everybody. I am a Patient No.6. I am interested in troubleshooting creative people trough psychiatry and psychiatry in general. Under the intense influence of these horrible things I’ve created a Patient No.6 and today I ask you to help me with the project “White and Red”. These are six 5-inch toys

1. the first toy is named - Scull of Patient No.6

2. the second toy is named Gagarin in Rocket

3. the third toy is named - “Patient No.6 in car”

4. afourth toy is named – “Doctor”

5. afifth toy is named-“Patient No.6 Rabbit mask”

6. and a sixth toy is named-“Patient No.6 after lobotomy”

These figures are completely different from those, which you see in the world of designer toys every day. Then, as one famous person said – there is something inside and something  outside. And Patient No.6 – is something inside.

              

  What I Need & What You Get

For realization this project a reality I need the money, I have a little bit, but that's not enough for this purpose. Means that you give will be used to complete the purchase of materials and equipment. You are investing not only the current draft, but the future too, and in return you get a quality psychiatric art.  I promise you this…

The Patient No.6 story

Patient â„– 6 - is a creative person's head which breaks his imagination (no earthly creature ). There is nothing wrong, but society does not need is not predictable people, for this reason he has for many years undergoing treatment in a psychiatric hospital… But talent does not kill…

Here some publications about Patient No.6:

http://www.jeremyriad.com/blog/toy-talk/resin/patient-no-6-needs-your-help/

http://www.jeremyriad.com/blog/toy-talk/resin/new-resin-toy-art-from-ukrainian-asylum/

http://toysrevil.blogspot.com/2011/10/update-on-patient-no6.html

http://www.spankystokes.com/2011/12/patient-no6-in-car-new-resin-figure.html

http://www.flickr.com/photos/patient6/sets/72157629722310663/

 My official web-site- www.patient6.com

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the world about our fundraising campaign on your blog, facebook, twiter, and google+…

story:
To learn more about the dreamscape foundation you can visit our website at : http:/www.dreamscape.me 


GOAL

I will use all the funds i raise into completing the Dreamscape Foundation platform. The platform will allow me to reach more by connecting people in need to people and charities who want to give and help. By doing so, I will be able to provide the resources and support to many that need it.

Joseph

LOST MY SIGHT NOT MY VISION 

Since my disability onset, I have encountered the complications that disabled people must face in society, which most will take for granted. They want to be able to cook, go for a jog, read a book, and simply enjoy life. However they fully realize that their life will have limitations

A disability can redefine someone’s life; this is a severe reality and the Dreamscape Foundation is here to help.

The Dreamscape Foundation will provide the education, the health care, and the essential assistance to help those adapt to their disability and enjoy their lives.  It is time to make a difference; it is time to share the dream.

DREAM 10 PROGRAM

 You can bring optimism into someone’s life through the Dream 10 Program.

To help provide the assets for the disabled community. Prior to becoming legally blind, I was very artistically inclined, as I went through my ordeal I found ways to continue applying my creativity inspite of my disability, proving anything is possible.

I will create 10 Pieces of Art based off of pop culture and mixed media for donors to help raise funds for the foundation.  In addition there will be alternative donation packages for those who wish to support.

 

**I have designed the first three pieces of my Dream 10 series to begin**              

 Here is just a quick sample of one of my pieces of art for this program.

View more at our gallery : http://www.indiegogo.com/projects/dreamscape-foundation-dream-10-program/x/4273869?c=gallery 


SUPPORT US

In the months to follow, this foundation will continue to use the funds raised to aid the disabled and change the course of their life for the better. This foundation depends on the determination and goodwill of humanity to help people in need. Any form of a donation is greatly acknowledged, whether it is a financial donation or simply showing your support and spreading the word.

The cost of a donation is insignificant when it comes to your generosity, all that matters is knowing that someone’s life has been made better because of you, and this is priceless.

Any contribution is appreciated and we are truly grateful for your support towards the Dreamscape Foundation.

MY MISSION

 Nothing in someone’s life can prepare him or her for a rare unanticipated disability, it’s a forever changing experience, but there is still hope. Our mission is to aid the population of people affected by disabilities, in a goal to help them achieve success and to fund a cure. The Joseph Sehwani Dreamscape Foundation will provide individuals with scholarships, job aids, education accommodations, health aids and amenities to help them succeed in life. This foundation will focus on supporting their future in order to provide equality. With your help we can fight these disabilities. Our dreams are just the beginning… 

Regardless of your disability, together we will conquer our obstacles as we continue our mission to achieve success.

 My goal is for people with disabilities to no longer forgo on experiences in life, help me make a difference – Joseph Sehwani


Follow us on our Google + page to follow updates on the foundation and help us spread the word! 

http://gplus.to/dreamscapefoundation

story:
In 2008 I opened an art gallery named Gallerysmith

My surname is Smith so the name represents not only who I am but what I do. Gallerysmith represents visual artists in the traditional way and in the 6 years since we opened, we have helped many artists to reach their potential by assisting them to develop their practices, by matching them to curatorial opportunities and by developing collector interest in their work. While working hard for our artists, we have developed a strong client base of collectors and a community of art lovers who look forward to seeing our annual program unfold. Someone recently quipped that the Gallerysmith community is like a book of fascinating characters (the opening chapter begins with a 70 year old artist with a grey pony tail who arrives at the gallery to tell me about his new work. He is animated and excited, throwing his arms about in a manner reminiscent of the way he applies oil paint to canvas. In walks a young stylish woman with cropped black hair covered in loose pigment whose studio is upstairs. She begins a conversation about her work in progress and the older artist tells the younger woman to turn her paintings upside down so she can can see them more clearly. In the midst of this creative exchange, a truck pulls up to deliver the works for an upcoming exhibition. We count the works and while the consignment note is being signed, a collector arrives to preview the new work. I greet him and offer a cup of tea. He is excited because he has been waiting for months to see this work emerge from the studio. The phone rings. It is a client who wants to talk more about the images I emailed her this morning ...) This is a typical scene, but I digress...

What do we want to do?

We (I use the first person plural because the gallery is its own character too) are indebted to our community of art lovers and we want to continue to engage them with new and exciting work, so we want to broaden our offer by opening an additional space called GALLERYSMITH PROJECT SPACE. Our vision for this new gallery (in an existing but disused gallery space upstairs and on the same premises) is to create real opportunities for younger artists by connecting them with our established audience, thereby bumping along their careers. We will work with artists for short-term projects rather than as longer term relationships.

When is it happening?

It has all come together so quickly. My Gallery Manager (she is on the left, I am on the right of the above pic) hatched the idea two months ago. Since then we have developed a strategy and are launching in August. Our branding is done. Our facebook page has attracted 560 likes. The space is almost ready to go and we have exhibitions booked for the rest of the year. But we need a little bit of extra capital to give the launch some va va voom so we can begin to attract more applicants.

What do we need?

Prior to the launch, we need to:

  • paint the entrance and foyer, ($690)
  • install some vinyl signage, ($155)
  • set up website hosting, ($49)
  • design a simple free website (most of the foundation work is complete), ($0)
  • distribute an EDM with details of the launch to our established client base (design completed) ($181).

At the launch we will have:

  • a group exhibition showcasing work by artists of the calibre we want to attract (already curated), ($0)
  • a dj playing some experimental music, ($150)
  • a dance performance in the space, ($150)
  • a photographer and branded backdrop to take social shots ($450)
  • bar staff ($120)
  • drinks and some simple nibbles. ($550)

TOTAL CAPITAL needed = $2,495


Why a big launch?

Good question. Well, in a nutshell, we need the launch to be super dooper to set the scene. All of the photographic content from the launch will feed into our social media, facebook page, instagram, website and blog to present a vibrant gallery atmosphere that will attract more collectors to future events. A higher level of collector interest will appeal to artists and this will translate to an increase in the calibre of the applications.

If we don't reach our goal, we will still launch, but we will not be able to create the buzz we need to build the momentum. The vitality of the launch and the initial energy will be self fulfilling. Once the project space is up and running it will be self-funding.

Why support us?

For six years I have supported artists in largely tangible but often intangible ways. I have encouraged them, shared in their triumphs, mentored them, cooked for them, put them up in my spare room, opened proverbial doors for them, celebrated with them, taken the heat for them when the chips are down, offered advice, a shoulder, a coffee. I love what we do and the Gallerysmith community loves us and our artists. We have firmly established the careers of a number of fledgeling artists by hosting their first major exhibitions (Nici Cumpston, Siri Hayes, Tony Albert, TextaQueen, Eric Bridgeman, Lucas Grogan, Catherine Nelson all of whom are now recognised and have solid reputations). Gallerysmith Project Space will allow us to cast our net more widely and give us the opportuniity to identify other young hopefuls but work with them in a project rather than on ongoing context.

Financially, we just need a small snowball that we can roll down the hill.
story_txt:
In 2008 I opened an art gallery named Gallerysmith
My surname is Smith so the name
represents not only who I am but what I do. Gallerysmith represents visual
artists in the traditional way and in the 6 years since we opened, we have
helped many artists to reach their potential by assisting them to develop their
practices, by matching them to curatorial opportunities and by developing
collector interest in their work. While working hard for our artists, we have
developed a strong client base of collectors and a community of art lovers who
look forward to seeing our annual program unfold. Someone recently quipped that
the Gallerysmith community is like a book of fascinating characters (the
opening chapter begins with a 70 year old artist with a grey pony tail who arrives at
the gallery to tell me about his new work. He is animated
and excited, throwing his arms about in a manner reminiscent of the way
he applies oil paint to canvas. In walks a young stylish woman with cropped black
hair covered in loose pigment whose studio is upstairs. She begins a conversation
about her work in progress and the older artist tells the younger woman to turn
her paintings upside down so she can can see them more clearly. In the midst of this
creative exchange, a truck pulls up to deliver the works for an upcoming
exhibition. We count the works and while the consignment note is being signed, a collector arrives to
preview the new work. I greet him and offer a cup of tea. He is excited because
he has been waiting for months to see this work emerge from the studio. The phone
rings. It is a client who wants to talk more about the images I emailed her
this morning ...) This is a typical scene, but I digress...
What do we want to do?
We (I use the first person plural because the gallery is its own character too) are indebted to our community of art lovers and we want to continue to engage them with new and exciting work, so we want to broaden our offer by opening an additional space called GALLERYSMITH PROJECT SPACE. Our vision for this new gallery (in an existing but disused gallery space upstairs and on the same premises) is to create real opportunities for younger artists by connecting them with our established audience, thereby bumping along their careers. We will work with artists for short-term projects rather than as longer term relationships.
When is it happening?
It has all come together so quickly. My Gallery Manager (she is on the left, I am on the right of the above pic) hatched the idea two months ago. Since then we have developed a strategy and are launching in August. Our branding is done. Our facebook page has attracted 560 likes. The space is almost ready to go and we have exhibitions booked for the rest of the year. But we need a little bit of extra capital to give the launch some va va voom so we can begin to attract more applicants. 
What do we need?
Prior to the launch, we need to: 

paint the entrance and foyer, ($690)

install some vinyl signage, ($155)

set up website hosting, ($49) 

design a simple free website (most of the foundation work is complete), ($0)

distribute an EDM with details of the launch to our established client base (design completed) ($181).

At the launch we will have:

a group exhibition showcasing work by artists of the calibre we want to attract (already curated), ($0)

a dj playing some experimental music, ($150)

a dance performance in the space, ($150)

a photographer and branded backdrop to take social shots ($450)
bar staff ($120)

drinks and some simple nibbles. ($550)


TOTAL CAPITAL needed = $2,495


Why a big launch?
Good question. Well, in a nutshell, we need the launch to be super dooper to set the scene. All of the photographic content from the launch will feed into our social media, facebook page, instagram, website and blog to present a vibrant gallery atmosphere that will attract more collectors to future events. A higher level of collector interest will appeal to artists and this will translate to an increase in the calibre of the applications.
If we don't reach our goal, we will still launch, but we will not be able to create the buzz we need to build the momentum. The vitality of the launch and the initial energy will be self fulfilling. Once the project space is up and running it will be self-funding. 
Why support us?
For six years I have supported artists in largely tangible but often intangible ways. I have encouraged them, shared in their triumphs, mentored them, cooked for them, put them up in my spare room, opened proverbial doors for them, celebrated with them, taken the heat for them when the chips are down, offered advice, a shoulder, a coffee. I love what we do and the Gallerysmith community loves us and our artists. We have firmly established the careers of a number of fledgeling artists by hosting their first major exhibitions (Nici Cumpston, Siri Hayes, Tony Albert, TextaQueen, Eric Bridgeman, Lucas Grogan, Catherine Nelson all of whom are now recognised and have solid reputations). Gallerysmith Project Space will allow us to cast our net more widely and give us the opportuniity to identify other young hopefuls but work with them in a project rather than on ongoing context. 
Financially, we just need a small snowball that we can roll down the hill.

story: I am raising money for an art studio space. The cheapest places I've found are 300 dollars a month and need first month, last, and a security deposit to live in. All together that adds up to 900$. Even though I have 2 1/2 jobs it would be extremely difficult for me to save up all that money to move in. So help a brotha out.

story:
Hi ,My name is Roman Tcherpak and i am a photograph leaving in Venice ,Italy 

  • I create this campaign to finish my research on new printing method .
  • It all starts when i moved to Venice and due to ecological situation desided not to work again with toxic materials .I started to examine existing ways to print digital photography manualy and find out very few suitable techniques for my situation. .So i desided ,to create a new eco friendly system availible to everybody,everywhere with no prier knowlege in printing  .After series of experiments we arrived to point ,in which it is possible in 10 minutes to produce a plate for itching, starting from laser printed  paper image on normal 80 gsm paper .We need some additional materials and time to finish .

Know, when we working on  a stable technique

story:
(version française plus bas dans la page) 

What we do

We are Seb Toussaint, and Spag, two artists from the UK and France, and together we make up the Outsiders Krew. We do street art, photography and film, and at the moment we're using these art-forms in an on-going art project called “Share The Word”. The idea is simple : we ask people who live in slums to give us words that we then turn into street art. Each family gives us one word that they want to share with the outside world, and we then paint this word on their house. In this project we use graffiti to bring the focus on a specific community through its own words. The art is the result of an interaction between us and the environment, and it becomes a bridge between the community and the outside world. Involving the local children and getting them to help us is always a priority, especially in places where not all children go to school and where art education is non-existent.

From our experience, slums are vibrant places full of interesting and creative people. Unfortunately they are cut off from the rest of society, ignored or forgotten by many governments. If we want to build a more equal world, we need to include these communities, interact with them, and learn from them. Our photography and film work aim not only to showcase our street art, but to bring attention to these often ignored communities.

After having taken Share The Word project to low income neighbourhoods of Indonesia, Kenya and Nepal, we now want to take the project to Colombia. In August 2014, we will spend 5 weeks in a slum of Bogota, painting street art on people's houses, and getting the kids involved in the project.


How you can help

You can help us by sending some money that will be used for the project in Colombia to pay for transport, paint, food and accommodation. Outsiders Krew is a non profit association, registered in the Prefecture du Calvados, in France. We're a very small organisation made up of simply us two artists doing things on our own, on a low budget. We financed the first 3 episodes of this project ourselves with our own savings, but after such successful episodes, we want to continue doing this and visit more slums!

To participate you can choose a perk from 3€ to 500€ (on the right hand side). You can also donate any amount, click contribute, enter how much you want to donate and choose "no contribution".

After 3 episodes of Share The Word project, we are able to have a clear view of how much money is needed on this type of project.

This is what our budget looks like for 5 weeks in Bogota :

--

Flights : 1700 €

Paint and art supplies : 950 €

Food and daily expenses: 500 €

Accommodation : 180 €

Transport in Bogota : 70 €

Crowd funding and banking fees : 100 €

Total : 3500 €


How we make an impact

A typical day on a Share The Word project starts with us going to the slum looking for a nice wall to paint. When we've found one, we ask the family whose wall it is, to give a word that they would like to share. It may be in any language or script. As soon as they give us the word, we start painting, using spray paint, rollers, paint brushes or whatever we can get our hands on. The mural is improvised, inspired by the place, the people and the meaning of the word itself.

The first 3 episodes of Share The Word project in Indonesia, Kenya and Nepal were very successful. The locals welcomed the project and were very enthusiastic. It was very interesting both for them and us to interact and learn from each other. In all these places, our project was talked about in the newspapers, magazines and on the internet in the countries we were working in. The inhabitants of the slums felt a little prouder of their neighbourhood, felt inspired and more connected to the outside world. In Nepal, many tourists came to the slum to have a look at the art. In Indonesia and Kenya, inhabitants of wealthier areas started coming into the slum to have a look at the art too. As a result of this, the people from the slum and the people from the outside interacted and exchanged for the first time.

We feel that this sort of interaction is a small step towards a more equal society. We feel that bringing attention on a slum through art is a way of making people think differently about these communities.


The challenges we face

The main challenge for us is to stay safe in a sometimes hostile environment. The vast majority of people who live in slums are very friendly and welcoming, but like everywhere, we also meet people with not-so-good intentions. However, slums are forgotten by the local police and security remains a major issue.

Our experience of working in slums has taught us how to deal with this issue. We are always extremely cautious when we first enter the slum, and start by introducing ourselves and explaining our project to the community leaders. Since government laws often don't always apply to marginalised communities, we use common sense and a lot of respect in order to stay safe and work efficiently. We are now very confident about going into marginalised communities, and we know our project will be appreciated.


A long term project

Share The Word project is an ongoing project that started in August 2013 in a low income neighbourhood of Jakarta, Indonesia. Since then we worked in Nairobi, Kenya, and Kathmandu, Nepal. You can help us take this project further by contributing to the project in Bogota in August. After that, we will set up art exhebitions to show our work in more detail and help pay for future episodes in many other places. In the future we would also like to return to neighborhoods previously visited to work their again and see how things have changed.

Please feel free to help us by spreading the word to people around you! We're on facebook, twitter and instagram.

We're glad to answer any questions you may have! Feel free to drop us an e-mail or to give us a call : +33 (0)6 73 01 51 14 ! 

Thank you very much for your help!



______

Qui sommes-nous, que faisons-nous ?

Nous sommes Seb Toussaint, et Spag, deux artistes respectivement britannique et français, regroupés sous le nom d'Outsiders Krew. Nous faisons du street art, de la photographie, de la vidéo et mixons ces différents "outils" dans un projet artistique que nous avons baptisé « Share The Word ». L'idée est simple, nous demandons aux habitants de bidonvilles de nous donner des mots, à partir desquels nous créons des fresques murales. 

Chaque famille nous donne un mot qu'elle souhaite partager avec le monde extérieur et nous improvisons une fresque sur le mur de leur habitation, autour du mot choisi. Dans ce projet, nous utilisons le graffiti pour attirer l'attention sur une communauté, à travers ses propres mots. L'art créé est le fruit d'une interaction entre nous-même et l’environnement. L'art devient ainsi un pont entre la communauté du bidonville et le monde extérieur. Dans des pays où beaucoup d'enfants ne vont pas à l'école et n'ont pas de cours d'art plastique, nous trouvons toujours un moyen de faire participer les enfants de ces quartiers à nos projets.

Les bidonvilles sont des lieux très vivants où l'on trouve de nombreuses personnes intéressantes et créatives. Hélas, ces quartiers sont coupés du reste de la société, ignorés et oubliés par les autorités locales. Si nous voulons construire un monde plus égalitaire, nous devons inclure ces communautés, échanger avec elles et apprendre d'elles. Notre travail de photographie et de vidéo ne sert pas uniquement à montrer nos peintures, mais permet aussi de mettre en lumière ces communautés oubliées.

Après avoir mené ce projet en Indonésie, au Kenya et au Népal, nous souhaitons pouvoir mettre en place notre projet en Colombie. En Août 2014, nous irons passer 5 semaines dans un quartier marginalisé de Bogota, pour peindre les maisons des habitants et faire participer la jeunesse locale.


Comment nous aider ? 

Les fonds récoltés grâce à cette campagne seront utilisés pour financer le 4ème épisode du projet (en Colombie). Nous en avons besoin pour financer le transport, la peinture, et notre vie sur place. 

Outsiders Krew est une association loi 1901, à but non lucratif, déposée en Préfecture du Calvados, en France. Nous ne sommes que 2 dans cette structure, et nous organisons tous nos projets seuls, avec peu de moyens. Nous avons financé nous mêmes les 3 premiers épisodes de ce projet avec nos économies ; et suite au succès rencontré, nous voulons continuer à nous rendre dans d'autres quartiers défavorisés.

Pour y contribuer, vous pouvez choisir un pack allant de 3€ à 500 € (à droite de ce texte). Vous avez aussi la possibilité de faire un don d'un montant libre (choisir "don sans contrepartie" et indiquer la somme souhaitée). 

Après 3 épisodes de Share The Word, nous avons une vision assez précise du coût d'un projet.

Voici notre budget prévisionnel pour 5 semaines à Bogota :

--

Vols : 1700 €

Peinture et matériel : 950 €

Nourriture et dépenses quotidiennes : 500 €

Logement : 180 €

Transport à Bogota : 70 €

Frais de financement et frais bancaires : 100 €

Total : 3500 €


L'impact du projet :

Une journée type sur un épisode Share The Word commence, une fois le quartier trouvé, par la recherche d'un mur à peindre suffisamment "bon" (hauteur, type de surface, visibilité, etc...). Nous demandons ensuite à son ou ses propriétaires de nous donner un mot qu'ils souhaitent partager. Il peut être exprimé en n'importe quelle langue et dans n'importe quel alphabet ou caractère. Dès que ce mot nous est donné, nous commençons à peindre en utilisant principalement de la peinture classique pour surface extérieure étalée avec des rouleaux et pinceaux mais aussi de la peinture aérosol pour les détails généralement. Chaque fresque est improvisée et inspirée par l’environnement, le lieu, ses habitants et le sens du mot que l'on peint.

Les 3 premiers épisodes de Share The Word ont été un succès total ! Les locaux ont à chaque fois été très accueillants et enthousiastes vis-à-vis du projet. Il était très intéressant à la fois pour nous, et pour les locaux, d'échanger et d'apprendre de nos cultures et de nos différences. Dans chaque pays où nous avons travaillé, les médias locaux ont parlé du projet. Les habitants se sont sentis plus fiers de leur quartier. Grâce à l'art, ces lieux se sont un peu plus ouverts au monde extérieur. Au Népal, de nombreux touristes sont venus dans le bidonville pour voir les fresques de plus près. En Indonésie et au Kenya, les habitants des quartiers plus riches sont venus pour y voir nos peintures. Les habitants ont pu échanger, parfois pour la première fois, avec des gens de l'extérieur.

Nous pensons que ce type d'échanges est un petit pas vers une société plus égalitaire. Nous pensons qu'attirer l'attention sur un quartier défavorisé au travers de l'art peut changer la façon dont ces communautés sont perçues.


Les challenges : 

Nous travaillons dans des milieux parfois difficiles, voire hostiles, notre principal challenge est la sécurité. L'immense majorité des habitants des bidonvilles sont très accueillants et sympathiques, mais comme partout, certaines personnes peuvent être mal intentionnées. A la différence de nos villes, les bidonvilles sont généralement oubliés par la police et la sécurité demeure un problème majeur.

Notre expérience nous a appris à faire face à tout ça. Nous sommes toujours très vigilants quand nous entrons pour la première fois dans un bidonville. Les lois du pays ne s'appliquent pas vraiment dans ces quartiers... Faire preuve de bon sens et de beaucoup de respect sont la clé pour pouvoir travailler dans les meilleures conditions possibles. Après ces 3 épisodes positifs, nous savons que notre projet sera toujours apprécié dans ces quartiers.


Un projet d'envergure 

Share The Word est un projet à long terme qui a commencé en août 2013 à Jakarta en Indonésie. Depuis, nous avons travaillé à Nairobi au Kenya, et à Katmandou au Népal. Vous pouvez nous aider à aller plus loin, en participant au financement de notre prochain épisode à Bogota en août. Une exposition est prévue à Caen pour la fin de l'année 2014 ; nous y présenterons notre travail et vendrons nos oeuvres pour permettre de financer les futurs épisodes prévus en 2015. 

N'hésitez pas à parler de notre projet autour de vous ! Nous sommes sur facebook, twitter et instagram.

Pour toutes questions, n'hésitez pas nous à envoyer un e-mail ou nous téléphoner au +33 (0)6 73 01 51 14 .

Merci beaucoup pour votre aide !

L'impact du projet :

Une journée type sur un épisode Share The Word commence, une fois le quartier trouvé, par la recherche d'un mur à peindre suffisamment "bon" (hauteur, type de surface, visibilité, etc...). Nous demandons ensuite à son ou ses propriétaires de nous donner un mot qu'ils souhaitent partager. Il peut être exprimé en n'importe quelle langue et dans n'importe quel alphabet ou caractère. Dès que ce mot nous est donné, nous commençons à peindre en utilisant principalement de la peinture classique pour surface extérieure étalée avec des rouleaux et pinceaux mais aussi de la peinture aérosol pour les détails généralement. Chaque fresque est improvisée et inspirée par l’environnement, le lieu, ses habitants et le sens du mot que l'on peint.
Les 3 premiers épisodes de Share The Word ont été un succès total ! Les locaux ont à chaque fois été très accueillants et enthousiastes vis-à-vis du projet. Il était très intéressant à la fois pour nous, et pour les locaux, d'échanger et d'apprendre de nos cultures et de nos différences. Dans chaque pays où nous avons travaillé, les médias locaux ont parlé du projet. Les habitants se sont sentis plus fiers de leur quartier. Grâce à l'art, ces lieux se sont un peu plus ouverts au monde extérieur. Au Népal, de nombreux touristes sont venus dans le bidonville pour voir les fresques de plus près. En Indonésie et au Kenya, les habitants des quartiers plus riches sont venus pour y voir nos peintures. Les habitants ont pu échanger, parfois pour la première fois, avec des gens de l'extérieur.
Nous pensons que ce type d'échanges est un petit pas vers une société plus égalitaire. Nous pensons qu'attirer l'attention sur un quartier défavorisé au travers de l'art peut changer la façon dont ces communautés sont perçues.




Les challenges : 
Nous travaillons dans des milieux parfois difficiles, voire hostiles, notre principal challenge est la sécurité. L'immense majorité des habitants des bidonvilles sont très accueillants et sympathiques, mais comme partout, certaines personnes peuvent être mal intentionnées. A la différence de nos villes, les bidonvilles sont généralement oubliés par la police et la sécurité demeure un problème majeur.
Notre expérience nous a appris à faire face à tout ça. Nous sommes toujours très vigilants quand nous entrons pour la première fois dans un bidonville. Les lois du pays ne s'appliquent pas vraiment dans ces quartiers... Faire preuve de bon sens et de beaucoup de respect sont la clé pour pouvoir travailler dans les meilleures conditions possibles. Après ces 3 épisodes positifs, nous savons que notre projet sera toujours apprécié dans ces quartiers.


Un projet d'envergure 
Share The Word est un projet à long terme qui a commencé en août 2013 à Jakarta en Indonésie. Depuis, nous avons travaillé à Nairobi au Kenya, et à Katmandou au Népal. Vous pouvez nous aider à aller plus loin, en participant au financement de notre prochain épisode à Bogota en août. Une exposition est prévue à Caen pour la fin de l'année 2014 ; nous y présenterons notre travail et vendrons nos oeuvres pour permettre de financer les futurs épisodes prévus en 2015. 
N'hésitez pas à parler de notre projet autour de vous ! Nous sommes sur facebook, twitter et instagram.
Pour toutes questions, n'hésitez pas nous à envoyer un e-mail ou nous téléphoner au +33 (0)6 73 01 51 14 .
Merci beaucoup pour votre aide !

story:
Short Summary

Hello. I am Vedat Örs. I am a painter. I invite you to help us build an art location, Village of Art in Bodrum situated on a beautiful peninsula on the Aegean sea of Turkey. It will be home particularly to the public of all backgrounds and mediums for social gathering, conversation, artistic experimentation, and holiday.

As a piece of Bodrum’s cultural infrastructure, Village of Art will be home also to artists, sculptors, cinematograhers, photographers, producers, directors, musicians, illustrators, dancers, inventors, writers, performers, editors, designers, performers and more of all art disciplines.

There will be art, painting, sculpture, ceramics workshops in the Village of Art that we intend to build. At the same time there will be a number of workshops on the visual arts. We aim to help both Turkish young artists and foreign artists to assemble in a functional space to have information and cultural exchange with each other. All people who do not have even any background in art issues will be able to participate in our workshops and programs. They will get an opportunity both to meet artists in the workshops but also have leisure time activities on this favourite holiday peninsula.

What We Need & What You Get

We want an arts commuity to operate efficiently and produce work freely. The total cost of construction and improvements of the location of our Village of Art is 30,000 USD. Your contributions will not only provide the support necessary to develop this work, they will help make the creation of a public place happen.

Indeed contributing to our campaign is a way to support art in a very direct way, by bringing people all over the world and artists together in this lively holiday location where new works can be conceived and produced on a daily basis. Participants will accomodate in tents and bungalows in the Village of Art and enjoy having a nice stay in this lively holiday resort. They will experience the peninsula to truly understand the attraction of Bodrum.

The town's charm is well-known, attracting a diverse population of vacationers. Not far from town, you can swim in absolutely clear, tideless, warm seas. The evenings in Bodrum are for sitting idly in one of the manyrestaurants, dining on fresh seafood and other Aegean specialties. Afterwards night clubs with live music and, of course, some of thebest discosin Europe keep you going until dawn.

Every dolar raised through Indiegogo will go directly to the technical and creative design for the project. If we do not reach our goal, our location can still be constructed with the money contributed, supplemented by sponsor participation. If you participate in our campaign, you will still receive all the benefits. We offer you not only a nice holiday on the peninsula thanks to its charming landscape and cultural sphere but also an experience to participate in all art workshops.

Please spread the word about our Village of Art by using the Indiegogo share tools. Share this link with your friends, your family and your neighbours. The location opening will be open to the public on July 1, 2014. We would like to see you there.

Thank you for supporting our project – Each and every contribution will make it happen!

REWARDS !!!

Your support will be rewarded. By donating to this fundraiser we are offering you a variety of perks. Come stay with us in the Village of Art. Save money. Take full advantage of going on a holiday on this popular holiday peninsula in Bodrum on the Aegean cost of Turkey.

For 20 dollars, receive 20 % discount per night to accommodate in tent in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018.

For 50 dollars, receive 30 % discount per night to accommodate in tent in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 75 dollars, receive 20 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 100 dollars, receive 30 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 125 dollars, receive 35 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season.Valid until 1 October 2018

For 150 dollars, receive 40 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 200 dollars, receive 50 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 250 dollars, receive 60 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 300 dollars, receive 70 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 350 dollars, receive 75 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 400 dollars, receive 80 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 450 dollars, receive 85 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 500 dollars, receive 90 % discount per night to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 750 dollars, enjoy 10 free nights to accommodate in bungalow in our Village of Art. Take a yacht tour to the peninsula. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 1000 dollars, your name will be written on an olive tree in your honour in our Village of Art. Enjoy 10 free nights to accommodate in bungalow. Take 2 yacht tours to the peninsula. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 2000 dollars, your name will be written on an olive tree in your honour in our Village of Art. Enjoy 10 free nights to accommodate in bungalow. Take 3 yacht tours to the peninsula. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

For 3000 dollars, your name will be written on an olive tree in your honour in our Village of Art. Enjoy 20 free nights to accommodate in bungalow. Take 5 yacht tours to the peninsula. Includes breakfast. Price per person. For 1 season. Valid until 1 October 2018

Contact us for more information: uzay.kl@yandex.com / vedators@gmail.com 


Team on this Campaign: 

Vedat Örs / Founder 

Uzay Kılıç

Sulhi Baybar

story:
For over eleven years now The Sanctuary has been resident in Northampton, providing affordable working spaces for up and coming artists and graduates to continue with their practice.

In that time we have hosted nearly three hundred exhibitions and shows for the public, free of charge to come and socialise whist enjoying the output of both studio members and a variety of other creative s from all manner of discipline’s and artistic outputs.

Now in our eleventh year we plan to continue with our voluntary run, diverse, inclusive and sometimes challenging program, with shows which we believe should continue to be available for all to attend. To do this to our best potential though we are at a point where we are looking for some support from our friends and followers old and new to revitalise the building we have inhabited over the past decade.

We are seeking donations from our supporters towards a indiegogo bid in order to breath some new life into the now very well used gallery and studios. In return many of our very popular resident artists have been producing pieces of work which will be sent to those who support us. These works will also be exhibited in a Christmas show where you can pick directly the works which you would like for some bargain unique stocking fillers.

The donations will work as follows

£30 a 10x10"  piece of work by an artist amongst the Sanctuary members.

£45 a 20x20"  piece of work by an artist amongst the Sanctuary members.

£75 a 1 day printmaking workshop with artist Pauline Wood in our studios.

The Christmas show will be open on Saturday the 13th of December from 12 until 8pm, drop in and have a glass of wine whilst picking out a truely unique gift without the stresses of the ques.

story:
Updated message from Eleni - November 19, 2015

WOW -- I just wanted to thank everyone so much for their kindness in contributing to this campaign to help give a very strong woman the extra boost needed to get back into financial health.  My heart is warmed by each and every one of your purchases!  I hope that you enjoy Lynn's creative art as much as I have.

We are ALMOST at the goal -- so close!  If you have any friends/family shopping for the holidays, please do share these links for gift ideas!

This campaign: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/legal-fees--30/x/12446677#/story

Hair of the Dog ("turning trash into treasure"): https://www.etsy.com/shop/ecoimbiber

Aguavino ("functional photography & treasured trash"): https://www.etsy.com/shop/aguavino

Thank you again, everyone, and just know that you have made my year!

--Eleni


Message from Eleni

Fellow friends of Lynn:  I have watched this drama unfold from afar, and neglected to act until now.  One of the kindest people I know has been struggling for two years due to some very unfair legal fees she has incurred (which most of you know about).  I feel badly that I have not done anything until now, but realize we're all very busy and it's easy to forget when your friend is so strong and capable despite all of the barriers she has faced.  Please consider buying her beautiful art for Halloween, Thanksgiving, Christmas, Hanukkah,  or any other occasion to help her bring down the burden of this heavy legal debt she's been unfairly saddled with.  As you undoubtedly know, Lynn is a hard worker and a true friend, and I'm saddened that she has suffered from this experience, and had over $10K in fees (now owing $6K).  As a single parent, this burden is enormous. Your help and support means the world.  --Eleni

What We Need & What You Get

Help us reach our goal of $3,000. We have something to give for every level of your generosity! If you do not see any perks that you like here, you can always just donate to the fund in any amount with the no-perk "Contribute Now" option, or you can support Lynn by purchasing from her Etsy shops, where she sells other handmade creations:

Hair of the Dog features useful items handmade from recycled bar & beverage packaging, such as bottle cap soy candles, pick yer poison journals, hangover- helper eye pillows, safe-sex pillows, and more. All great gifts for any eco-imbiber! (ecoimbiber.etsy.com)

Aguavino features Lynn's "functional photography & treasured trash," including light switch covers made from her original photos, bibs made from recycled T-shirts, and even vegan-themed temporary tattoos! (aguavino.etsy.com)

To view images of the various perks, please click on the links below:
--Photo Magnets
--4" x 4" Photo Tiles
--8" x 6" Photo Tiles
--One-of-a-kind Art Pieces
--Photo Greeting Cards
(Please note that you will not be able to specify your selections when you place your order. You will have to tell us your selection through the comment or contact section of this site after your order is placed.)

Help Spread the Word

Whether you are able to help out financially or not, we would greatly appreciate if you could share our campaign link with your friends and family. The artwork that Lynn is offering makes excellent gifts for the upcoming holidays, so spread the word today!

Message from Lynn:

When Eleni came up with the idea to do this, I was skeptical at first, because I have always been very independent and self-sufficient. But I really am in a time of need right now, and Eleni is the kind of person who makes things happen. 

Two years ago, I incurred about $10,000 of legal fees for a situation that could have been handled without the use of attorneys or the court system. I will not go into the specifics of the case; those that know me know the story and know that it was completely unnecessary, and the end result was almost exactly the same as it was before the legal proceedings. What many may not know is what a huge financial strain this has been for me.

Just recently, there have been more unnecessary court proceedings caused by the same party. The time and energy put into this latest round caused me to miss a lot of work and added even more to my debt.

I have managed to pay off almost half of the debt, but I have felt like an indentured servant for the last two years, giving every extra dime to either my lawyer or my credit card company every month. I am a single mom, working and providing for myself and my son without any financial assistance in the form of child support or aid from the state. We live very modestly and I very rarely buy anything for myself. It's been almost four years since I've seen my dad and some other family members because I have had no extra money to travel to the East Coast.

The amount I still owe is about $6,000. I was able to get a low-interest-rate loan from my bank for the $3,000 that was on my credit card; the other $3,000 I owe directly to my attorney.

I am offering my artwork and professional editing services in exchange for your generosity, and every little bit helps. If we can reach our goal, it will help me get back on my feet and back to a fair playing field. I deeply appreciate all the love and support! xoxo

story:
“A Yantra is a symbolic, compact, geometrical diagram, designed as a magical instrument, used to elevate the mind and shift one’s perception away from negative states…for the first time, these ancient Yantras are available to us in the most accessible way, as a beautiful full color deck of oracle cards.”   --Sharon Gannon, author of Jivamukti Yoga and The Art of Yoga, Co-Creator of the Jivamukti Yoga Method.

 

The Yantra Bliss Oracle Deck, 44 Exquisite Cards For Daily Healing:

Who are we: the design team for the Yantra Bliss Oracle Deck is led by Sarah Tomlinson, yantrica, yoga teacher, and ayurvedic astrologer, whose fans include renowned yogis Shiva Rea, Krishna Das and Elena Brower. Sarah has spent more than 20 years mastering the art and meaning of the Yantras. Yantras are geometric colored images, depicting planets and deities featured in the Oracle Deck. Yantras were revealed in Northern India around 1,000 B.C., through the great scriptures. They help you harness your intuition and offer insight and understanding around aspects of your life and place in the Universe, from the mundane to the profane.

How Sarah discovered Yantras: Sarah met her teacher Harish Johari, in New York and subsequently went to India to study with him. Over her years of study, and many trips to India, he gave her his blessings to share these teachings. Through countless workshops, witnessing the individual potency of each Yantra in her students, and her own life,  she has uncovered the healing effect of each Yantra's symbolism and the wisdom teachings woven into their philosophy. 

Now Sarah feels compelled to share the images with you to use in the comfort and tranquility of your own home. This is the first time the 3,000 year-old Yantra tradition is available to the audience in a fun, easy-to-use format. Sarah's aim is to make this ancient medicine more readily available to a world in desperate need of a little more joy and goodness. With the help of designer Moriah Ray, artistic direction of Staci MacKenzie, and branding vision of Abby Allen at Neon Butterfly, this fine art project is so very very nearly ready for you.

" These beautiful cards give us a simple and tangible way to connect to the divine within and without. " --Ambika Cooper, Kirtan Walli  

Why are we campaigning? We are launching this three-week campaign to give you the opportunity to pre-order your own deck of cards, do some early holiday shopping, and to spread the word about Yantras and the Yantra Bliss Oracle Deck. This sum of money will pay for the printing of the cards, the information pamphlet and the sweet box they are housed in.

Through your contribution we will for the first time in history be able to share the wisdom teachings of this select group of Yantras (empowerment symbols) in one place for you to use as a daily practice.

" I must have a Yantra deck! The deck is brilliant, Sarah has created a special method  here to connect us with the Yantras and to stay in tune throughout your day. "  --Lara Land, Founder of Land Yoga, Harlem, NY

The Funding Will Go To: The Yantra Bliss Oracle Deck requires your contributions to pay for the printing of this first limited edition run of 1,000 card decks, the boxes and their shipping. Additional funding  will go towards distribution costs.

The breakdown:

$9,000.00 Printing

$575.00 Shipping

 

The Perks Just For You! In addition to making a financial contribution for any sum from $5-$5,000, we would like to thank-you by offering you some incredible perks: If you are one of the first 50 contributors you will receive your very own free signed Sri Yantra Print. Other perks include: Signed and blessed limited edition Yantra Bliss Oracle Decks, Hand-painted Yantras by Sarah Tomlinson, Ayurvedic Astrological Yantra Readings and guidance on how to work with your Yantras, and Private Yantra Making Classes. As you read through the perks you can see which one you would like to receive at this time. The perks will be wonderful for you and perhaps you can offer them as gifts to friends and family this holiday season.

The three hand-painted Yantras available as perks in this campaign are the 1) Moon Yantra, good for self-nourishment, 2) the Power Yantra: Bagla Mukhi, good for focus and success, and 3) the Beauty Yantra: Tripura Sundari, wonderful for aligning your life with the highest energies.

There is a beautiful new (fourth) painting in the campaign: The Sri Yantra. Contact Sarah@yantrabliss.com to see a picture of this stunning Yantra.

1) Nourishment: The Moon (no longer available)

2) Power: Bagla Mukhi (no longer available)

 

 

3) Beauty: Tripura Sundari (no longer available)

 

 

4) Sri Yantra: Perspective — Email sarah@yantrabliss.com for detail pictures of the Yantra Paintings.

 

“Working with Yantras in contemplation is a powerful and ancient technology for navigating our human experience; coupling this with the convenience and the “luck of the draw” of an exquisite deck of Yantra cards elevates this meditation to offer insights of the NOW at the pace of our times.”

Wes Stevens – CEO, VOX, Inc.

 

How Do You Use The Cards?

Each morning pick the one that calls to you, read the message and revel in the mesmerizing colors and patterns. Though it only takes a few moments, the process is centering and the results are astonishing.

You might choose a lesson from Jupiter, encouraging you to expand your business or circle of friends. Or it could be blessings from the goddess Kali showering you with the strength to move through fears and into new realms of creativity. Part meditation, part divination, whatever the message, it always seems to be exactly what you need. And it’s because this art is rooted in science and time-tested wisdom that few have access to in the West.

 

More About Us:

Sarah Tomlinson: Sarah is an author, artist, yogini, doula and mother. After becoming certified in the Jivamukti Yoga Method decades ago by David Life and Sharon Gannon, she traveled to India where she worked extensively with her mentor and teacher, the world famous, Harish Johari. Yoga Journal deemed Johari, “ Ayurveda’s Renaissance Man.” He initiated Sarah into the spiritual practice of painting Yantras and she has been practicing and teaching the ancient art ever since, for over 20 years. Her Yantra art is collected worldwide. Sarah is the author of "Nine Designs For Inner Peace" Destiny Publishing, 2008, A guide to creating the Planetary Yantras, and has a forthcoming book on Yantras coming in 2017 to be published by Shambhala Publishing. yantrabliss.com

 

Moriah Ray, M.F.A.: Moriah is an artist, designer, mother and yogini. Inspired by the Yantras in her spiritual life, Moriah came together with Sarah to create this card deck. Moriah combines her design layout skills with her knowledge of color and healing. Moriah directs the BrooklynBritt, and art and design house:  moriahray.net

 

More About The Cards: There are 44 cards, 3.75" x 5.5", printed in luscious colors. There is an accompanying fold-out instructional pamphlet. The magical healing deck is contained and protected by a beautiful box. The cards are printed in the USA.

 

Other Ways To Help: You can also contribute by sharing this campaign on your social media networks and passing the information along to friends and colleagues who may be enriched by the Art of Yantra Painting, perhaps they would like to own a Yantra for their Art Collection, and receive the healing benefits that Yantras offer, and would be happy to contribute to a unique funding opportunity like this.

 

 

There are Indiegogo share tools right here to make it easy for you to share on your social media networks or email to a friend!

Thank-you.

 

Be a part of this artistic collaboration.

Be a part of the change. Life = Art = Spirituality = Beauty = Truth = You

Sarah

story:
BIENVENIDOS!

Hello FRIENDS AND FAMILY!

As many of you know, we are producing a short film, called "The Calendar," set to shoot in August. Right now, we are in the tail-end of our fundraising, and we need your help!

EL IMPACTO!

The backbone of any film is the story, and we believe very strongly in ours.

The story involves a veteran who's dealing with a mental illness after returning from deployment, and a woman, seemingly a mere acquaintance, who is struggling with her need to "save" him. 

We are approaching this story in a honest, somewhat blunt style, and in that aesthetic, we will explore these two character's journeys as authentically as we can.

We are proud to have created a female protagonist who is human and real and well-rounded! And we are proud to have created a character who's a veteran, and yet void of the usual Hollywood cliches.

In terms of casting, we're committed to diversity. The story takes place in New York, and New York is incredibly diverse. Our actors should reflect their location.

Ellyn Long Marshall, a respected casting director, shares our sentiment about casting. She loved our script, and has signed on to be our casting director! Her casting credits include the independent hits, "Maria Full of Grace," starring Catalina Moreno, "Girlfight" starring Michelle Rodriguez, and "Real Women Have Curves," starring America Ferrerra. We're very excited to have her on board.

As you can see, every step of the way, from writing to casting to shooting, we want to make our choices reflect the heart of the story we've created. And we think that goal is often lacking in the filmmaking industry.

LA MULA!

Now let's get down to business. With your help, we hope to raise $3950, which we will spend on the following important aspects of our production:

1) FOOD! (Craft Services & Catering)
- We have a 15 person crew, who will be shooting in the summer and working long hours. We want to make sure there is an abundance of water, coffee, snacks as well as hearty meals for the cast and crew. It's our responsibility to afford this basic, yet crucial, aspect of the filmmaking process. 

2) SOUND! (Sound Mixing)
-One of the dead-giveaways of an amateur film is poor sound quality. Who wants to watch a beautiful film, if it's a strain to listen to?  We want to invest in a professional, highly skilled, sound mixer and boom operator, because skimping on sound is never a good idea.

EL SECRETO!

This campaign is to be semi-private, which means we're only sending it to friends, family and people who are involved in the project. I know this choice seems totally counter-intuitive, since we're trying to raise money. But the reason is that we will be promoting another campaign AFTER we're done shooting, which we'll hype-up like there's no tomorrow. This  second campaign will help us raise funds for our post-production costs, which involve editing, color grading, ADR, etc.

So AFTER we shoot is actually the time when we will reach out to everybody and their mama. It'll be a much better time to crowdfund to the general public, since we'll have a full cast and crew, as well as photos from the set, and even a trailer.

GRACIAS!

Thank you so much for supporting us in our lives, thus far. And we hope to take you on this journey with us.
