story:
Art throughout history is full of naked women

Lovers are very difficult to find
Girls, let's change that:


I invite you, the female artists from around the world to 

start painting, start sculpturing! Contribute your lover, too!

Deutsch Français Italiano


Goal for now is to select 99 lovers

created by contemporary female artists from around the world

and to publish them in a fine art book.

                 

The time is ripe
to show the world

how we, today's women,

eternalize our men.


1. What helps?      


1 Hour -1 Like - 1 Share - 1 Dollar                                     

Totally appreciated!

Details on how to help

2. Who am I?

Muni, the international coordinator and communicator 

I have twenty years of business experience as international coordinator and communicator. I can deliver. I can coordinate. I can teamlead.

Muni, the painter

I have inherited a lot of creativity from my forefathers, and I have been painting ever since. I have had exhibitions in Munich, Mumbai, Maloja, Buenos Aires, New York, Geneva and on Lago die Como.


        


3. How is the money spent?

  • Inviting female artists from around the world to paint and sculpture lovers
  • Creating the platform on which these lovers can be presented and admired
  • Researching, selecting & coordinating 99 lovers in the art & their artists
  • Layout & printing of "99 Lovers from around the World"
  • Professional Services (film crew, blog, website, SEO, funding specialist)


4. The chosen lovers/artists ...so far

      

I love the lovers & artists I found so far. Support me to find more and present them to you!

Please take the time to visit their websites, and if you like their art, buy it, or support them by spreading the word about them, liking them, sharing their art on facebook etc.

"A giant"

   

Ioana Niculescu-Aron, Romania
I am an art addict. I am young. I am vibrant. I am beautiful. I want to understand who I am. Who the others are. What life is all about. Painting, I find myself. Painting, I explore myself. Painting, I guess the essence of the other. Painting, I capture the essence of the other. Like I imagine a blind person slowly discovering other humans, I discover the world by painting and in sculptures. I paint. Fullstop. I am a visionary. Through my nature I love living, exploring life and then give life by coloring canvases, walls, gesso, and everything else stays in front of me. I am strong, I know this.. and even so, there is someone warmer than me – someone with huge hands and land body: a giant. A dear friend of mine calls me Solaris. Stay tuned. Follow my journey. Apart from painting the giant of course.


"My secret, cherished"

Mandy Racine, Mallorca
My paintings and drawings of male nudes are inspired by the power and movement of the male body. I explore a variety of techniques to try and capture a moment, when it's moving from one place to another. Plaster, charcoal, paint & varnish, sometimes with traces of writing are applied in a very spontaneous way and often reworked several times. Sources of inspiration are often classical subjects which I put a contemporary twist to.  


"Watchman"


Sylvia Itzen, Germany

Freelancer performer, born 1968. Since 1989 I`m working in a small village closed to Hamburg and internationally. Why do I produce art? It´s a passion and I have to do it! I need the creativity and the dialogue with different kind of material. I love round and oscillated profiles, even and textured facing. My sculptures are made out of natural stone or wooden and they are made to be touched. Art means to me creation out of an idea, somehow unique with an unreproducible effect.



"Li"

Jade, Australia

I am having a ball with the art, and am delighted to report that I'm getting commissions. But it's all about the sheer fun of it, being able to create the kind of work I always dreamed of, back in the days when I had the vision but no way to get that vision out of my head and onto canvas. I just glimpsed something new, as I typed those words, and I'll be busy with it it five more minutes!



"Bliss"

Muni, Switzerland

When I have a creative thrust, there is no holding me back. My visions are powerful.

I did not plan 99 lovers.

99 lovers chose me to bring them into life, into your perception. With your support, we can make it!



5. Celebrating your Support


6. Project-Plan




7. How was the idea born?

A friend of mine and I were sitting in the sun watching men pass by, pondering on whom of the passersby we would like to paint.

We had a ball.

Soon we discussed our favourite male nudes in the art. And realized, each single one of them was painted by a man.

This realization shocked me, so one day I sat down and started researching a bit.

The result made me sad. There are hardly any painted men. And if you finally find one, he has almost always been painted by a man.

I googled, and googled and googled. Try for yourself. Male nudes, nudes in the art.... I tried it from a different angle by googling images of contemporary female artists, country by country:

and what did I get as a result? Naked women. Or men painted by men. It seems that hardly any contemporary female artists paint or sculpture men.


The search was and is very time consuming and at the same time fascinating. To me it seemed, and this is my personal impression, you might not agree with, that we women are still very much concentrating on the body we can offer to our lover, on the body we think will excite or repulse men.

I feel the time is ripe to celebrate our lovers. To eternalize them. To show to the world, what we consider attractive, repulsive, pulsating.

Where are the contemporary female artists who paint men? Lovers? 

When I continued researching out of curiosity, I stumbled across some very interesting art, great artists, but my initial impressioned deepened. Men in contemporary art are pretty very much hidden, difficult to find.

I caught fire! I realized that if I want to change that, I cannot do it alone. I need to spread the spark, to invite artists from around the world to participate. And at the same time create a platform, on which we can then present what we create.

The idea of the blog/book "99 lovers from around the world" was born. 



8. The Team

Please book their services ;-)


Director, Film Crew & Youtube Channel Specialist

Peter Varsek and Rita Schilly were so kind as to film & edit & survive my innumerable special wishes for free. I would love to pay them for their services. They are an awesome team, if you want a filmcrew for your company, your crowdfunding campaign, wedding or other, book them!

 

Homepage

Marketing,  Webdesign, blog & SOE

Michael A. Steiner gives my ideas it's digital shape via html-coding, streamlines my creativity and makes the campaign vibrant with his marketing ideas. 

If you are looking for business advice and it's technical realization, contact him.

Homepage

Crowdfunding Advisor

David Englhardt has been active in the digital field for over five years. His professional experise includes entrepreneurship, start-ups, strategy consulting and business development in various fields. Since 2013 he is dedicating himself to crowdfunding and crowdinvesting.


 

Consultant

Dorote Lucci thinks out of the box. Her consultation is fresh, vibrant and has pushed us into thinking in new directions. She is a  Mindfulness Coach, experimenting with bringing people into the present moment experience through art, poetry and tech.

Homepage

Design & Music

Pierre is a Design Guru for Logos, CI and Flyers. With his twin brother they are RaXiNoaR. Want to start the day with good vibes? Check their music out.

Design        Music


The Support-Net:


Join and support us!

What can you do? Get involved, join the teams below. Or call your local radio station, and talk about this campaign. Order the .pdf file, have posters printed and plaster your town. Become a gateopener for your country, blog about us, contact bloggers, spread the word. Organize a "99 Lovers" chartiy event.  


99 Lovers - Multiplier & Networker:

Multipliers & Networkers have a very strong social media presence and/or network:

Pierre & Paul RaXiNoaR: www.raxinoar.com
Lidwine Reustle www.lidwinereustle.com
Tommaso di Dio: www.vongott.net 
Jens Maier: jens.maier1@gmx.de


99 Lovers - Gateopener:

Gateopeners have a strong connection to one particular country:

Cuba: Maura Rodenberg-Ruiz
Togo: Guy Marcel Tiguoe
Mallorca: Barbara Jago 
Italy: Marilena Cimmino
Marocco: Sohaila


99 Lovers - Volunteers:

Stephan Bartlakowski: www.stephan-bartlakowski.de/



99 Lovers - Feedbackteam & Constructive Critisism:

My Mamma & my sister & my friends: Thanks for believing in me, and supporting me and sharing my crazy ideas in all detail all over the years and especially for critizising me. Thanks to your honest advice I have benefitted & grown so much! 

My dearest friend Sohaila, who forced me to write a project plan, calculate budgets and pushed me with rigorous demands to give my best, just like my family. Thanks!



9. FAQs


Will the artists always be female?

I am already considering an edition by male artists of 99 Lovers from around the World. Or a totally mixed version.

And when cities participate in the "99 lovers from 99 cities" event, each city can choose the lovers they want to choose. 

Why are there no perks for buying the book "99 Lovers from around the world"?

The perks for buying a hardcopy of "99 Lovers from around the world" will be made available as soon as sufficient funds have been collected in order to layout and print the book.






Deutsch


Kunst in allen Jahrhunderten ist voll nackter weiblicher Sinnlichkeit

Liebhaber und Männer sind in der Kunst schwer zu finden. Lasst uns das ändern!

Mädels, krempelt die Ärmel hoch, packt die Ölfarben aus!
 

Wo sind Eure Liebhaber?

Es ist an der Zeit,
dass wir Frauen der Welt zeigen 
wie wir unsere Männer verewigen.

Ziel ist es jetzt erst einmal, 99 Kunstwerke zum Thema Liebhaber von zeitgenössischen Künstlerinnen aus der ganzen Welt in einem Blog und einem Buch zu veröffentlichen.


Wir freuen uns über jede Stunde, jedes Like, jeden Share, jeden Dollar

Ich bin Muni Leykauf und habe 20 Jahre Erfahrung in internationaler Projektkoordination.

Ein großes und kraftvolles Paket an Kreativität habe ich dankenswerter Weise von meinen Vorfahren geerbt. Ich hatte Ausstellungen in München, Mumbai, Maloja, Buenos Aires, New York, Genf und am Comer See.


Wofür wird das Geld verwendet? 

  • Einladung an Künstlerinnen auf der ganzen Welt, Liebhaber zu malen
  • Aufbau der Plattform, auf der diese dann präsentiert werden können
  • Layout & Druck für das Buch "99 Liebhaber"
  • Professionelle Dienste (Filmteam, Webseite/Blog, SEO)
  • Recherche und Koordination der 99 Liebhaber & der Künstlerinnen

Die Liebhaber & die Künstlerinnen 

Welche Künstlerin und welches ihrer Kunstwerke alles dabei ist, finden Sie im englischsprachigen Teil oben aufgeführt.

Wir sind noch nicht am Ziel. Mein Team und ich möchten Ihnen insgesamt 99 Liebhaber vorstellen können. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Unterstützung, damit wir noch ganz viele finden.

Nehmen Sie sich die Zeit die Webseiten der Künstler zu besuchen, sie kennen zu lernen. Und wenn Ihnen deren Werke gefallen, können Sie diese kaufen oder auf Facebook liken und teilen.








Français

L'art a toujours été plein de séduction féminile et des femmes nues

Les amants et les hommes sont difficile à trouver dans l'art. Changons cela!

Filles, laissez-nous montrer au monde, comment nous, les femmes d'aujourd'hui éternalisent les hommes.

Supportez nous, pour que je puisse créer la plateforme pour vous présenter 99 amants crées par des artistes contemporaines du monde entier et de les publier pour vous en blog et livre.

Nous vous remercions pour tout: chaque heure, chaque like, chaque partage, chaque dollar.

Je suis Muni Leykauf et j’ai vingt ans d’expérience dans la coordination et communication internationale.

J’ai recu une créativité très forte de mes ancestres et j’ai eu des exhibitions à Munich, Mumbai, Maloja, Buenos Aires, New York, Genève et sur le lac du Como.

Comment serà utilitsé l’argent?

  • Invitation aux artistes du monde entier de paintre et sculpturer des amants
  • Création del la plateforme, sur laquelle peuvent être présentés ces amants
  • Layout &  Imprimerie de "99 Amants du monde entier"
  • Services Professionels (Équipe Video, Site Web/Blog, SEO)
  • Recherche et coordination des oevre d'art et les artistes

Les Oevres d'Art sujet amant & les artistes

Veuillez prendre le temps de les regarder dans la section Anglaise. Visitez leurs sites web, achetez leur art. 

Supportez nous pour que nous puissions trouvez encore d'autres. Merci


Italiano

L’Arte nella storia e’piena di donne nude

Difficile trovare amanti nell’arte. Cambiamo tutto cio’.

Ragazze, mettete vi a dipingere!

Mostriamo al mondo come noi donne immortaliamo gli uomini.

Aiutatemi nella ricerca e nella selezione di 99 artiste contermporanee da tutto il mondo & ad introdurvele tramite blog & book.

Grazie per il vostro supporto:  1 ora – 1 mi piace – 1 condividi – 1 dollaro.

Mi chiamo Muni Leykauf ed ho 26 anni di esperienza nel campo degli affari internazionali come coordinatrice e comunicatrice  internazionale. 

Ho ereditato molta creativita’ dai miei antenati ed ho sempre dipinto.  Ho fatto mostre A Munaco, Mumbai, Buenos Aires, New York, Genova e sul Lago di Como.

Come sara’ speso il denaro?
  • Dare l'inspirazione ad altre artiste di dipingere e creare uomini nell'arte
  • Creazione della piattaforma sulla quale questi possono essere esposti
  • Layout  & stampa di “ 99 lovers da tutto il mondo”
  • Servizi professionali  (troupe cinematografica, blog, website, SEO)
  • Ricerca & coordinazione degli 99 lovers e le artiste 
Gli amanti & le artiste 

trovate nella seczione Inglese.

Vi prego di dedicare un po’ del Vostro tempo per visitare il loro websites, e se vi piace l’arte, compralo o supportali parlando di loro, amandoli, e condividendo la loro arte su facebook, etc.
story_txt:
Art throughout history is full of naked women







Lovers are very difficult to findGirls, let's change that:


I invite you, the female artists from around the world to 
start painting, start sculpturing! Contribute your lover, too!
Deutsch Français Italiano





Goal for now is to select 99 lovers
created by contemporary female artists from around the world

and to publish them in a fine art book. 







                 


The time is ripe to show the world
how we, today's women,
eternalize our men.


1. What helps?      

1 Hour -1 Like - 1 Share - 1 Dollar                                      
Totally appreciated!
Details on how to help

2. Who am I?

Muni, the international coordinator and communicator I have twenty years of business experience as international coordinator and communicator. I can deliver. I can coordinate. I can teamlead. 
Muni, the painter
I have inherited a lot of creativity from my forefathers, and I have been painting ever since. I have had exhibitions in Munich, Mumbai, Maloja, Buenos Aires, New York, Geneva and on Lago die Como.

        

3. How is the money spent?

Inviting female artists from around the world to paint and sculpture lovers

Creating the platform on which these lovers can be presented and admired

Researching, selecting & coordinating 99 lovers in the art & their artists

Layout & printing of "99 Lovers from around the World"
Professional Services (film crew, blog, website, SEO, funding specialist)




4. The chosen lovers/artists ...so far

      

I love the lovers & artists I found so far. Support me to find more and present them to you!

Please take the time to visit their websites, and if you like their art, buy it, or support them by spreading the word about them, liking them, sharing their art on facebook etc.



"A giant"

   


Ioana Niculescu-Aron, Romania
I am an art addict. I am young. I am vibrant. I am beautiful. I want to understand who I am. Who the others are. What life is all about. Painting, I find myself. Painting, I explore myself. Painting, I guess the essence of the other. Painting, I capture the essence of the other. Like I imagine a blind person slowly discovering other humans, I discover the world by painting and in sculptures. I paint. Fullstop. I am a visionary. Through my nature I love living, exploring life and then give life by coloring canvases, walls, gesso, and everything else stays in front of me. I am strong, I know this.. and even so, there is someone warmer than me – someone with huge hands and land body: a giant. A dear friend of mine calls me Solaris. Stay tuned. Follow my journey. Apart from painting the giant of course.




"My secret, cherished"



Mandy Racine, Mallorca


My paintings and drawings of male nudes are inspired by the power and movement of the male body. I explore a variety of techniques to try and capture a moment, when it's moving from one place to another. Plaster, charcoal, paint & varnish, sometimes with traces of writing are applied in a very spontaneous way and often reworked several times. Sources of inspiration are often classical subjects which I put a contemporary twist to.  



"Watchman"





Sylvia Itzen, Germany
Freelancer performer, born 1968. Since 1989 I`m working in a small village closed to Hamburg and internationally. Why do I produce art? It´s a passion and I have to do it! I need the creativity and the dialogue with different kind of material. I love round and oscillated profiles, even and textured facing. My sculptures are made out of natural stone or wooden and they are made to be touched. Art means to me creation out of an idea, somehow unique with an unreproducible effect.



"Li"


Jade, Australia
I am having a ball with the art, and am delighted to report that I'm getting commissions. But it's all about the sheer fun of it, being able to create the kind of work I always dreamed of, back in the days when I had the vision but no way to get that vision out of my head and onto canvas. I just glimpsed something new, as I typed those words, and I'll be busy with it it five more minutes!


"Bliss"




Muni, Switzerland
When I have a creative thrust, there is no holding me back. My visions are powerful. 
I did not plan 99 lovers. 
99 lovers chose me to bring them into life, into your perception. With your support, we can make it!







5. Celebrating your Support





6. Project-Plan






7. How was the idea born?

A friend of mine and I were sitting in the sun watching men pass by, pondering on whom of the passersby we would like to paint.We had a ball.Soon we discussed our favourite male nudes in the art. And realized, each single one of them was painted by a man. This realization shocked me, so one day I sat down and started researching a bit.The result made me sad. There are hardly any painted men. And if you finally find one, he has almost always been painted by a man.I googled, and googled and googled. Try for yourself. Male nudes, nudes in the art.... I tried it from a different angle by googling images of contemporary female artists, country by country:and what did I get as a result? Naked women. Or men painted by men. It seems that hardly any contemporary female artists paint or sculpture men.

The search was and is very time consuming and at the same time fascinating. To
 me it seemed, and this is my personal impression, you might not agree 
with, that we women are still very much concentrating on the body we can
 offer to our lover, on the body we think will excite or repulse men.

I feel the time is ripe to celebrate our lovers. To 
eternalize them. To show to the world, what we consider attractive, 
repulsive, pulsating.
Where are the contemporary female artists who paint men? Lovers? 
When I continued researching out of curiosity, I
 stumbled across some very interesting art, great artists, but my initial impressioned deepened. Men in contemporary art are pretty very much hidden, difficult to 
find. 
I caught fire! I realized that if I want to change that, I cannot do it alone. I need to spread the spark, to invite artists from around the world to participate. And at the same time create a platform, on which we can then present what we create. 
The idea of the blog/book "99 lovers from around the world" was born. 






8. The Team
Please book their services ;-)
Director, Film Crew & Youtube Channel Specialist
Peter Varsek and Rita Schilly were so kind as to film & edit & survive my innumerable special wishes for free. I would love to pay them for their services. They are an awesome team, if you want a filmcrew for your company, your crowdfunding campaign, wedding or other, book them!
 
Homepage



Marketing,  Webdesign, blog & SOE


Michael A. Steiner gives my ideas it's digital shape via html-coding, streamlines my creativity and makes the campaign vibrant with his marketing ideas. 
If you are looking for business advice and it's technical realization, contact him.
Homepage
Crowdfunding Advisor
David Englhardt has been active in the digital field for over five years. His professional experise includes entrepreneurship, start-ups, strategy consulting and business development in various fields. Since 2013 he is dedicating himself to crowdfunding and crowdinvesting.






 Consultant
Dorote Lucci thinks out of the box. Her consultation is fresh, vibrant and has pushed us into thinking in new directions. She is a  Mindfulness Coach, experimenting with bringing people into the present moment experience through art, poetry and tech.

Homepage
Design & Music
Pierre is a Design Guru for Logos, CI and Flyers. With his twin brother they are RaXiNoaR. Want to start the day with good vibes? Check their music out.

Design        Music

The Support-Net:



Join and support us!

What can you do? Get involved, join the teams below. Or call your local radio station, and talk about this campaign. Order the .pdf file, have posters printed and plaster your town. Become a gateopener for your country, blog about us, contact bloggers, spread the word. Organize a "99 Lovers" chartiy event.  

99 Lovers - Multiplier & Networker:


Multipliers & Networkers have a very strong social media presence and/or network:
Pierre & Paul RaXiNoaR: www.raxinoar.comLidwine Reustle www.lidwinereustle.comTommaso di Dio: www.vongott.net Jens Maier: jens.maier1@gmx.de

99 Lovers - Gateopener:
Gateopeners have a strong connection to one particular country:
Cuba: Maura Rodenberg-RuizTogo: Guy Marcel TiguoeMallorca: Barbara Jago Italy: Marilena CimminoMarocco: Sohaila

99 Lovers - Volunteers:
Stephan Bartlakowski: www.stephan-bartlakowski.de/
99 Lovers - Feedbackteam & Constructive Critisism:
My Mamma & my sister & my friends: Thanks for believing in me, and supporting me and sharing my crazy ideas in all detail all over the years and especially for critizising me. Thanks to your honest advice I have benefitted & grown so much! 
My dearest friend Sohaila, who forced me to write a project plan, calculate budgets and pushed me with rigorous demands to give my best, just like my family. Thanks!



9. FAQs
Will the artists always be female?
I am already considering an edition by male artists of 99 Lovers from around the World. Or a totally mixed version.
And when cities participate in the "99 lovers from 99 cities" event, each city can choose the lovers they want to choose. 
Why are there no perks for buying the book "99 Lovers from around the world"?
The perks for buying a hardcopy of "99 Lovers from around the world" will be made available as soon as sufficient funds have been collected in order to layout and print the book.






Deutsch
Kunst in allen Jahrhunderten ist voll nackter weiblicher Sinnlichkeit

Liebhaber und Männer sind in der Kunst schwer zu finden. Lasst uns das ändern!Mädels, krempelt die Ärmel hoch, packt die Ölfarben aus!
 

Wo sind Eure Liebhaber?
Es ist an der Zeit,dass wir Frauen der Welt zeigen wie wir unsere Männer verewigen.
Ziel ist es jetzt erst einmal, 99 
Kunstwerke zum Thema Liebhaber von zeitgenössischen Künstlerinnen aus der ganzen Welt in 
einem Blog und einem Buch zu veröffentlichen. 

Wir freuen uns über jede Stunde, jedes Like, jeden Share, jeden DollarIch bin Muni Leykauf und habe 20 Jahre Erfahrung in internationaler Projektkoordination. Ein großes und kraftvolles Paket an Kreativität habe ich dankenswerter Weise von meinen 
Vorfahren geerbt. Ich hatte Ausstellungen in München, Mumbai, Maloja, 
Buenos Aires, New York, Genf und am Comer See.

Wofür wird das Geld verwendet? 

Einladung an Künstlerinnen auf der ganzen Welt, Liebhaber zu malen
Aufbau der Plattform, auf der diese dann präsentiert werden können
Layout & Druck für das Buch "99 Liebhaber"
Professionelle Dienste (Filmteam, Webseite/Blog, SEO)
Recherche und Koordination der 99 Liebhaber & der Künstlerinnen


Die Liebhaber & die Künstlerinnen 
Welche Künstlerin und welches ihrer Kunstwerke alles dabei ist, finden Sie im
englischsprachigen Teil oben aufgeführt.
Wir sind noch nicht am
Ziel. Mein Team und ich möchten Ihnen insgesamt 99
Liebhaber vorstellen können. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Unterstützung, damit wir
noch ganz viele finden.
Nehmen
Sie sich die Zeit die Webseiten der Künstler zu
besuchen, sie kennen zu lernen. Und wenn Ihnen deren Werke gefallen, können
Sie diese kaufen oder auf Facebook liken und
teilen.









Français

L'art a
toujours été plein de séduction féminile et des femmes nues
Les amants et
les hommes sont difficile à trouver dans l'art. Changons cela!
Filles,
laissez-nous montrer au monde, comment nous, les femmes d'aujourd'hui éternalisent
les hommes.
Supportez nous, pour que je puisse
créer la plateforme pour vous présenter 99 amants crées par des artistes contemporaines du monde entier et
de les publier pour vous en blog et livre.
Nous vous
remercions pour tout: chaque heure, chaque like, chaque partage, chaque dollar.
Je suis Muni Leykauf et j’ai vingt ans d’expérience dans la coordination et communication
internationale. 
J’ai recu une
créativité très forte de mes ancestres et j’ai eu des exhibitions à Munich,
Mumbai, Maloja, Buenos Aires, New York, Genève et sur le lac du Como.
Comment serà utilitsé l’argent?

Invitation aux artistes du monde entier de paintre et sculpturer des amants
Création del la plateforme, sur laquelle peuvent être présentés ces amants
Layout &  Imprimerie de "99
     Amants du monde entier"
Services Professionels
     (Équipe Video, Site Web/Blog, SEO)
Recherche et coordination des oevre d'art et les artistes

Les Oevres d'Art sujet amant & les artistes 
Veuillez prendre le temps de les regarder dans la section Anglaise. Visitez leurs sites web, achetez leur art.  
Supportez nous pour que nous puissions trouvez encore d'autres. Merci


Italiano

L’Arte nella storia e’piena
di donne nude

Difficile trovare amanti nell’arte. Cambiamo tutto cio’.


Ragazze, mettete vi a dipingere! 
Mostriamo al mondo come noi donne immortaliamo gli uomini.

Aiutatemi nella ricerca e nella selezione di 99 artiste
contermporanee da tutto il mondo & ad introdurvele tramite blog
& book.




Grazie per il vostro supporto:  1 ora – 1 mi piace – 1
condividi – 1 dollaro.
Mi chiamo Muni Leykauf ed ho 26 anni di esperienza nel campo degli affari
internazionali come coordinatrice e comunicatrice  internazionale.  Ho ereditato molta
creativita’ dai miei antenati ed ho sempre dipinto.  Ho fatto mostre A Munaco, Mumbai, Buenos
Aires, New York, Genova e sul Lago di Como.
Come sara’ speso il
denaro?
Dare l'inspirazione ad altre artiste di dipingere e creare uomini nell'arte
Creazione della piattaforma sulla quale questi possono essere esposti 

Layout  & stampa di
     “ 99 lovers da tutto il mondo”



Servizi professionali  (troupe
cinematografica, blog, website, SEO)

Ricerca & coordinazione degli 99 lovers e le artiste

trovate nella seczione Inglese.

Vi prego di dedicare un po’ del Vostro tempo per visitare
il loro websites, e se vi piace l’arte, compralo o supportali parlando di loro,

story:
Our Story


Sleepy Robot 13 is a  handmade business started in late 2009 via Etsy. At the time I had just lost my job and was going through a deep postpartum depression after the birth of my 1st child. I started the company as a way to make a little money to keep my rent and bills paid while I looked for a new job.


Sleepy robots are tiny individually hand sculpted polymer clay robots that are full of personality, emotions and curiosity. 


What started out as a line of robot themed figurines and toys, quickly grew to include buttons, stickers, jewelry and more. 

Thanks to the success of Sleepy Robot 13' I was able to stop my job search and overcome my depression.


Between October 2009 and July 2011 I have created and sold more than 4,500 individually handmade pieces.


Sleepy Robots have been purchased as Christmas,birthday and wedding gifts. As well as mementos to inspire and support. Several bots have also made their way to soldiers in Iraq and Afghanistan.


 I have been told by many people that looking at one of my robots  brings a smile to their face. My response to that id "If my art can my make at  least one person a day smile, I've done my job".


The Impact


Funding would assist me in expanding my business to accept wholesale orders. As I am working alone from home at this time, I have had to turn down several lucrative wholesale orders and possible long term sales commitments. Additional space would allow me to bring in 2 or more interns/part time staff to assist in filling these orders and provide them with adequate work space.


In December of 2010 I was approached by a representative for Borders Inc. regarding supplying them with a considerable amount of my zombie robots to be sold in several of their retail stores. I was unable to accept the wholesale request. I could not create the the large quantity of robots and packing in the short amount of time the company needed them and keep up with my regular orders as well.


During Christmas season 2010 I made  over 650 items, shipped 400+ orders and answered/sent 285 emails by myself. I am expecting double that this year.


With the addition of at least 2 interns or part time employees many of the issues I struggled with above could be evenly handled by the 3 of us.


If my campaign is funded it will assist in creating:

-jobs and internships

-Awareness and support for small locally owned businesses

-Work shops and  Educationational opportunities for the community


This is a great opportunity to for me to offer art students in my community internships for class credit as well as useful experience running an art/craft business.


Eventually I would like to be able to offer workshops for children and adults interested in art, crafting and starting their own small arts based business.


What We Need & What You Get

 My goal to is continue to move Sleepy Robot 13 forward while staying D.I.Y (do it yourself) . To do so I need help. Help in this case equals money.


Along with making the actual products sold I am responsible for, marketing, web design, advertising, customer service, inventory, quality control, accounting, social media, purchases and shipping. On top of wearing all of these hats, 80% of my businesses current income goes back into the above mentioned fields leaving very little  left over.


 I have been very fortunate to be able to start my business with very little capital, but that is not the case with continuing to grow. 


The money raised from this campaign will be used for:


-Hiring interns and/or part time staff

-Accepting/fulfilling wholesale requests

-Making products available to retail stores

-Attending industry trade shows and events

-Webdesign

-Advertising

-Marketing

-Purchasing bulk wholesale materials

-Renting adequate manufacturing space

-Making/developing new products

-Developing community workshops with a focus on crafting and starting a handmade business.


  In addition Sleepy Robot 13 will be able to move forward with new ventures and products including but not limited to:


-Developing a children's book

- Hand silk screened T-shirts

-Developing a website specifically for wedding and event cake toppers.


  Also we could continue taking custom item requests year round (currently I can only take requests 5-6 months out of the year due to the holidays and volume of regular orders).



In return for your campaign contributions I can offer stickers, buttons, cell phone charms, T-shirt, custom robot figure, exclusive indie gogo donor exclusives and more!


If Funding Goal Is Not Reached

If my funding goal is not reachedI will not give up. I will continue running my business as I have for the last 2 years. I will continue to seek out other opportunities including similar funding sites as well as small business, arts  and women's grants.

Other Ways You Can Help


Even if you cannot donate money yourself at this time you can definitely help in other ways!


-Post a link to this page on Twitter


-Spread the word about this campaign on Facebook, Myspace or your personal blog


-Talk about it on your favorite message board


-Use the share tools located on this page


Print/cut out a few fliers and leave them at your local coffee shop, art gallery, alternative clothing store, craft show/art fair, concert venue, community bulletin board, ect... 

(Fliers can be found here:          )

story:
Hello,

My name is Jason and I'm an artist. Actually, I'm an oil painter and a lover of traditional, realistic art (think Caravaggio and Rembrandt). I have been working hard to establish my career as a classical realist for the last 12 years, and it's been going well. However, for the next stage of my professional development, I will need a little help.

This September, I will begin training at Studio Incamminati in Philadelphia. Studio Incamminati has been approved by the Art Renewal Center (ARC) and will give me the final push I need to become a world-class professional artist. With my personal determination, ambition, and work-ethic, I have high hopes for the future. As a Canadian citizen, I will be unable to have a job during my time at the studio; therefore, sources like this ease my financial burden and may even help in aquiring my student visa. I am offering unique rewards in exchange for the generosity and faith of those who support and invest in me.

What I need and what YOU get:

My goal is to raise $6000.00USD per semester to cover the cost of tuition.  There are eight semesters in the full-time professional program, and I will be launching a fresh campaign on Indiegogo a few months prior to each semester.

I believe in earning what I get, so I am offering my work in exchange for your generosity.  Each piece will be a one-of-a-kind original.  Depending on your contribution, you could get a small sketch or study, on up to a custom portrait in oils.

According to the Art Renewal Center, modern, abstract art is losing credibility and collectibility, while representational art is gaining popularity, collectibility, and value and seeing a re-emergence. Observing reviews, public discourse, and major auctions, it is plain to see this polarity shift is very real.   Between my own dedication and the prestige of Studio Incamminati, my work should only increase in value in the coming years; therefore, this is a good time to invest in my career and your art collection. 

To see my current work, check out my website at www.jasonpatrickjenkins.com.  You can expect to receive work of this caliber in exchange for your contribution.

I will also dedicate my first show after I complete my training at Studio Incamminati to all of the people who invest in me (please let me know if you wish to remain anonymous).

If I don't reach my goal, I will still find a way to study at Studio Incamminati, and the funds I do get from this campaign will still be used for tuition.  And don't worry—you will still receive your perk! In the event that I am fortunate enough to succeed beyond my goal, all funds will be put toward future semesters as advance payments.

The Impact

I want to establish myself as a traditional artist and as a classical realist.  I want to produce humanist work that provides beauty and a sense of purpose to the public and that speaks to universal truths and timeless themes; I want to help to re-kindle the public's faith in the importance of art.

My long-term goal is to pass on the knowledge I gain at Studio incamminati to the next generation of young artists, and to one day pass on those traditions in an art school of my own.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but are unable to contribute financially, there are certainly other things you can do!

  • Share my Indiegogo campaign with your friends, family, and anyone else you think might be interested.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to get started!
  • Like my Artist Page on Facebook!
  • Check out my website at www.jasonpatrickjenkins.com.
  • Marvel at my ARC gallery page.  :)

My sincerest thanks for your interest and support, 

Jason

What I need and what YOU get:
My goal is to raise $6000.00USD per semester to cover the cost of tuition.  There are eight semesters in the full-time professional program, and I will be launching a fresh campaign on Indiegogo a few months prior to each semester.
I believe in earning what I get, so I am offering my work in exchange for your generosity.  Each piece will be a one-of-a-kind original.  Depending on your contribution, you could get a small sketch or study, on up to a custom portrait in oils.
According to the Art Renewal Center, modern, abstract art is losing credibility and collectibility, while representational art is gaining popularity, collectibility, and value and seeing a re-emergence. Observing reviews, public discourse, and major auctions, it is plain to see this polarity shift is very real.   Between my own dedication and the prestige of Studio Incamminati, my work should only increase in value in the coming years; therefore, this is a good time to invest in my career and your art collection. 
To see my current work, check out my website at www.jasonpatrickjenkins.com.  You can expect to receive work of this caliber in exchange for your contribution.
I will also dedicate my first show after I complete my training at Studio Incamminati to all of the people who invest in me (please let me know if you wish to remain anonymous).
If I don't reach my goal, I will still find a way to study at Studio Incamminati, and the funds I do get from this campaign will still be used for tuition.  And don't worry—you will still receive your perk! In the event that I am fortunate enough to succeed beyond my goal, all funds will be put toward future semesters as advance payments.

The Impact
I want to establish myself as a traditional artist and as a classical realist.  I want to produce humanist work that provides beauty and a sense of purpose to the public and that speaks to universal truths and timeless themes; I want to help to re-kindle the public's faith in the importance of art.
My long-term goal is to pass on the knowledge I gain at Studio incamminati to the next generation of young artists, and to one day pass on those traditions in an art school of my own.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you want to help but are unable to contribute financially, there are certainly other things you can do!

Share my Indiegogo campaign with your friends, family, and anyone else you think might be interested.  Use the Indiegogo share tools to get started!
Like my Artist Page on Facebook!

Check out my website at www.jasonpatrickjenkins.com.
Marvel at my ARC gallery page.  :)
My sincerest thanks for your interest and support, 
Jason

story:
In the next school year many institution across Alberta will be determining the best ways to generate funding to make up the deficit due to recent budget cuts. The Alberta College of Art and Design has already felt some of the repercussions the increased pressure to generate money has had on our school. Only weeks after the end of our school year, Gord Ferguson, one of the beloved members of our community was fired after allowing one of his students to do a subversive and evocative performance in our cafeteria. One of the official statements released about the situation explained the firing was due to the apparent defamation of the school and potential loss of prospective students. After an uproar from the artists community including demonstrations, petitions, and letters from respected teachers and students across the country, Gord Ferguson was reinstated. Any person involved in the art world knows that it is part of an artists role within society to push boundaries and make people re-assess the accepted norms of how we think and act. Suddenly being “popular” (a.k.a. in good standings with those who have a heavy pocket book) was becoming more important than freedom of expression.This entire situation puts into sharp focus how the power of money has direct influence over what type of environment we are subjected to and how decisions are made within our institution. Over the next year The Alberta College of Art and Design must raise $300,000 and if that money has to come from corporations we jeopardize the future of our school as we know it. After attending budget cut meetings it is clear that failure to raise enough funds will result in reduced hours of operation, cut staff, and shutting down entire programs. It is now up to the student body of ACAD to put together all our creative forces and appeal to our community to help us raise the money ourselves, therefore giving us a bigger voice and more control over what  decisions are being made about our future as an art school.

The official ACAD website reads:

"This is a time of dynamic growth for ACAD. We are carving out a new role as a leader in cultural development and cultural research.  We have adopted a new mandate and vision; we have established our Institute for the Creative Process; and we have led public discourse on imagination, arts and community. This is also a time of unprecedented support for ACAD.  This allows us to achieve unprecedented excellence in our programs and practices which encourages others to add their support and help increase our momentum."


If budget cuts or outside funding force us to reconfigure our values of being a leading centre for creativity and innovative thought, then the integrity of being an artist is at stake....By donating to The Art Kids Revenge you are showing support for your local Canadian up and coming artists. Your donation helps maintain the quality and variety of  instruction we receive which has developed artists who make important contributions to culture and innovation across the country. 

 

The deficit is $300,000 and I have placed my goal for this portion of my fundraising at a third of this total. The failure or success of this campaign is not simply about numbers. Beyond the Indigogo campaign I have several other fund raising strategies in place over the summer, and hope to become a strong testament towards what one determined person can do. All the money donated will go towards a scholarship for the Alberta College of Art and Design. I will be appealing to the student body (my peers) to use the scholarship as an incentive to raise the same amount among themselves to put towards our deficit. By donating (any amount) you are giving direct support towards the contributions art makes to a healthy and diverse culture. By putting money in the hands of the student body we show our commitment to maintaing an artistic institution which is respondent to the needs of its students and not its payroll.

So this is it- the art kids revenge. We are lovers of the under ground, and naturally the under dogs. Theatre, dance, music, and fine arts always seem to be the first to be dismissed during budget cuts- but we still learn how to thrive. We use our passion and creative problem solving capacities to find new ways to succeed. With your help we can say ^%#$ the big corporations, @%^% the government- the only thing we need to support ourselves is to prove our passion, appeal to our community and silently exact the perfect Art Kids Revenge: Using our art to support our arts education - an energy flow that makes sense.

story:
Beauty For a Cause!

PinTuP girls began a calendar contest for classic pin-up style models on April 1, 2013 to help raise money for Building Blocks For Kids.  Please check out our gallery for a sneak peek at just a few of our models!

Help us get this calendar printed and help a family that really needs it!

Building Blocks For Kids is a non-profit organization that provides assistance to families of children with health-related needs. To read more about this amazing organization, please go to their website.  http://bb4k.org. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • ANY dollar amount.  No donation is too small, or too big for that matter! We want to do all we can for Building Blocks For Kids. We accept credit cards and checks!
  • Don't want to give cash? We also accept gift cards and/or “prize packs”.   Prize packs can include a mix of gift cards and/or branded merchandise from your business.

Anyone who donates to our cause will be entered to win a free, signed copy of the calendar and/or a free ticket to the launch event.  Other prizes may be added during the donation period.

How do I donate? 

Paypal is our first choice!  Please send any donations to pintupgirls@gmail.com.    Prize packs, gift cards and checks can be be picked up, locally, by a PinTuP Girls representative.  If you are not a local business and would still like to send a prize pack, gift card or check, please contact PinTuP girls via email at pintupgirls@gmail.com

The fine print...kinda

PinTuP Girls is in no way a charity organization, nor or we officially affiliated with any charity. Building Blocks For Kids was chosen as the charity we want to support based on careful research and consideration.  PinTuP girls is committed to improving the lives of those around us. Full disclosure of the PinTuP Girls donation to Building Blocks For Kids will be provided at the close of calendar sales.

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD!  The more we get this out, the more money we can raise for Building Blocks For Kids.


If you have any questions, please contact us at pintupgirls@gmail.com

THANKS SO MUCH!!

story:
Hello, I'm Dee, some of you know me as ddkinzart from social media, and I'm really excited to share this pin campaign with you— it has been one of my new year's resolutions to get into pin making and launch my own collection and this is my very first one!!

By contributing to this campaign, not only will you help fund these cute fruity pins but would also be aiding me in launching one of my dreams ♡ 

☆ There are currently 8 designs available to unlock, but should this project be successful, I am excited to work on and add even more designs for you ☆

If you've never used Indiegogo before then thank you for allowing me to be your first!! Here's a brief introduction of how it works, much like Kickstarter, Indiegogo is a crowdfunding platform, however as opposed to Kickstarter operating in only a few countries, Indiegogo is available in a much wider range, including where I'm currently situated: Dubai. 

☆ By choosing a perk, you will be both helping in the funding of the pins as well as pre-ordering the reward chosen, which means once the campaign ends and the pins have been manufactured, your items will be shipped out to you! ☆

Keep in mind, this is a fixed funding project, which means if the initial goal is not met, you will be refunded and I will not receive any of the funds. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me ♡ 

Once the campaign ends, I will be sending out a survey to all my backers via e-mail to fill, where you can choose which design you would like to order. 500$ is the minimum for any Indiegogo campaign which means the project will not go through / be funded, unless both the first two designs are unlocked. 

☆ If you are backing this project, please make sure to occasionally check your e-mail for any updates and the survey ☆

  • 75% Manufacturing
  • 10% Shipping
  • 5% Packaging
  • 10% Indiegogo Fees

☆  Each design will cost approximately $250 to produce, these funds will go into manufacturing, the packaging ( backing cards ), indiegogo fees, shipping and a bit extra in case of any emergencies or unaccounted for expenses ☆ 

☆ Every pledge is set at a discounted pre-order price
☆ Additional discounts are available for limited early bird orders
☆ You can add a vinyl sticker to your perk for an additional $2 per sticker

☆ Fund Raising: Mid April - End of May
☆ Indiegogo Review + Surveying: 2 weeks
☆ Production ( 4 to 6 weeks ): May - June
☆ Shipping ( 2 weeks ): June - July

This is a very rough estimate of the time line and should things run smoothly, you will have your pins in your hand by June, or July at most. All pins will be shipped via registered mail with a tracking number.

☆ I will always keep you updated on the progress / process of the campaign but keep in mind I have no control over things from the manufacturers side, nor if there any delays with the mail AFTER I send over the package from my side.

☆ Keep in mind the colors displayed are just a mock up, and colors vary from one screen to another, therefore, there might be very slight differences in the actual size and color of the product itself when produced.

☆ While I have worked on campaigns before, this is my first pin campaign and my first time manufacturing pins in such a large amount. I will work very hard to ensure things run smoothly, however should any errors occur during manufacturing or shipping or other unforeseen problems which could cause a slight delay in the timeline, backers will be notified immediately. 

Thank you so much to everyone who supports me and my art, I would not have the courage to pursue new concepts and goals had it not been for your support and encouragement! Any support, be it through backing the campaign or sharing the word through social media, means the world to me.

If you can spread the word and share this in any way — please do! 

You all have my eternal gratitude and I hope we can run a successful project together! ♡

You all have my eternal gratitude and I hope we can run a successful project together! ♡

story:
Hello to everyone! My name is Matthew and I have been drawing  since I was very young.  Besides music,  art has been my only  passion .   It's the only thing I love doing  and I   Would love to put  pictures on people. I love tattoos with all my heart because there so much passion behind an artists piece.  

Recently I got offered a position as an apprentice at a tattoo  parlor close to my house and was completely overjoyed!  I couldn't believe that  after  all my hard work  and dedication it was finally going to pay off!  

Currently I work  at a retail store in Iowa city, Iowa  for minimum wage which is 7.25/hour .  The equipment that I need to start tattooing isn't cheap and I really have no idea how to come up with the money.  My brother is the one who told me to try this site where I could possibly get help.   My brother and I don't come from any kind of money and have worked really hard for  what we have.  I'll continue to keep working hard regardless of how this turns out.   I know that you have to work hard to get what you want from life and this is all I've ever wanted!  

Every little bit counts and I feel like I'm not asking for too much.  I just need help and I have no one to turn too. I don't know anyone with good enough credit to co sign a loan for me and I work for minimum wage and have a family to take care of.   By family I mean fiancé and a 2 year old golden retriever.  

I'm ready to move onto the next chapter of my life and I am asking for your help.  Any little bit will get me closer to my dream of owning my own tattoo shop and putting beautiful art on anyone with the eye for tattoos.


Thank you too all who take the time to read this through to the end  and  any assistance will help!  

Sincerely ,

Matthew

Join your West Irondequoit neighbors in getting out the vote!  I vote lawn sign printing cost was $600, so please contribute a few dollars if you're able to support the cause.

Design work generously donated by Jan Cunningham Design, Inc.

Find I vote on Facebook: on.fb.me/1udPuTO.

story:
A Bit About Me


Short Summary 

My name is Silvia Taylor and I am currently an Artist-In-Residence at Harbourfront Centre, in downtown Toronto. I have always been infatuated with the rapport between glass and metal. I play with this interaction of mediums with my current sculptural work and in the past year I have started exploring installation projects. However helpful, I can’t obtain the necessary skills or experience to execute effectively the installation work by reading or discussing ideas with those more experienced. I need hands-on experience to create the installations I plan on making in the future. In short, I have done the research, and have come up with several solutions, but I need help to make it happen!

I have been granted the rare opportunity to attend Penland School of Craft this summer for a two week course, with a partial scholarship. This campaign is my attempt to fund the other half of the workshop and cover travel expenses. 

The class I was accepted into is called 'Sculpture, Installation, & Form', taught by Pamela J. Wallace. It covers the basics of blacksmithing with a special consideration of incorporating mixed media. Pamela's work is absolutely amazing, her compositions and use of mixed media is considerate and canny.  

www.pamelajwallacesculpture.com

I believe that this workshop will be an invaluable experience to me, complete with the opportunity to collaborate and network with many other artists from around the world! Thank you for reviewing my Indiegogo campaign. Your support is truly appreciated!


My goals & What You Get

My goal is to raise $2,000.

This will allow me to cover the remaining portion of the workshop ($1,300), this includes material costs and tuition; and travel expenses ($700), Penland School of Craft is located outside of Asheville, North Carolina USA.

In exchange for your generous donations I will be offering *SPECIAL PRICES* on work from my NEW production line, ALLUVIAL GLASS!
These items will never been marked at this price again, so take the incentive and donate to a great cause (for a great price)!!

Please check out the website for more photos and information

www.silviataylor.ca


The Impact

My hope is that this workshop will have a dramatic impact and expand my body of work. I hope it will give me the tools I need to explore installation. It will be an invaluable experience for me! Penland is an amazing school with workshops taught in multiple disciplines including iron, glass, jewelry, photography, printmaking, drawing, weaving, and woodworking. I will be in the woods with an intense group of artists for two weeks ….I cannot say that there is much else I would rather do! Please donate to help me make it happen!


Risks & Challenges

It is hard to justify spending the money on a two week workshop when rent is always a struggle to pay and three meals a day, is a very good day. But it is important to keep looking forward and take necessary risks. I see this workshop as an investment, and hope that you too can see this in a similar way. It is already a risk pursuing the career i have chosen for myself but it is my passion and my life! I trust that this workshop will be the next milestone along my career path, any help is truly appreciated.


Other Ways You Can Help

Strapped for cash?! I know the feeling! If you can't donate and you want to help please share my indiegogo campaign with friends, family, and colleagues who may be interested. Make some noise and spread the word! Anything will help!!


Shipping

Items do not include shipping expenses. An additional fee will be charged through PayPal (under my name). Prices for shipping will vary by size of item and distance. I will be sending things out as soon as i get your information from Indiegogo! Hopefully soon! If you would like the items sooner please send me your information privately. Picking up items is always an option! Send me an email and we can meet at Harbourfront! Thanks in advance and sorry for the inconvinience!

to help me make it happen!  Risks & Challenges  It is hard to justify spending the money on a two week workshop when rent is always a struggle to pay and three meals a day, is a very good day. But it is important to keep looking forward and take necessary risks. I see this workshop as an investment, and hope that you too can see this in a similar way. It is already a risk pursuing the career i have chosen for myself but it is my passion and my life! I trust that this workshop will be the next milestone along my career path, any help is truly appreciated.  Other Ways You Can Help
Strapped
for cash?! I know the feeling! If you can't donate and you want to help please
share my indiegogo campaign with friends, family, and colleagues who may be
interested. Make some noise and spread the word! Anything will help!!ShippingItems do not include shipping expenses. An additional fee will be charged through PayPal (under my name). Prices for shipping will vary by size of item and distance. I will be sending things out as soon as i get your information from Indiegogo! Hopefully soon! If you would like the items sooner please send me your information privately. Picking up items is always an option! Send me an email and we can meet at Harbourfront! Thanks in advance and sorry for the inconvinience!

story:
Hi, my name is Kerrie and ever since I was a little girl living in France with my family, I’ve wanted to be an artist. All of my adult life, I’ve been chipping away at HOW to make this dream my full-time occupation in realistic ways, and still afford a roof over my head. For 35 years, I’ve lived in the same PNW university community and raised my own child who is successfully chasing dreams of her own out in the world. 

                                   

While the price for my current artist abode matches the local market average, it is beyond reach for an independent artist to purchase alone. Now, I have an opportunity to buy the duplex that I’ve lived in for the past 5 years, a home to me that is perfectly situated within walking/biking distance to both the university and the downtown art scene.

That’s where you come in- with the enthusiastic support of culture lovers of all kinds, I can finally settle one of the biggest hurdles to my childhood dream: that of having a permanent studio and home I can depend on, to ramp up my creative concentration and output at long last.

Oh, and buying this duplex provides a permanent home for one of my muses, who loves his peaceful perches throughout the house.

What your contribution helps me achieve is MAJOR stress relief at a critical juncture between funding cycles on the community art project I am working on, and have been working on for three years now, as a recent university graduate in French.

Home ownership is potent- it changes brain chemistry. That kind of peace of mind finds its way into my sense of confidence and wonderfully affects everything I see and do as an artist.

I am free to value everything more, and I am more freed up to focus energy and attention on the current community art project I have been collaborating on with partners at the university and in the local community. A sophisticated project that will add to the public's discovery of not only a precious cultural legacy, but to one's own knowledge of just how valuable one’s eyes, perceptions and perspectives are. Yet, to move through this critical juncture in the community art project, I must stabilize my housing and studio requirements so I am free to remain to concentrated on the necessary work over the next 12 months, in order to reach our goals of getting the project in front of next level investors by this time next year.


                                                                                       
The duplex is on the market for $229k.                                                                                          I am asking you to help me raise $239k to achieve full successful purchase, with just enough to cover the costs in the first year of ownership, while I devote my attentions to the success of impending community art project goals as briefly described above.

Please know that every single donation amount counts toward the goal of beating the odds for funding my dream of buying my first home so, don't be put off by the total here. Even if the campaign falls short, and we only raise say 1/3rd of the total-  I will choose to rent locally, and maybe we will have achieved raising enough funding so that I am free to focus on the community art project for the next twelve months.

Either way, because I've chosen to make this a Flexible Funding campaign- I will keep what we do raise and put it to good use. And that's ok, too.
In fact, my blog is a good place to keep up with what comes with me, and with the community art project, after this campaign ends- 40 days after it is launched.
And since beyond my housing, the first priority is the community art project- there are development goals that can definitely benefit from whatever funds may prove to be extra. Such as replacing my computer that recently gave up the ghost after working like a draft horse non-stop for years. I miss it, and my project work needs it.

Obviously, owning one’s home provides emotional and psychological solvency in America. Remember that very independent child I alluded to raising on my own? What words can describe the shift for her to know that her idealistic dreamer of an only parent has finally accomplished the stable, solid life that I’ve always told my child is possible in this country, when one keeps working hard towards one's dreams and goals.

As a young child growing up in France for a few significant years in my childhood, my father was stationed there as a pilot in the US Military. It was he who instilled in me our national ideals; to believe in one’s self, trust in our freedoms, represent our country well, and to work hard towards one’s goals for the best potential in one’s community.

As an adult, artist and parent, I have worked hard and taken responsibility for choosing and being chosen by art, by showing up in the studio and on location to produce a body of work that has been exhibited locally, continues to attract a following, and long-term patron support.

I have and do volunteer in my spiritual and community educational environments, where I have cultivated the Looking/Seeing Project that I have taught ages from 2-92.

Over time, that project has evolved and today it continues to be refined and get adapted, as I learn and collaborate to take it into mobile technology. In smart phone technology more people in and visitors to our community get to access our community’s permanent cultural legacy, called the Percent for Art Collection. We are building it with an engaging learning model that makes the encounter enriching and enjoyable for everyone. No background in the arts is required!


 In order for me to keep up my momentum as an artist going forward on this project, a project that ultimately benefits everyone, it is critical that I secure my current housing now. I can do this with your help.

Because we are so close on this community art project, I must keep moving forward, and it is your contribution that will enable me to buy my own home, so I can continue my work on the community art project.

Click here for a brief look at a Prezi presentation of the community service art project idea.
For the past three years while I was at the university, the idea for the community access to public art project took shape. When I first shared the initial concept with the student provost’s office, the idea was met with resounding acknowledgment and support. This truly continues to be an important moment to me. Since 2011, I have collaborated across academic programs and disciplines to attract partners I have successfully collaborated with, to realize the proof-of-concept, and to build a consensus community of support.  

                                     

Over this time, this project has become more than a full-time job for me, and even though support has hit a temporary funding gap at the end of 2nd-stage refinements, the work of innovation must continue moving forward no matter what.

Now, with my current home on the market, I turn to you- my community for help because without you, I will face no housing for the immediate future.

Therefore, I ask that you will support my campaign to stay on track on the community service art project, by helping me to buy my home.

With your support, the loss of time and the diversion of energy becomes an avoided crisis for this dedicated artist- busy innovating something new and enjoyable for all of us, for years to come.

And without your help, I immediately face being without a home by September 1, 2014. From that point, I will need to divert all of my commitments to the art project, to finding another paying job, and  to saving enough money over the coming months in order to afford a new place to live, all of which takes time as you know. Meanwhile there are storage costs, and the loss of very valuable momentum needed to stay on the community art project. A project I will not quit, because we have all come a long way on its initial creation and development, and are all just turning a critical corner to having a refined prototype that will capture successful investment in the next 12 months.

As an artist, I have been pursuing my dreams to function successfully within my chosen career for many years, and I have learned a lot about perseverance in the process. Raising my child well at the same time is a testament to all that it takes for us to do a good job in this life.

               

                                                                       


Indeed, recently earning that degree in French, reflecting parallel lifelong dreams, is also to say, I know how to keep my focus on something and someone I believe in and value, like my daughter, and my community. I also know how to reach my goals through perseverance, hard work and sometimes we all need just a little help.

               

The same is true with my motivation to buy my house.                                                                                                                                                  

As much of this campaign description in which I am asking you to help me buy my house, includes describing how much I am currently working between funding cycles on the community art project- a project that must continue moving forward in order to successfully attract the next investment resources- there are some of you who simply cannot contribute money.

That's ok, because everyone CAN still contribute support, EVERYONE who wants to, CAN help! By sharing your enthusiasm for culture, and telling everyone that you know, see on the street, have lunch with, see at the store, are affiliated with, go to church, school, work or live with- about the local independent community project artist who is trying to buy her first home with everyone’s help!

Don’t be shy talking to anyone about this campaign.

You love art, music, dance, writing, theater or any combination of the arts, right?

Together we can make this campaign successful, and I believe that's all there is to it. Thank-you, from the bottom of my heart.

story:
Investigation at House, SE15 1PT is a project that brings together 12 young artists to exhibit in an existing three-storey residence in the heart of Peckham, in South East London. The house will be transformed into an art space for one night on 15 June 2013, and we are hoping that you can help us realise our vision.

The Investigation series is an ongoing project between Hanqing and Rianna, who are both interested in the permanence of space. The centrality of the project lies in an attempt to separate space from place, or make one from the other. It stages a meaningful encounter between the viewer and a recognisable space that is subverted, molded and played around with.

A photo of the living room

We are interested in art that people can relate to, or be excited by. We aren't too crazy about white walls in a gallery with clean white floors to match, but spaces that we step in and out of every day. It is important that art is not just made by artists for the art world, and that we see its possibility in spaces in the "real world". In staging this encounter we invite you, the viewer, into a personal space where you will find familiarity anc comfort being challenged in numerous ways.

We sent out a call for submission of proposals in late March and in April we selected 12 proposals to be realised for our show. We have been meeting regularly since then, staying in contact with every member and urging each project forward. From traditional paintings to performance to crazy ideas involving whirlpools and bathtubs, we have tried to gather a wide variety of works with equal depth of ideas.

Adeeb Ashfaq

The art exhibition is on for a single night on 15 June 2013, a Saturday night where the house will be completely taken over by the artworks. 

Artists involved

Adeeb Ashfaq
Kat Buchanan
The Fluent Collective
Ana Gold
Robert Mckenzie
Hanqing Miao and Rianna Suen
Badr Mukred
Julia Parks and Faun Nash
Adam Ralph
Alexis Sinchongco
Calvin Tan
Giselle Tanabe

The Fluent Collective #2

How you can help

We have a lot of support from fellow students and friends who are very eager to see our progress and it's been very inspiring to chart the amount of interest in our project. However, to realise our plans fully and to support the artists involved, we need your help and support, for which we will be truly grateful.

Transport and Logistics

We are trying to be ambitious with our works, not letting scale stop a project, but with that comes logistical concerns of transportation of work and installation. It is very likely we will require the hire of a van to bring the works into the house.

Publicity

To raise awareness of the project we have been planning the creation of a website as well as print materials - posters and postcards to spread the word about our ambitious show. 

Art materials

Art-making is becoming increasingly expensive, especially here in London. Being art students means that we have learnt tricks in cutting corners, but not everything has an economical replacement and sometimes, money has to spent getting a piece of work exactly how it should be. 

"Tramonto" by Badr Mukred

Event needs

Every art opening comes with drinks and publicity materials. For the night itself we will be needing a budget for everything to make the night as memorable and enjoyable as possible - a reasonable amount of drinks, lights, light snacks and printed flyers with the floorplan and artist blurbs to guide the viewers around.

The catalogue

A hand bound catalogue of works will be produced after the event, with images of each work, sketchbook excerpts, artist statements and more alongside an extended review of the show. Every artist will be receiving a copy of this, and we will be taking orders on the night itself for a limited run of the book. The only other place to get it is here as one of the rewards. We have already started planning this with one of the artists - Badr Mukred, who is also a graphic designer. As this is the first show in a series, this publication will take on increasing importance as the series progresses. 

 "Photo 23/46" by Julia Parks

Hanqing and Rianna both study Fine Art at Central Saint Martins College of Art and Design in London. Hanqing is originally from Singapore and her practice revolves around resolving distances. Rianna is from London and has an interest in site-specifity.

story:
Hey there!

Thanks for stopping by! I appreciate any interest this brings, hopefully it will spread!

My name is Patrick Larson, I'm a 25 year old living in Southern Pennsylvania. Right now I'm attending college full time in Salem County, New Jersey, to learn how to blow glass for the scientific glass technologies field. I also work as close a I can to full time every week at my job at GreatGlas in Newark, Delaware. Typically Monday-Friday I'm in 3 if not 4 different states, drive close to 100 miles a day, and am away from my house for a span of twelve hours or so.

I'm missing something I desperately need, and it has come to a point where I need to take the necessary steps to ensure that not another month goes by where I don't have the option of honing my craft in the comfort of my own home.

At this point in the game Ive been flameworking for almost five years on and off, I finally got my own torch this summer! That has been great, finally becoming one with a tool I use... But as I covered earlier I'm living in Pennsylvania, my torch is set up in my friend's shop out in New Jersey. I want to bring it home to me. I want to have the option of being able to go downstairs and melting some glass.

I've decided at this point whether I meet my goal of getting this kiln or not I'm going to do this move. It is crucial to the development of my understanding of glass, and how it works. The only way to become a better glass blower is the same way you become great at anything, lot of blood, sweat, tears, dedication, hard work, and practice. whether or not I meet my goal monetarily.

MY GOAL: To blow glass EVERYDAY no questions asked.

My birthday is coming up, October 1st. I'm going to be turning 26 years old. I guess I'm asking anyone that would like to contribute to do so. I set a goal of $900.00 This will cover the cost of the kiln and shipping of the kiln entirely with maybe some money left over that will go towards O2. I'm running this though til October 15th because I realize it's super short notice. ANY Contribution helps this artist start his career.

I thank you all for your time.

Have a great day.
