story:
Who Are We

City Hearts is a non-profit organization providing the highest quality visual and performing arts classes to the most-at-risk children in the most economically stressed neighborhoods in southern California.

Established in 1984 by, former-ballerina turned criminal defense attorney, Sherry Jason and her husband attorney Bob Jason, City Hearts goal is to enhance self-esteem, creativity, literacy, social and academic skills while strengthening the health and vitality of the children and their community. City Hearts was founded on the belief that the Arts can and do help rehabilitate troubled youth who are plagued by drugs and gangs. City Hearts is now an integral part of the prevention and rehabilitation efforts in Los Angeles’ inner city. City Hearts inspires a love of the Arts, an appreciation of creative discipline and respect for the creative process, enabling children and youth to be confident, imaginative, tolerant, generous and cooperative, as well as caring contributing participants in the global community. The program is a model for youth diversion programs nationwide. City Hearts currently reaches over 600 inner city, abused, homeless and court-affiliated youth each week.

Shakespeare Challenge Dance Recital and Photography Exhibition

Every year, City Hearts concludes its visual and performing arts classes with an event called the Shakespeare Challenge Dance Recital and Photography Exhibition. On May 31st, in the beautiful, outdoor amphitheater of Theatricum Botanicum, Shakespeare students will perform scenes and monologues for a panel of guest and celebrity judges, dance and musical theater will perform and an exhibition of the photography students will be displayed. This unique event gives City Hearts students, ages 5 through 18, the chance to showcase what they’ve learned over the past year.

The City Hearts visual and performing arts classes include:

  • Shakespeare
  • Photography
  • Acting
  • Musical Theater
  • Improvisation
  • Ballet
  • Jazz dance
  • Hip Hop
  • Stomp
  • Fabric Arts
  • Folk/Reggae/World Music
  • Drumming
  • Percussion
  • Guitar
  • Playwriting
  • Puppetry

What Makes Us Different

City Hearts seeks out sites not currently being served by other arts organizations.  We target our community’s most impoverished and under-served children who have no other access to Arts enrichment and education. City Hearts provides programs to Charter & Title 1 schools, to organizations, youth and family centers, cultural and community organizations, and supports partnerships with these organizations.  Particularly during these challenging economic times, when families and communities are in crisis, and underserved schools and youth and family centers, lacking money, cannot afford the bus transportation needed to participate in the currently existing Arts programs, City Hearts programs reach youth within their own neighborhoods and help provide much needed services.

Why We Need Your Help

All of the City Hearts classes are free-of-charge to the children. But it takes cold hard cash to make it happen. Our funding comes through grants and from wonderful people like you. We hope you'll decide to make a difference in a child's life and donate. Any amount would be appreciated. Our budget breaks down into the following categories:

Classes – 37%

(regular instruction, master classes, Parent Participation Nights, class supplies)

Performances – 26%

(rehearsals, costumes, props, equipment rentals, venue rental, student bus transportation, etc.)

Marketing – 12%

(marketing material, flyers, programs, banners, flags etc.)

Indiegogo Fees – 11%

(6.75% for Indiegogo and 4% for the FirstGiving non-profit payment processing fee)

Insurance – 4%

Administration Costs – 10%


The City Hearts Team

The City Hearts Team is made up of management and faculty that are highly trained in their respective artistic discipline with years of experience working with our particular demographic, along with business and community leaders that bring diverse and valuable perspectives to the organization.

City Hearts Team Members

Scott Sykes – City Hearts Board President: Vice President Fixed Income, Capital Group Companies, Inc.; Americorps National VISTA, Rebuilding Together; Everybody Wins!; 4 years with City Hearts

Sherry Jason – City Hearts Founder/Director: Attorney-at-law, Director of Ballet of Topanga, Dance Educators of America; 29 years with City Hearts

Jane Donaldson – City Hearts Executive Director: Fabric Arts Designer and Instructor; 14 years with City Hearts

Bob Jason – City Hearts Founder: Attorney at Law, LA County Public Defender; 29 years with City Hearts

Jim Chressanthis – Board Member: ASC, Major Documentary & Feature Film Cinematographer, Photographer, DGA member, Motion Picture & Television Fund volunteer; new board member

Dean Deruise – Board Member: Investigator, LA County Public Defender’s Office; 8 years with City Hearts

Adam Latham – Board Member: Professional Photographer; 10 years with City Hearts

Carolyn Niner – Board Member: Vice Pres. Fixed Income, Capital Research Co., Chartered Financial Analyst; 2 years with City Hearts

Ed O’Neill – Board Member: Engineer, Contractor, Developer, Owner of Drilling and Construction Co.; Topanga Historical Society; new board member

Wendi Reagan – Board Member: Branch Manager, US Bank; new board member

John Sandoval – Board Member: Business Systems Analyst, Deloitte Tax, LLP, Financial and Consulting Firm; City Hearts graduate, member and teacher; 12 years with City Hearts

Paul Sears – Board Member: Certified Public Accountant, Financier, Investor, Philanthropist; 4 years with City Hearts

Dick Weaver – Board Member: President, PR Works and Tale Weaver Publish; 4 years with City Hearts

Karen Lee – Junior Board Mentor: Investment Group Assistant, Capital Group Co., Inc; Community Service Program: Everyone Wins!; 6 years with City Hearts

Martin Schmitt – Advisory Council: Internet Innovator, Cars.co, Philanthropist, Kayangel.org; 12 years with City Hearts

Felice Willat – Advisory Council:Professional Photographer, Member of Gallery Orvis; 1 year with City Hearts

Calvin Banks – Instructor: teaches guitar, Folk, Reggae and World music; 1 year with City Hearts

Katie Dalsemer – Instructor: teaches art and photography; 15 years with City Hearts

Claudia Donovan – Instructor: teaches dance and musical theater; 2 years with City Hearts

Karen Furno – Instructor: teaches acting, dance, musical theater and Shakespeare: 4 years with City Hearts

Charles Maceo – Instructor: teaches Shakespeare; 6 years with City Hearts

Brian Nieman – Instructor: teaches photography: 4 years with City Hearts

Gwendolyn Oliver – Instructor: teaches ballet, jazz dance, hip hop, stomp, drama, musical theater, improv and fabric arts: 14 years with City Hearts

Yvonne Senat – Instructor: teaches Shakespeare, Commedia dell'arte and dance; 2 years with City Hearts

Eric J. Stein – Instructor: teaches Shakespeare, improvisation, percussion, musical theatre and percussive dance; 11 years with City Hearts

Raul Vega – Instructor: teaches photography; 4 years with City Hearts 

Amelia Lampard – Junior Board President: Student

Amalia Astin – Junior Board Member: Student

Saisha Brody – Junior Board Member: Student

Mollyann Davis – Junior Board Member: Student

Maya Eliahou – Junior Board Member: Student

Leah Duff Gutentag – Junior Board Member: Student

Taylor Sietsema – Junior Board Member: Student


How Can You Get Involved

In these tough economic times, not everyone can donate.  If you could forward our Indiegogo page to a friend or two, who might consider donating, that would be lovely. If you could “like” our City Hearts Facebook page, that would be wonderful. Or, just sending us “good wishes” would make our day. Thank you for visiting our Indiegogo page.

You can check us out on Facebook, Twitter  and on our website, www.cityhearts.org. See the links below.
story_txt:
Who Are WeCity Hearts is a non-profit organization providing
the highest quality visual and performing arts classes to the most-at-risk
children in the most economically stressed neighborhoods in southern California.
Established in 1984 by, former-ballerina
turned criminal defense attorney, Sherry Jason and her husband attorney Bob
Jason, City Hearts goal is to enhance self-esteem, creativity,
literacy, social and academic skills while strengthening the health and
vitality of the children and their community. City Hearts was founded
on the belief that the Arts can and do help rehabilitate troubled youth who are
plagued by drugs and gangs. City Hearts is now an integral part
of the prevention and rehabilitation efforts in Los Angeles’ inner
city. City Hearts inspires a love of the Arts, an appreciation of
creative discipline and respect for the creative process, enabling children and
youth to be confident, imaginative, tolerant, generous and cooperative, as well
as caring contributing participants in the global community. The program is a
model for youth diversion programs nationwide. City Hearts currently
reaches over 600 inner city, abused, homeless and court-affiliated youth each
week.Shakespeare Challenge Dance Recital and
Photography Exhibition

visual and performing arts classes with an event called the Shakespeare

story:
The summer of 2014 saw the beginning of an amazing program:

The Ayatana Artist Research Program hosts artists from around the world while they experience natural phenomena with the guidance of scientists and non-art experts.  In this first summer we ran three projects with 10 artists and 14 experts who studied either biology and wildlife or the sky and flight. The artists grew glow in the dark mushrooms, climbed sacred trees, flew stunt kites, looked through microscopes and telescopes, howled at the super moon, chased invasive crabs and some of them jumped out of an airplane all the while learning from the shared knowledge of our crew of experts. The artists have now gone back to their respective homes and built a book.

The artists involved:
Helga Jakobson, Winnipeg, Canada
Susan Rochester, Oregon, USA
Natalie Draz, Montreal, Canada
Sophie Lindsey, Portsmouth, England
Laura Grossett, Colorado, USA
Sarah Fagan, Oregon, USA
Rahni Allen, Tasmania, Australia
Elena Thomas, Washington, USA
Cara Cole, BC, Canada
Alexis Williams, Ontario, Canada

The Plan:
Together the books form a collection of 11 volumes: a catalogue and one book made by each of the 10 artists involved. We'd like to  give a copy of the collection to each of our experts and to artist's book libraries around the world.  But printing is expensive.   So we will print more copies and post them to contributors. If you buy a copy you will also be sponsoring the production of a copy to be given as a gift to one of our experts or a public collection.

The Books:
Our collection of pocket sized books includes a 50 page catalogue of all the artists and the experts involved:
                                                                   catalogue
Artist's books:
Each artist has made a single simple book.  They vary in format and are completely different in content. They are all the same dimensions and stack together tidily. They will all be printed and assembled for you by hand. If you only want one book you can chose which artist's book is for you. Or you can have them all:

Susan Rochester

Analysis  by Helga Jakobson (A scientific account of a magic spell)


Twenty Eight Tides: A Lunitidal Bioclock  by Natalie Draz

Snow Covers Blood  by Cara Cole


Pull by Sarah FaganGaining Height, Methods of Flight, Falling Right by Elena Thomas


Breeding by Laura Grossett


How to Throw Yourself at the Ground and Miss: Instructional Guide to Attaining Orbital Velocity by Rahni Allan

A Science Fiction Guide to Mushrooms by Sophie Lindsey


Drift by Alexis Williams


You can see more about the artists involved here.
You can see more about Ayatana Artist Research Residencies here.
You can see the stickers available here.
You can see the experts involved here. (But don't tell them about this, it's a surprise)

We will donate one collection of 11 books to each of these libraries :

Biblioteque National du Quebec

Musee d’Art Contemporian de Montreal, Archives et Mediatheque

Brooklyn Art Library

Anchor Archive Zine Library

The Museum of Modern Art Library 

Bienes Museum of the Modern Book

Artexte

Banff Centre Collection

Emily Carr Artist's Book Collection

Vaughan Memorial Library, Acadia University

Museum of Old and New Art, Tasmania


If this project is successful we will continue to produce artist's book collections with new artists in the future as part of the regular Ayatana Artist Research Program.  If you support us this time you can have the first edition.

What could possibly go wrong?

We have overcome some big obstacles so far but the adventurous nature of Ayatana leads to adventurous problem solving which means anything can happen and that anything can be amazing! 

We've done all the dangerous stuff and now the only thing left standing in our way to fulfilling this project is paying for printing.  To print the copies we want to give to our experts and to the libraries will cost $390 and $300 to ship them. (and postage to ship to artists,) To print more for you so we can raise the money to do the first bunch will cost the same again plus a little more to ship internationally.  This project represents a theme that threaded through all of our adventures this summer: a composite organism made of many smaller organisms. So it is perfectly suitable for us all to come together to realize this project. Please be part of this Terminal Start with us!

If you can't contribute but know people who like artist books or the intersection of art & science please hit the share button!

story:
Our Story

Shantelle “Ladybug” Brumfield is making her debut as a visual artist with her 1st Exhibition: WOMEN IN 3-D'OLOGY. Ladybug is the founder/CEO of National Society of Soul (NSS), and has gained much success for the company as lead Fashion Designer. She currently works as an executive in the music industry, where she’s garnered a few milestones for both emerging and established artists, writers, and producers. However, she’s discovered her new passion as a visual artist.

Her current materials of choice are canvas, acrylic paint, and various embellishments—including her favorite pastime…crochet fashion—all inspired by her love for music. Initially, Ladybug embarked on her new passion in September 2010 to create cover-art for the packaging of NSS and its products. Now it has become the final extension of the NSS Brand, and encoded in her creative genome.

WOMEN IN 3-D'OLOGY is a collection of paintings focused on women illustrating the essence that defines Fashion, Art, and Music. Each piece represents the multitude of personalities that women exude at any given moment...simply because...that's how we feel! The adjectives on each painting illustrate each women's style, body language, and personality. You will notice various embellishments and jewelry worn by each of the women. These items represent their fashion-sense, and are actual pieces produced and/or in production for National Society of Soul, Inc.

National Society of Soul is an organization of young realists whose mission is to promote LIFE in FASHION, ART, and MUSIC thru Creativity, Individuality, Intellect, and Ability to nurture LIFE.

Young People + Opportunity = LIFE's Most Abundant Resource!

www.myssfam.com

The Impact

All proceeds from her inaugural exhibition will be donated to her nonprofit organization-- TooL BoX: Academy for Arts & Entertainment.


TooL BoX: Academy for Arts & Entertainment is a 4-Year High School College Preparatory Program for Arts & Entertainment. 


Go To www.mynssfam.com for more details ;-)


What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $10K in order to host our art exhibition, entitled: WOMEN IN 3-D'OLOGY. The proceeds will be used to finance venue rental fees, t-shirt contest for local (Los Angeles, CA) high school students---Grand Prize: iPad2, t-shirt production for featured student-designer (all t-shirt sales will be donated to TooL BoX), and interactive exhibition display. 


You may contribute as little as .50 cents and/or become an Official Sponsor of WOMEN IN 3-D'OLOGY! Please see the section entitled, PERKS! For your contribution, everyone will receive a commemorative certificate/plaque for being one of our few inaugural supporters of TooL BoX: Academy for Arts & Entertainment.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please show your support for LadyBug and TooL BoX by raising awareness about our event/fundraising campaign.


Follow us on Twitter: @mynssfam @LadyBugSupaSuit

Website: www.mynssfam.com

story:
Experimental Action is a three day International performance art festival hosting artists from around the globe performing alongside local Houston performance art to be held February 23rd through the 25th, 2017. We are a DIY, grassroots operation working fervently to cultivate the representation of performance art culture in Houston. Growing out of the Lone Star Explosion 2014 festival, Experimental Action is quickly evolving into an event that is synonymous with avant-garde performance art all over the world. With a mission to cultivate an environment that is rich with artistic talent, that expands the artistic community by showcasing experimental, innovative performance art.

This art extravaganza will provide a stage to a diverse range of performance work that all brings something new to the world. Immerse yourself in performances that excite and inspire in equal measure, crafted by artists who aren’t afraid to push boundaries and create pieces from pioneering, cutting edge ideas.

We’ve been beavering away for over two years to bring this to the very tip of fruition. It’s been a very long emotional journey that has been fueled by our belief that Houston has something to offer the performance art world as well as something valuable to give.

As we reach the precipice of festival events, we are coming to you with an opportunity to offer your support and reinforcement of this ambitious vision through donations!  We are using every resource we receive towards honoring the artists and giving them the strong support they need to present an absolutely unforgettable experience for everyone present!

Experimental Action will create a short term community that will foster creativity, contemplation and critical thought. This temporary community will be further enhanced through communal housing and meals. This gives local artists, incoming artists and volunteers a true cultural exchange, with a chance to develop lasting connections and forge future collaborations.

Experimental Action promises to be an engaging festival for people who have never witnessed performance art, seasoned art connoisseurs and performance artists themselves. Artists will be arriving from Canada, China, Serbia, and Spain with representation from national performers and a selection of the rich performance art that Houston has to offer.

Artists will be speaking about their work at area universities and a free to the public symposium at the Contemporary Art Museum of Houston. This gives Houston community members the chance to ask questions and engage with the work on a deeper level.

Any donation you can provide will be gratefully received. All money will go towards artist supplies, lodging, food and transportation for this trans-formative event. Let’s make something truly magical happen!

For more information about our vision, schedule and line up, please visit:
http://www.experimentalaction.com

To be notified of all ExA breaking news, be sure to follow us on Facebook

http://www.facebook.com/experimentalaction

If you are interested in supporting us through volunteer work, please visit: 
http://www.artshound.com/classified/experimenta...

Donations through this crowdfunding campaign are NOT tax deductible. To make a tax deductible donation to Experimental Action please visit: https://www.fresharts.org/content/experimental-action

Please spread the word! Just the simple act of sharing this with family, friends and on social media can help to make this event even bigger and better. Don't forget to follow and like Experimental Action on Facebook!

We will see you there!
story_txt: Experimental Action is a three day International performance art festival hosting artists from around the globe performing alongside local Houston performance art to be held February 23rd through the 25th, 2017. We are a DIY, grassroots operation working fervently to cultivate the representation of performance art culture in Houston. Growing out of the Lone Star Explosion 2014 festival, Experimental Action is quickly evolving into an event that is synonymous with avant-garde performance art all over the world. With a mission to cultivate an environment that is rich with artistic talent, that expands the artistic community by showcasing experimental, innovative performance art.This art extravaganza will provide a stage to a diverse range of performance work that all brings something new to the world. Immerse yourself in performances that excite and inspire in equal measure, crafted by artists who aren’t afraid to push boundaries and create pieces from pioneering, cutting edge ideas.We’ve been beavering away for over two years to bring this to the very tip of fruition. It’s been a very long emotional journey that has been fueled by our belief that Houston has something to offer the performance art world as well as something valuable to give.As we reach the precipice of festival events, we are coming to you with an opportunity to offer your support and reinforcement of this ambitious vision through donations!  We are using every resource we receive towards honoring the artists and giving them the strong support they need to present an absolutely unforgettable experience for everyone present!Experimental Action will create a short term community that will foster creativity, contemplation and critical thought. This temporary community will be further enhanced through communal housing and meals. This gives local artists, incoming artists and volunteers a true cultural exchange, with a chance to develop lasting connections and forge future collaborations.Experimental Action promises to be an engaging festival for people who have never witnessed performance art, seasoned art connoisseurs and performance artists themselves. Artists will be arriving from Canada, China, Serbia, and Spain with representation from national performers and a selection of the rich performance art that Houston has to offer.Artists will be speaking about their work at area universities and a free to the public symposium at the Contemporary Art Museum of Houston. This gives Houston community members the chance to ask questions and engage with the work on a deeper level.Any donation you can provide will be gratefully received. All money will go towards artist supplies, lodging, food and transportation for this trans-formative event. Let’s make something truly magical happen!For more information about our vision, schedule and line up, please visit:http://www.experimentalaction.comTo be notified of all ExA breaking news, be sure to follow us on Facebookhttp://www.facebook.com/experimentalactionIf you are interested in supporting us through volunteer work, please visit: http://www.artshound.com/classified/experimenta...Donations through this crowdfunding campaign are NOT tax deductible. To make a tax deductible donation to Experimental Action please visit: https://www.fresharts.org/content/experimental-actionPlease spread the word! Just the simple act of sharing this with family, friends and on social media can help to make this event even bigger and better. Don't forget to follow and like Experimental Action on Facebook!We will see you there!

story:
About Me

  • I am an artist from Manchester UK, I run the Bookbinding and Letterpress workshop at Manchester School of Art and I am studying  for a Masters degree in Book Arts at Camberwell College of Arts, London.
  • In my art practice I work with Artist’ Books, Printmaking and Photography to explore storytelling, history and poetry. I am fascinated with traditional craft skills and I love to teach others about this subject too.
  • See more of my work on my website http://caitlinakers.com/

The Residency

  • The Scuola Internazionale di Grafica di Venezia was founded in 1969 and it is the top international studio in Italy for practising and professional artists and designers. The Scuola offers courses and workshops in Printmaking, the Artists Book, Calligraphy, and Graphic Design.
  • In the professionally equipped studios and workshops by the Grand Canal, artists and students from all over the world have the opportunity to work side by side with Italian artists and students. This is what makes an experience at the Scuola truly unique.
  • See more on their website http://www.scuolagrafica.it/art/

Why Am I Going?

  • I have been invited by the Scuola to take up an Academic Partial Fellowship residency in Book Arts. I want to learn new skills in Book Arts, Letterpress and Printmaking that I can use for not only my own art practice but also share with my students at Manchester School of Art and my MA course peers at Camberwell College of Arts
  • Whilst I am at there I want to create new work, this will take the form of an Artist Book piece and a set of Letterpress prints.These pieces will be part of larger body of work and contribute to my overall grade for my Masters degree.
  • The Venice Art Biennial is on in July, I want to visit the many exhibitions all over the city and gather inspiration from the event. I would also use this opportunity to meet other artists and curators, exchange knowledge and extend my professional network.

What I Need & What You Get

  • The residency is partially funded by the Scuola but I still need £1000, to cover the remainder of the cost of the residency, plus flights, living expenses and art materials.
  • In return for your generous donations you will receive unique, handmade, letterpress printed goods.
  • Any contribution, great or small, will help towards the cost of the residency.

Impact

  • I believe this unique experience will have a massive impact on my career as an artist.
  • It will give  me new skills in my field that I can go on to share with others.
  • Help me to establish new networks with other artists and curators.
  • Allow me time to create new work that I can go on to exhibit or publish.
  • As a contributor your support will help directly with my development as an artist.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If moneys too tight to mention, then you can help in other ways!
  • Share my campaign on social media! It's the fastest and easiest way to get the word out.  
  • Indiegogo makes it easy to share! Share your heart out!

story:
What's Circumference All About?

Tannery Arts Center, Santa Cruz, CA. September 7th, 2019

www.circumferencefestival.com

 

It's an event

Circumference is a collaborative event for musicians, visual artists, and digital media doers to showcase their work, network with fellow artists and agencies, collaborate and gain crucial exposure, all while enjoying a festival style atmosphere.

It's a stage

Circumference will be an opportunistic, advantageous event that will provide a stage for rising musicians and artists to showcase, network and build contacts within their discipline. The main objective is to expand opportunities and access to them, by bringing together various representatives, vendors, performers, and artists in a conference style setting with festival style performances.

It's a celebration

Circumference celebrates the diversity and convergence of the music, arts and digital media industries in Santa Cruz County and dedicates itself to helping creative individuals reach their goals. 

It's a network

Circumference is an event that will forge artistic connections, provide opportunities for self promotion, collaboration, performance, and overall enhance the artistic frequency in the city of Santa Cruz. 

It's a fundraiser

A portion of every ticket sold will go to the SCCAAE (Santa Cruz County Alliance for Arts Education). An award winning organization dedicated to preserving Arts education in schools K-12 throughout Santa Cruz County. The remainder of event proceeds will be donated back to the Tannery Arts Center.

 

What Your Support Helps Us With:  

Facility Costs- $1,500

  • Facility space and fees
  • Studio 119 rental
  • Silent Disco 
  • Radius Gallery

Day-of-equipment costs- $2,500

  • Lighting
  • Additional sound equipment
  • Trusses
  • Popup shades
  • Seating
  • Water station

Promotional material and marketing- $1,000

  • Promotional flyers
  • Distribution
  • Ad in local media
  • Social media promotion

 

Other Ways You Can Help Circumference Grow

Its tough out there, that's why we are fundraising! Here are other ways you can help.

  • Get the word out for us to people who might be interested. Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Follow us on social media, leave us a comment!
  • Join our mailing list

 

Thank You!

We hope to see you at the 1st annual

Circumference Festival!

story:
Short Summary

The passions of my life are my Christian faith, my art, teaching and travelling. If I ever get to do all of them at once? Well things don't get much better than that!

I have been invited by Network of International Christian Schools (https://nics.org) to spend 2 weeks in Caracas, Venzeula teaching art and performing my one-man-show, "Thomas: Confessions of a Doubter." I am very excited about the possibility of bringing new inspiration to the children of that country. I am also excited about being there with my nephew Tyler who is in his second year there and can be seen speaking half-way through the video.

I have been working for faith based organizations for the past 25 years (Rosebud School of the Arts, Canadian Badlands Passion Play) and have been a freelance art teacher for as long.

What I Need & What You Get

I am donating my time to this venture. Anything you donate will help to cover my costs. The amount is so low (I am always leary of how much money is spent on "short-term missions") because my plane ticket was purchased in Venezuela and now I need to reimburse NICS. Anything raised in excess will help to cover my cost of living during the trip since I'm a freelancer and don't have such things as paid holidays.

I don't have much to offer you in return for your support except my undying gratitude. Because it is a US organization I can not offer tax receipts. If you are an American and you would like a receipt, you can instead go to the NICS website https://nics.org/Donate.aspx, choose School Projects from the dropdown menu, and in "Other Project" put "ACIC - Caracas, Venezuela (002143)". Please put "Randall Wiebe" in the comments box so it specifically gets directed for that. Oh, and make a comment here to let me know that you have done that so we don't duplicate funding. 

The Impact

This school is situated in a city of huge contrasts; wealth and poverty, security and violence. Though a Christian School, many of the students are not from Christian homes and are simply sent there to get an English language education. The chance to reach them with the Christian message and with love is great. The chance to help them find new skills and a different way of looking at the world and to develop self-confidence is also great.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Let others know about my campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools
  • Pray!

story:
Muralist's Granddaughter Seeks Funding for Solo Art Exhibition in May 2013

Illness impacts finances!

Hello, my name is Lynda (Whelan) Evans and I am the granddaughter of Ezra Winter, a renowned muralist from the 1920's through 40's. One of his most famous murals is the one in Radio City Music Hall in New York City...the huge one going up the grand staircase and you may have seen it.  By the way, the larger easel you see in my video was my grandfather's!  I am thrilled to have it and be painting at it.  My mother painted at this same easel, too.  It is a nice legacy and I am reminded of both of them every time I sit down to paint.

My husband was diagnosed with a stage 4 cancer not too long ago.  He came through it very well and is now in remission.  But, with him being out of work for 1 1/2 years during this trying stage of our lives, there was a huge impact on our finances.  This show was scheduled before his illness and I am trying my best to fulfill my obligation to the gallery and put on an excellent show.  My website can be viewed at: www.LyndaEvansArt.com and from there you can find information about the gallery...address, phone# and hours. It would be wonderful to see many of you there!

I am well on my way to fulfilling this tall order, but need some help with offsetting the cost, mainly for framing.  In addition to the materials for the show, I am responsible for all advertising and associated mailing costs, and food & drinks for two receptions, which add up quickly.

Having started painting less than 10 years ago, I now work and sell from my studio/gallery next to my home.  My works are in many private collections all across the East and the Midwest.  I pride myself in being able to be flexible to meet a patron’s wishes in completing commissions and love inviting people into my workplace to show them what I am doing.

My first solo art exhibition was in 2010 and I did very well. I was the second highest selling artist of the season in the gallery and was second only to a very well known artist.  The same gallery has asked me back again for a second exhibition this coming May. I will need between 45 & 50 works to fill the gallery, at a considerable cost just for the substrates and framing materials.

Your contribution will help make this show even better, allowing me to purchase quality frames, advertise more widely, and provide for two "Meet the Artist" receptions. Having a successful show will be a big boost to my painting career and any help will be greatly appreciated. If you are unable to directly contribute to my campaign I ask that you help spread the word by forwarding this to anyone you think may be interested enough to contribute.

Thank you for taking the time to read this and I hope that together we will be able to meet my goals for this major exhibition.

story:
Are you several times in a dilemma?

  • Is someone from your close family having a birthday soon
  • Are your parents having an anniversary
  • Would you like to congratulate your child at some special event
  • Did you remember some old good friend and you would like to tell them that you  miss them

We are offering you a gift card. A present which will leave everybody speachless and touched.

We will send a letter with your name from long distant Land of love, with your words of love and suprise your beloved ones. This gift card will be first class original suprise.





You must be wondering now where this Land of love is. The same will happen with the person who will receive this present with love from you.


Once upon a time, in a magical land, which was green in the summer, and white in the winter, in this land full of castles lived Prince S and Princess Nia. They became friends when they were little kids but while they were growing up their friendship developed into love. All people in this land was happy because the love of Prince S and Princess Nia inspired everybody. From village to village everybody knew that Prince S is in love with Princess Nia.

In the end everybody was whispering S love Nia.

And since then the land full of love was called SLOVENIA.

This story is maybe real or maybe just one part of it. Nobody remembers full story but land Slovenia still exist.

Slovenia is the only country on Earth that has word LOVE in her name.

REMEMBER THIS:

  • We will make sure for your wishes. Submit your order today  and we will make sure that your letter of love comes on the day that you request.
  • You will never again forget to congratulate someone, we will make sure of it
  • On the day that you would like us to send your letter, we will inform you on your email, that the letter was sent.
  • You can order weeks or even months in advance, from then on it will be our concern to make sure that your beloved one will get your letter of love.





We will send the letter of love with your words to where you will decide.

At getting the letter this person will be suprised because he will get the letter from The Land Of LOVE.

At first he will not know who send him this letter from the country that he had never heard before but when he will open it he will know . In the front will be a photo and a notice that he get a letter from the land of love. He will ask himself where is this land.

In the back page will be written how this land got the name. Inside will be a photo of this land and in this photo will be your small photo,so this is how he will know who send him this. Inside will also be written what you will write only to him/her and it can be in your language,whichever you want.

As he is opening the letter he will feel our magic ,which we will add,something that he can feel but not see…



  • your photo, if you want it to be included in the gift card
  • your  words, wishes, greetings ( send us in which language you want)
  • the address to where you want us it to send, (you can send it worldwide)
  • date, on which you want gift card to be sent. On this day the letter will be send and you will get email that the letter was sent.


Here are informations (click here),where you can see how much time the letter needs to come from the land of love (Slovenia) to where you send it, and you do the math how much days before you need us to send it.

example

You would like to send letter from land of love to your mother for her birthday. Your mum lives in Australia. Her birthday is on 15 of May. Check the list here and you will find out that letter need 4-6 days to get to Australia. If you want the letter on her adress on 15 of May, then you should inform us to send your letter 6 days before the dare you want her to recieve it, which is on 9 of May. You just need to follow the instructions on our website, where you can order a Gift Card and enter information for order on that product ( in this case on 9 of May). On this day 9 of May we will dispatch your order.

We are sure that everybody who will get this letter from the Land of love, will be happy and surprised.



Our biggest wish is that we will send at least one letter of love in every country.

Love overcomes all obstacles,this is our motto, and we wish that with our and your  help, the world becomes better, full of love.




Don't worry,we will keep our promise and we will send all the letters and vouchers for massage  to the addreses that were ordered by you.


 Orders for massages will be accepted on this online site

www.filipinska-masaza.com/narocila 

With massages we will begin in July 2015.


Our first drafts for letters have already been made, which means that we are already prepared for your orders. your letters will be send on the day that you decide.

Your support will make our company bigger and allow us to make more people happy around the world.


Thank you for reading/watching our story.  


Please support us in the way that is the easiest for you.

If you can't afford to donate at this time, no problem! You can still help big time.

If you like this idea, get the word out about our project!

Share on:

  • Facebook,
  • tweet,
  • post,
  • tumblr,
  • snapchat,
  • send email to your friends, coworkers!! 
  • Sound the alarms,
  • ring the bells,
  • ping your friends,
  • put post-its in the break room! 

Do whatever you can do to let the world know about our story.

Hvala lepa (thank you!!)!


  • to spread love
  • to make feel good (important to someone) your beloved ones
  • to make the person (who gets letter) drop some tears of joy
  • to spread love around the world from the Land of love



What we need:

We just need your help to spread Love around the world  from the Land of love-

What you get: 

For your donation, we have prepared a lot of nice things (PERKS). Choose yourself of your choise as you like...



Thank you email!


Be a supporter of the Land of Love


Thank you


SUPER EARLY BIRD GIFT CARD


SUPER EARLY BIRD GIFT CARD


EARLY BIRD GIFT CARD


EARLY BIRD GIFT CARD

ONLY ONE CAN BE A KING


ONLY ONE CAN BE A QUEEN


VISIT SLOVENIA AND HANG OUT WITH US

info@landoflove.si

Love overcomes all obstacles,this is our motto, and we wish that with our and your  help, the

accepted on this online sitewww.filipinska-masaza.com/narocila

Your support will make our company bigger and allow us to make more people happy around the world.

story:
*main image by Ian Factor

www.ianfactor.com


There is a great need in the Boston area for affordable studio space.  After school, many former art students experience a rut, sometimes spanning decades, because they cannot afford a studio of their own, and don't know where to find the models they need.  Most art groups only run drop-in sessions one day a week, and sometimes only bi-weekly.  What if that time doesn't work with your schedule?  What about the time in between?

Bottega is my idea for a unique art space that will be open every day all day, for everyone to use as they wish. 

In addition to plentiful open studio space, there will also be separate studios, for those who wish to create in a more private setting. Some of these will be available to musicians.

For an inexpensive fee, everyone will be able to just drop in, and create. All day.

In the evenings, traditional figure drawing classes will be held. Some less traditional than others, in presentation.  While most will be quiet nude figure sessions, many will be accompanied by live music (strings, acoustic, or otherwise light music), and all will be accompanied by food and drink, to be enjoyed during breaks, to encourage socializing, and a sense of community.

Every Friday will be a night of mayhem, where people can come work with models of the unusual variety. Costumes, multiple models, props, music, movement…fun!

Once a month, the featured artist will change, and the ongoing gallery will be flipped. In celebration of each new artist's gallery showing, Bottega will hold a monthly art carnival, inviting performers of ALL kinds that reflect the work of the person whose art is on display.

Eventually, it is my hope that Bottega will become home to a smoothie bar/cafe, and will host classes of all kinds. A hip adult ed center, where people can come create, learn, and meet other artists.  I plan to utilize local schools for the talents of their students, offering jobs, internships, and gallery space.   I'd also like to have youth art sessions on weekends, to encourage children to get involved in the arts.  Sessions have live music, and arts and crafts for the younger ones, and potentially more concentrated sessions for those a bit older.

For now, I’d like to start off small, with the only classes being figure drawing/painting classes, and the occasional photography workshop.

FUNDING WILL GO TOWARD:

leasing a space
renovations/design work
catering/music for opening night
furnishings
art supplies

story:
We are Cristina, Chiara and Eliza, 3 Italians living in London.

Together we have founded Le Dame and three months ago we managed to make a big dream come true...we opened an Art, Crafts and Design Gallery in the heart of Notting Hill.

Our space wants to be more than a gallery, it is home to a large group of Italian artists, artisans and designers from all backgrounds and media: photographers, painters, craftsmen, illustrators, inventors, designers and more. This is why we decided to call it “Made by Italians”.

The dream has come true but still a lot needs to be done in order to have the perfect house for our artists. In particular we need to improve our premises.

Also, we need help to bring “Made by Italians” to the next level. 

With your support we will be able to acquire the basic resources a gallery should have to host performances and art events.

Chiara and the mould on the walls... Oh my!!!

Here's a detailed breakdown of what the gallery needs:

$30,000 premises improvement: damp proofing, office and storage refurbishment, electrical system for storage area, hardwood flooring, bathroom vent, video security system, new front window (the one we have is cracked). 

$23,000 basic resources to host performances and events: computer, camera, mixer, speakers, cables, adapters, video and monitors, displays and rails  for photographs.

$7,000 new website and advertising: design, development, programming and up-keep.

CHI SIAMO 

Cristina,  Chiara e Eliza, 3 italiane che vivono a Londra. Tre mesi fa siamo riuscite a realizzare un grande sogno... abbiamo  aperto una Galleria di Arte, Artigianato e Design nel cuore di Londra, a Notting Hill. 

Il nostro spazio vuole essere più di una Galleria, E' già un punto di riferimento, una casa per un folto gruppo di artisti, artigiani e designers italiani provenienti da dievrsi settori: fotografia, pittura, artigianato, illustrazione, mosaico, design e ancora altro. 

Per questo abbiamo deciso di chiamare il progetto "Made by Italians”, per dare agli artisti italiani residenti in Italia ma soprattutto a tutti quelli sparsi in giro per il mondo, la possibilità di avere uno spazio a Londra per poter  crescere, farsi conoscere, dare forma alla loro immaginazione e esibire le loro opere. 

Il “Made in Italy” è un marchio molto famoso nel mondo ma la globalizzazione e il desiderio di vivere altrove ha incoraggiato molti artisti e artigiani a lasciare l'Italia ma tutti portano con se le loro radici culturali e le conoscenze artistiche. Un bagaglio unico al mondo. Un patrimonio immenso. 

La nostra galleria “Made by Italians” è il luogo dove possono sentirsi "a casa" e dove possono avere una vetrina nella città più dinamica, creativa e accogliente del mondo. 

DI COSA ABBIAMO BISOGNO 

Il sogno è diventato realtà, abbiamo già la nostra galleria! Ma c'è ancora molto da fare per realizzare la "casa" perfetta per i nostri artisti. Nello specifico dobbiamo migliorare la struttura per offrire agli artisti e ai clienti un ambiente ideale. Uno spazio per lavorare accogliente è anche un luogo migliore per far volare la fantasia e creare. 

Inoltre, dobbiamo portare “Made by Italians” al livello successivo. Per questo abbiamo bisogno del vostro supporto:  per far si che la galleria abbia finalmente tutte le risorse necessarie per ospitare eventi, performances, workshop e finalmente produrre arte. 

Vi assicuriamo che ogni introito della galleria serve a coprire i costi di gestione e ad apportare migliorie alla struttura. 

Ecco un dettaglio delle necessità: 

$30,000 migliorie della struttura: manutenzione straordinaria dei locali, spazi espositivi, magazzino e ufficio, sistema elettrico, pavimentazione, impianto di ventilazione bagno, sistema di sicurezza video, una nuova vetrina (quella che abbiamo adesso è incrinata).

$23,000 risorse di base per ospitare performances e eventi: computer, videocamera, mixer, speakers, cablatura, adattatori, video and monitor, displays and rotaie per fotografie.

$7,000 nuovo sito e pubblicità: design, sviluppo, programmazione e manutenzione.

story:
After searching the internet for well-designed prints and greeting cards that incorporate "fuck" in funny and motivational ways, I quickly realized that they just don't exist.  Conveniently, I also happened to be a graphic designer.  
So, instead of continuing on with the frustration, I decided to do it myself and offer this product to the masses! The FuckPrints.com prints and greeting cards, along with any other additional products we carry, will not only allow you to express exactly how you feel to others and keep life funny, but also stay motivated in your life's endeavors. 


Here are a few FuckPrints.com concepts so that you get a feel for the brand. 


Currently, FuckPrints.com has a website built out with full eCommerce capabilities. I have 15 print designs and 15 greeting card designs ready to go to print. I simply need the get inventory to cover those orders once they start rolling in! $1,500 will allow me to order enough of each item to get started as well as packaging to ship the orders. As we grow, I plan on developing more products and because I interact with the public every day, the ideas for phrases are really endless. 

People need to express themselves and sometimes, cheesy sayings just don't cut it. The world is full of people with emotions and a lot of the time those emotions, both happy or not so happy, involve that magic f bomb. Investing in FuckPrints.com means you're helping your fellow man/woman express how they feel in the most honest and fun way possible.

story:
All the funding for this campaign will go into the expenses on art supplies, preparations and promotions of the next 10 psychedelic portraits and so on. Hence, more funding equals more portraits. 

 

Things You Ask, Things You Get & Things You See

What will my portrait look like?

Your Portrait will look like its a part of this Psychedelic collection. Select any one or two of your favourite portraits from this collection and your portrait be made in that manner. My style of portrait making is unique, just as your portrait will be. 

What are the risks involved?

There are no real risks involved. Postcards will reach you via post. Original Paintings will be dispatched along with Tshirts as soon as this campaign finishes. The only thing left to do is to paint you!

What happens when the campaign goal is reached and exceeded?

The campaign goal is $700, all of which will go into the expenses on art supplies, preparations and promotions of the next 10 psychedelic portraits and so on. Hence, more funding equals more portraits.

When will I receive my rewards?

Shipping begins on the last day of this campaign. Shipping is free worldwide. All signed postcards with handwritten thank you notes, along with gift coupons will be mailed to you via post. Tshirts and Portraits will be rolled into wrinkle-free Air-tight tubes and sent to you via DHL(international) and BlueDart(within India) services.

Where can I view the progress of this campaign?

The process of making and the final works will be featured regularly ( as always ) on my Studio Photostream and on social media platforms during and after the campaign is completed. Subscribe here to receive regular updates. Portrait #1 will be featured on May 15th, Portrait #100 on Aug 15th and everything else in between. So stay tuned! Links to my work: Studio Projects My work on Social Media: Facebook Twitter Behance Pinterest LinkedIn

Thank You So Much

I hope you enjoyed viewing my work as much as I enjoyed preparing them.

No contribution is too small. If you can't contribute but you like my work and want to see me make a hundred more portraits, please  help me make some noise!

Spread the word, let others know.

SHARE this project.

igg.me/at/Paint-Me-Trippy

 

| Rewards for your contributions |

Contribute $200 for YOUR Psychedelic Portrait and in addition you get an awesome PsyTshirt and a signed canvas print as rewards along with your original portrait as rewards.

Contribute $100 for a psychedelic sketch in black and white of YOU drawn on 8' x 12' smooth toned paper, signed and sent you along with an awesome PsyTshirt of your choice from this collection as rewards.

Contribute $30 and get an awesome Tshirt (choose from collection) available in S, M, L, XL and signed by the artist. Plus a personal thankyou note on a signed postcard of your choice from this collection as rewards.

 Add-ons are available as well.

Once you contribute, I will provide you with a Portrait Date and you'll send me your photographs. Your contributions will positively influence my artistic progess and enhance my Portrait Collection. Be sure to receive lots of complimentary gifts along with YOUR Original Portrait!

story:
On June 8, 2013, the One Million Bones project will culminate with an installation of 1,000,000 handmade bones on the National Mall! For the past three years, over one hundred thousand students, artists, activists and educators from all fifty states and thirty plus countries have been crafting replica human bones to recognize the victims and survivors of ongoing genocide and mass atrocities. These bones will be laid out together in a historic event that will not soon be forgotten. 

The Impact

We're really excited to launch this campaign and ask our community to help us take the final step in producing the culminating installation! This campaign is to help fund the transportation of the bones to the National Mall, the stage and sound for our speakers and security on the National Mall to ensure the bones remain safely on display for three days, bringing speakers to the installation, covering the cost to print the One Million Bones Memory Book and the cost for the bones to travel to their permanent home.  

Saturday, June 8th:

Starting at 10:00 am, volunteers dressed in white will begin to lay 1,000,000 handmade bones on the National Malll. Sign up here to let us know that you'll be joining us to lay down bones!

From 4:00 - 6:00 pm we will have international speakers and performers such as Neema Namadamu, John Dau, Mukesh Kapila and a performance from Elikeh - Stay tuned as we continue to announce more speakers and performers for Saturday's event!

Sunday, June 9th:

Join us on Sunday for educational workshops sponsored by our partners about Congo, Somalia, Sudan and Burma. In the evening we'll have a Candlelight Vigil around the bones with powerful speakers and performers including, Carl Wilkens and John Prendergast! Stay tuned for more!

Monday, June 10th:

In partnership with the Enough Project, Monday will be an Act Against Atrocities Advocacy Day, sign up here to join!

 

What is One Million Bones?

One Million Bones is a large scale social arts practice, meaning we use education, hands-on art making and large public installations to raise awareness of ongoing genocide and mass atrocities happening today in Sudan, South Sudan, Somalia, the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Burma. For the past three years students, artists, educators and activists have been crafting replica human bones out of clay, paper and plaster to symbolize those lost to these conflicts. Through a partnership with Students Rebuild, the Bezos Family Foundation donated $1 for every bone made, up to $500,000 for CARE’s relief work in Somalia and the Democratic Republic of Congo. We are proud to say that in March of 2013, we reached our $500,000 goal!

On June 8, 2013, thousands of volunteers dressed in white will lay one million of these handmade bones on the National Mall in Washington DC to create a symbolic mass grave and visual petition. We use the symbol of the bone not only to attest to the gravity of these conflicts but also, more importantly, as a symbol of our common humanity and a reminder that we belong to each other. 

What We've Done

In August of 2011, we held our first preview installation of 50,000 bones in Albuquerque, New Mexico where over 200 volunteers laid down bones at the intersection of Route 66 and Fourth Street. To watch a short 3 – minute video of that installation click here!

Eight months later, we held another preview installation in New Orleans, Louisiana, when 50,000 bones were laid down in historic Congo Square in Louis Armstrong Park. All 50,000 of these bones were crafted by the New Orleans Community, where youth were able to use the project as a way to confront and discuss the violence they experienced in their own lives, seeing a connection from local to global and relating to their peers thousands of miles away. To see a short video of that installation click here!

On April 28, 2012 our ten month Road to Washington Campaign culminated in thirty five mini installations in thirty four state capitals. They were all volunteer led and organized, check out some videos from the Tallahassee installation and Austin installation!

The Impact
We're really excited to launch this campaign and ask our community to help us take the final step in producing the culminating installation! This campaign is to help fund the transportation of the bones to the National Mall, the stage and sound for our speakers and security on the National Mall to ensure the bones remain safely on display for three days, bringing speakers to the installation, covering the cost to print the One Million Bones Memory Book and the cost for the bones to travel to their permanent home.  
Saturday, June 8th:
Starting at 10:00 am, volunteers dressed in white will begin to lay 1,000,000 handmade bones on the National Malll. Sign up here to let us know that you'll be joining us to lay down bones!
From 4:00 - 6:00 pm we will have international speakers and performers such as Neema Namadamu, John Dau, Mukesh Kapila and a performance from Elikeh - Stay tuned as we continue to announce more speakers and performers for Saturday's event!
Sunday, June 9th:
Join us on Sunday for educational workshops sponsored by our partners about Congo, Somalia, Sudan and Burma. In the evening we'll have a Candlelight Vigil around the bones with powerful speakers and performers including, Carl Wilkens and John Prendergast! Stay tuned for more!
Monday, June 10th:
In partnership with the Enough Project, Monday will be an Act Against Atrocities Advocacy Day, sign up here to join!
 
What is One Million Bones?
One Million Bones is a large scale social arts practice, meaning we use education, hands-on art making and large public installations to raise awareness of ongoing genocide and mass atrocities happening today in Sudan, South Sudan, Somalia, the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Burma. For the past three years students, artists, educators and activists have been crafting replica human bones out of clay, paper and plaster to symbolize those lost to these conflicts. Through a partnership with Students Rebuild, the Bezos Family Foundation donated $1 for every bone made, up to $500,000 for CARE’s relief work in Somalia and the Democratic Republic of Congo. We are proud to say that in March of 2013, we reached our $500,000 goal!
On June 8, 2013, thousands of volunteers dressed in white will lay one million of these handmade bones on the National Mall in Washington DC to create a symbolic mass grave and visual petition. We use the symbol of the bone not only to attest to the gravity of these conflicts but also, more importantly, as a symbol of our common humanity and a reminder that we belong to each other. 
What We've Done
In August of 2011, we held our first preview installation of 50,000 bones in Albuquerque, New Mexico where over 200 volunteers laid down bones at the intersection of Route 66 and Fourth Street. To watch a short 3 – minute video of that installation click here!
Eight months later, we held another preview installation in New Orleans, Louisiana, when 50,000 bones were laid down in historic Congo Square in Louis Armstrong Park. All 50,000 of these bones were crafted by the New Orleans Community, where youth were able to use the project as a way to confront and discuss the violence they experienced in their own lives, seeing a connection from local to global and relating to their peers thousands of miles away. To see a short video of that installation click here!
On April 28, 2012 our ten month Road to Washington Campaign culminated in thirty five mini installations in thirty four state capitals. They were all volunteer led and organized, check out some videos from the Tallahassee installation and Austin installation!

story:
A Black Rock City Honoraria Art Installation, CHRONOSYDRA is a reverse hourglass that runs for the week of Burning Man 2016. Brought to you by the DUST CRUSADERS, this installation is an abstract timepiece for Black Rock City that will sit deep in the playa awaiting your discovery.

 

 

You find CHRONOSYDRA on your ride through the deep playa. Its size in relation to you evokes the scale of a board-game timepiece if you were a player’s token. The wood base is wide enough to provide you a seat in its shade, and the benches around it double as your bike rack. You look closer, and see that it is not static, but a working hourglass that is filling upwards with small particulates that float from bottom to top chamber; its translucent pellets catch the sunlight during the day and swirl like fireflies when LED-lit at night.

Like a meter that measures the growing creativity and energy around it, this hourglass fills steadily over the length of the event and stands full at exodus; full like an hourglass that has just been turned over, full like time itself has been turned back. CHRONOSYDRA is an art piece that mirrors the week-long transformation of Black Rock City, and playfully reflects on the way in which our time at Burning Man may reset, revivify, and refill us if we let it.

 

WHAT ARE WE CREATING?

 

 

 

Inspired by Greek water clocks klepsydra |  Chronos (of Time) + Hydra (of Water)  

CHRONOSYDRA will be a working hourglass made of acrylic, wood, and steel that stands nearly 11'-0" tall and almost 10'-0" in diameter. Around the hourglass will be a ring of additional benches to complete this meditative oasis. At night, we will be illuminating the hourglass with over 100 ft of LED lights!

 

 

 

HOW DOES IT WORK?

Magic!

...and a lot of science (put your goggles on!). The steel and wood frame of  CHRONOSYDRA will support an 8'-0" tall acrylic hourglass that has a top and bottom chamber separated by an aperture (a super tiny opening). Before we get to Black Rock City, the bottom chamber will be filled with recycled plastic pellets. With the first sunrise of Burning Man 2016 we will fill the entire hourglass with water. Because the plastic pellets are less dense than the water, they will float from the bottom to the top chamber over our week together on the playa. We are calibrating the hourglass to run for 7 days by regulating the size of the aperture and the number of pellets within the system. 

In case you have your calculator handy, we will be using nearly 300 gallons of water and 700 pounds of recycled plastic pellets to make this magic happen!

We love that this project is both an art piece and a giant science experiment, and believe that it fits well with this year's theme - Da Vinci's Workshop. In honor of the theme, the benches surrounding the installation will read "Time stays long enough for those who use it" a quote commonly attributed to Da Vinci.

 

Da Vinci was both an artist and an inventor, and known for cryptically writing everything backwards, so we like to think he would have backed a reverse hourglass on Indiegogo too.

 

WHO IS GONNA BUILD IT?

 

The  DUST CRUSADERS are a collection of volunteer architects, engineers, craftsmen, and dreamers that have come together to offer CHRONOSYDRA for Burning Man 2016. We are building this art installation to gift back to a community that has provided creative inspiration and deep personal experience to each of us, and to celebrate the beautiful collaboration that becomes Black Rock City.

 

WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

Burning Man Arts has already pledged their support to CHRONOSYDRA and is funding about 70% of the project. The Honoraria grant will cover the costs of the final hourglass building materials and a structural engineering review. Even if we do not reach all of our fundraising goals, we are prioritizing making this a safe, beautiful, and unique installation for Black Rock City.

But we still need your help to TURN BACK TIME on the playa and to make the magic even BIGGER!
 

Your support will go towards:

- Build space : fabrication site in San Francisco!

- Materials for testing & calibration : extra machine time + materials! 

- Transportation : 15'-0" box truck to carry it safely from San Francisco to BRC!

- Storage : place for Chronosydra to hibernate until it can return home in 2017!

- Aperture refinement : help us create a visually transparent aperture so you can watch each pellet float gracefully between chambers!

 

 

HOW ELSE CAN YOU HELP?

You can help by sharing CHRONOSYDRA and its campaign with others!

We are also looking for help sourcing material consumables, machine shop time, and willing hands to join a local build day in San Francisco or to help keep this installation in the best shape possible on the playa this summer. If you are interested in learning more about the project or getting in touch to volunteer your time, please leave us a message on our CHRONOSYDRA Facebook page.
 

SEE YOU AT BURNING MAN 2016 & THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

 

 

Huge burner high-five to Dust Crusader Will who filmed and edited our campaign video! And, special shout-out to producer Hypha + Muti Music for letting us feature  Music Box - Hypha Ft. Lippe. For additional music featured in this video, please reference: Stock media provided by [ZayacMethodical]/ Pond5.com & by [Tatreal]/ AudioJungle.com. Part of this video was filmed at the beautiful Hayes Valley Temple, which you should go visit if you haven't already!

story:
About The Snail Mail Photo Blog

A few years ago I created The Snail Mail Photo Blog: a subscription-based photo blog, you guessed it, sent out in the mail.  I maintained this for a little over two years and have decided to relaunch it in 2016, with a "Bigger & Better" attitude towards it.

The Snail Mail Photo Blog features a photo taken within the month paired with a postcard story that has something to do with the photo.  Sometimes it is a piece of fiction, other times it might be non-fiction, or even an explanation of how the photo was taken or what you're looking at (It's not always straightforward).  The story is printed out on a piece of kraft paper and the corners rounded, and the two pieces are placed in an envelope with a snail linocut print on it.


What I Need & What You Get

I would like to be able to produce a book containing the entire original run of The Snail Mail Photo Blog, as well as create a more diverse range of methods in which the photos are produced.  I would also like this to be shared by as many people as possible to see how many countries I can get this sent to.  The previous iteration of the blog was sent out to four countries. 

  • A year-subscription to The Snail Mail Photo Blog is 12 issues delivered to you in the mail, sent out on or about the first of the month.
  • The book will be a 5"X7", 64-page (maybe more) edition containing the first two years of the blog, as well as additional material not included in the first run, such as behind-the-scenes stories or methods.  If the goal is met, the cost for the books will be over $1100, and then I still have to get them shipped out to you.
  • The more money I am able to raise for this project, the more interesting methods of photo production I will be able to use.  I require some more material to complete a darkroom at home, which will allow me to experiment more.  Original works will be scanned for use in the blog.
  • Because of the flexible funding, there is no part of this project which will be unattainable.  However, the more money I am able to raise, the better it will be.  Various options like Impossible Project film, 35mm film, Medium-format film, chemicals for the darkroom and photo paper will all make this project more interesting.  If we smash the goals I've set, an upgrade in my photo equipment could be in my immediate future (a guy can dream, can't he?).

Risks & Challenges

I don't consider this to be a risky endeavour.  The greatest risk is that something happens to me before your subscription runs out, or that I run late on my goal of shipping out the new issue on the first day of each month.  The biggest challenge for myself will be to continuously come up with something new every month, but that's exactly the type of challenge that makes this project interesting to me.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't support this yourself, please share this with friends or family, through FaceBook, Twitter, or any other means.


Thanks for making it this far (even if you skipped to the bottom).

story:
The Short Story

Working through hosting organizations, we use ART to empower & connect girls around the world. Our self-portrait  program encourages discovery, expression, and collaboration. Girls share their visions for a better future, and find steps to help them build it.  We share their voices and encourage them to work together, becoming their own agents for change. We have produced MFFC in NJ, CA, WY, Canada, Guatemala, Haiti, Spain, & Uganda.  We will be producing a program in Philadelphia  on  August 15th, and  with your help, bringing MFFC to India in October of 2016. This campaign will help us cover the production costs to bring Mighty Fingers Facing Change to Chinmaya Vijaya Orphanage  in Kaza Village of Guntur District, India. 

Chinmaya Vijaya is an apolitical, non-governmental, all-girls Orphanage, that was founded by Drs. Sumathi and AppaRao Mukkamala as a tribute to Swami Chinmayananda, who dedicated his entire life to the service of mankind. There are 109 girls between the ages of 3 - 18 living at the orphanage.  We will work with all of them, focusing on training the older girls in the arts, who will in turn continue to encourage the younger girls to express and experiment in the new ART room. 

Swami Chinmayananda, Oil on board, 8" x 6" Prints available as a "perk'. 

Original raffled in studio at 28 N Union Street, third floor of The Peoples Antique Store. Stop in before October 1st to enter our hat-pin raffle to win this little portrait of a selfless swami. 

Open Studio Event Fundraiser - August 20th & 21st

Getting it Done

Our hosting organization provides housing, meals, and logistical assistance.  We need $8,000 to cover art supplies, video production, studio furniture for the new art room at Chinmaya Vijaya, and transportation for the team,  Our time is voluntary, and your contributions cover hard costs of production.  You can help us by buying art postcards, ordering prints, taking first dibs on an original oil painting, reserving art lessons, and other fun perks! You can also visit the studio and pick a piece of original art to support to our efforts. 

Toni Tru's endless enthusiasm caught on film, a rare moment. Thank you Jamie!

The Self-Portrait

We help girls understand how to bring their own visions into reality. 

Through a guided visualization exercise, girls share stories of their own lives. They find common threads with their peers, and they express their ideas and visions for a better future for themselves, and the communities they live in.  They are reminded that their opinions matter, and that their actions have great potential to create a better world. 

Girls from Teton Valley, Idaho share their thoughts and laughter at Center for the Arts, Wyoming.

The girls use words and symbols on one side of bag to express their thoughts and opinions.  They then create a self-portrait based on that experience. They build critical thinking skills by using paint and their fingers to  translate their feelings and dreams into a piece of art that makes a statement about their own beauty and strength.  This self-portrait painting is created on a bag so that they can literally and symbolically fill that vessel with poems, letters, school work - whatever inspires them to follow their own path. The results are varied, unique, colorful, and full of hope.

Gema from Quatemala shows her work and her hopes for a happy world. 

 

The FingerSmear™
"Abundance" is the name of our 10' long FingerSmear™ canvas that travels with us to each Mighty Fingers location.  All of the girls add their mark and their name to this collaborative piece of art that ties them together. By the time we finish this FingerSmear (approximately 5 more stops with our small team) it will have been touched by over 1,000 girls from different corners of the world. 

"Dream Big! FingerSmears connects our young women to their big dreams, power, hope, and love through this unique, artistic, creative, experience.  Boys and Girls Club of San Francisco is honored to be part of Kelly Sullivan's amazing legacy of community building - one finger painted stroke at a time." Pat Zemora, Boys and Girls Club of San Francisco, Citywide Arts Programs. 

The Documentation
Videographer Toni Tru travels to each Mighty Fingers location, giving the girls a platform to spread their views and opinions through video and digital media.  Girls are encouraged to  operate equipment and learn about staging, lighting, and sound.  They love watching the playbacks on site, but more importantly, all of the girls, past, present, and future, can watch and share the videos for a greater understanding of the connection they have to 'sisters' around the world.  Toni's work creates a powerful tool not only for the girls,  but also for our hosting organizations.  Our hosts receive a copy all of the raw footage for them to use for their own efforts to support these girls. 

The Exchange
In each location the girls make something that we bring to the next location - A postcard, or a small piece of art.  We will be bringing cards made by girls in Amor Village, Uganda, and Philadelphia,  to the girls at Chinmaya Vijaya in India.  The girls in India will make a little something that we will bring to our next location . (Coming up, Atlanta, Ireland, South America, Australia, Russia, and the Middle East)

Above, girls from Philadelphia's Athletic Recreation Center read a hand made card carried home for them, all the way from Uganda. They made cards that we will carry to India. 

The Result

Empowered, connected, inspired girls.  And we get a kick out of it too.  Thank you for believing in me, and the work we can do.  Thank you for believing that art does create a better world, and supporting it by choosing 'perks'.  Thank you for helping us uplift these beautiful girls into stronger, more compassionate, and confident women. You help us bring creativity and hope to these girls.  Together we work toward a multi-generational solution that is at the root of lasting change.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help, but crowdfunding isn't your method we can suggest a couple of ideas:

  • Share the campaign with friends
  • Donate 'miles' for our airfare
  • Commission art work
  • Come by the studio and enter a change to win art, or purchase fine art pieces.
  • Sponsor a rural girl in any number of programs (call me, I know several that need you)

Thank you for getting us this far, and continuing to support our efforts.  Kelly

story:
About Mother Pigeon...

After moving to New York City in the 80's, I quickly fell in love with the pigeons that inhabited the streets and parks. To share my adoration of the often mistreated birds, I started making soft sculpture pigeons made of felt and wire. After sharing my pigeons with friends, I was inspired to make my flock larger and share it on the city streets. 

It was apparent these felt pigeons were the perfect opener to talk about the wonder of pigeons. When people return to share their newfound appreciation, or tell me that they started feeding birds, it gives me inspiration to continue sharing my passion.  

 

About the Project...

After three years of being Mother Pigeon, I am able to sustain myself and the many animals I feed and rescue on the support you have given me. Mother Pigeon's next dream is to share a flashflock outstallation of 300 felt pigeons in the park. An outstallation of this size will bring a huge, new awareness to the pigeons and their many extraordinary qualities. Also, as the city is constantly being sterilized into a giant mall, you are helping to keep new york the magical, exciting, free art city that people from all over the world come to see.

I need your help! It is an enormous undertaking of money, time, and energy to create 300 pigeons. I am asking you to support me, Mother Pigeon, and all pigeons, by contributing to my campaign. Your adoption of my pigeons (or other campaign perks) will make this dream flashflock outstallation project a reality! The pigeons you adopt will be shipped out after the event in October or if you live in the city, you can come to the park to pick up your bird. Additionally, if I reach my campaign goal, 5% of the proceeds will go to support the amazing work being done at the Wild Bird Fund and 5% to Palomacy  Pigeon and Dove adoptions.  

 

Perks...

Make a contribution to 300 Pigeons in the Park and earn fun perks or donate directly. Show your support of NYC wildlife! Each special edition perk/bird will be numbered and signed by me!   

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

Other Ways to Help...

Help me spread the word:

Share the 300 Pigeons in the Park page on social media! Use the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the campaign page, on the left. Talk about the project with your friends!

 

Thank You!!!

I can't wait to see my vision come to life. I greatly appreciate your support and can't wait to see you in the park!

story:
Short Summary

Our collective's mission is to exhibit multi-disciplinary emerging art in an inclusive and open environment. bb collective aims to break down the borders of traditional art mediums as well as the social barriers which hinder some from experiencing and participating in the arts. We ask for your support in order to help us fund this project as well as pay our participating artists a fair artist fee. 

What We Need & What You Get

The money that you donate to us will go towards paying the artists, funding the venue space, and marketing costs.

To show our appreciation for your donation, we have provided a number of rewards! From art made by our artistic team to tickets to cultural hotspots in Toronto, there is something for everyone. 

The Impact

Your donation will go towards providing the opportunity for emerging artists to exhibit their work in an open and inclusive environment. 

Additionally, we would love if YOU attended our event. Come see these incredible artists and musicians exhibit their work and be a part of the Toronto Arts community.

Risks & Challenges

As this is a community arts project, there are a lot of economic risk factors that may make reaching our fundraising goal difficult. Therefore, we have limited our expenses to only the essentials. Our priorities are paying our artists and providing a positive experience for the guests attending. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate to our campaign monetarily, please share our story, campaign, and follow us on social media: 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/bbcollectivetoronto/

Twitter: @bbcollectiveTO

Instagram: bbcollectiveto 

 

 

Thank you to our sponsors
