story:
My name is Zeke Kan and I'm a Malaysian Artist based in Toronto, Canada. I have been invited by Pilotenkueche in Leipzig, Germany, to be an Artist in Residence for four months: February through May. Pilotenkueche is offering me a large, collaborative space in which to work, access to research communities, technical assistance, and an exhibition.

This experience in Leipzig will be an amazing chance for me to develop my artistic research in a professional setting. It is a chance to learn new things, to discuss my work, and to share my artistic project in an international context. In order to make this a reality, I will need YOUR help and SUPPORT!

I will be documenting my time at Pilotenkueche, so that you will be able to share my experience, and interact with me.

You can see more of my work here. 

 

My Plans for the Residency
 

I’m stoked about this opportunity, as it will give me the time, space, and facilities to focus on my artistic practice, pursuing a new body of work without interruptions. During this 4-month residence, I aim to seek other opportunities in the region with the work I produce.

I intend to work on a new body of work during the residency. I’d like to create an installation of mixed media works, including drawings, paintings, photography, sculpture, and architecture as a way to create a more democratized experience, leaving it up to the viewers to make their experiences meaningful through their own processes of interpretation and association.

I do not create works about one subject or another, the purpose is to be closer to beauty, and where beauty is not abstract, but concretely experience. My desire is to share something contemplative and experiential. I’m interested in the primary or absolute reality of the beauty in experiencing art. In sharing these experience, I wish to blur the boundary between art and life. I do not feel like my job as an artist is to provide resolution, but rather to be a catalyst to experiences.

I’m sure the work produced in Leipzig will be directed by my experiences there. The materials employed to produce the work will be directly connected to the resources available to me in this new environment. I would like to fully experience my new environment, using new and unconventional materials, interacting with my new community, and exploring the resources that are available to me.  

Here's some of my work

 

WHAT I NEED

The money I am raising through Indiegogo will be 75% of the total cost of participating in this residency. I have and will be working hard in order to cover as much of the remainder expenses for the 4-month residency, air travel, living costs, and materials. Funds raised beyond my goal will be used to fund 100% of the cost of the residency as well as art materials.

Pilotenkueche Residency - €2000 ($2200)

Travel expenses (Toronto/Leipzig roundtrip) - $1100

Accommodation - €1200 ($1320)
Total – $4620

75% - $3465 + Indiegogo fees($175)

Thank you in advance for supporting this project!

 

 

About Pilotenkueche?

The PILOTENKUECHE philosophy is focused on an interest of exchange by group dynamic, experimental strategies and transdisciplinary exchange. The kinetic dialogue between the group of artists influences each to go experimental ways about art, its ideas, approaches and methods. Pilotenkueche wishes to provide our participants with the experience of accomplishing something as a group; and, moreover, in experimenting with new forms of cooperation vital in fostering an independent position in one’s work. This leads to an intensive dialogue about individual ideas and working practices, binding the artists individuality temporarily into the group, which leads to a longer-term network that exists even after the residency is over.

There is also a new studio space from 01.02.17 (http://westside.pilotenkueche.net/?page_id=35)

 

Risks and Challenges

PILOTENKUECHE has already accepted me and I have an actual contract. They guarantee to involve me as an artist in many exhibitions during the residence, actively promoting my work. The final event of the residence will be a big group exhibition, with galleries and museum involvement.

I feel confident that my project will be successful and don’t foresee any setbacks. At this point, my biggest challenge is obtaining funds for my time at Pilotenkueche. While in Leipzig, I will not be allowed to obtain employment. On the upside, this allows me complete focus on the project at hand, making this Indiegogo campaign important. 

Thank you Perks!

Even the smallest of contributions would make a huge difference for me!

For donations $1 to $9. I will send you an e-mail with my sincere gratitude for believing in my project. You will receive a link to a web page via email to follow my experience in Leipzig.

Handwritten Thank You Card

For a donation of $10: you'll be rewarded with a handwritten Thank You Card. On the back, there will be my thank you note for to your donation and a link to my web page to follow my experience in Leipzig.

Any donation exceeding $10 ($11-19) will receive a random iPhone photograph as well.

Also, Your name will be listed as a contributor on my web page. 

An Original 4x6 photograph 

For donations of $25-34$ you'll receive an original photograph print that will be taken during my time in Leipzig. No duplicates of this will be made.  (2 photographs if your donation is 50, and so on). 

Your name will be listed as a contributor on my website.

An Original Postcard size Art

For donations $35 you'll receive an original postcard size art from Leipzig. I will send you an original artwork that is about the size of a postcard. This might be a drawing, painting, collage, it's a surprise. 

An Original Work on Collected End Pages 

For donations $50-$74 you'll receive an original work on paper (from my collection of End Pages). Only 3 of these will be available.

An Original New Work on Paper 

For donations of $75 you will receive an original New Work on Paper (22x15) that will be made during my time in Leipzig. 

An Original New Work on Paper 

For donations  of $125 you will receive an original New Work on Paper (30X22) that will be made during my residency in Leipzig. 

Painting on Canvas 

For donations of $125 you will receive a small painting on Canvas (8"x10"). 

 

CONTACT VIA EMAIL: zekekan@rocketmail.com if you are interested in the ORIGINAL pieces below. Price available upon request as well. 

Untitled (2016) 20x30

Untitled (2016) 20x30

Untitled (2015) 22x30

Untitled 2015 (Bleach) 40x52

Untitled 2015 (Bleach) 40x52

Untitled 2015  (Bleach) 40x52

Untitled (2015) 20x30

 

Don’t hesitate to contact me with comments, questions or requests for more information zekekan@rocketmail.com. 

You can explore more of my work on my website:  http://www.zekekan.com

If you are not able to support me financially, you can still help me out by spreading the word - posting it to Facebook, twitter,  you can pin it, share it on LinkedIn and telling all your friends and family who support the arts.

Thanks in advance for your support!

story:
A Little Summary 

Hi!  I'm Liz Yerby.  I'm a cartoonist in Portland, Oregon and I set up this calendar project with a lot of my comics and graphic design friends!  

For the last few years, I've been helping organize, edit and produce comics anthologies with stories by my friends! Themes have been animals we sent to space, movies we like, and important cats in our lives. This will be the latest friend project, and we're trying out a new thing by making a calendar! Since we've already done Important Cats, we wanted to balance it out by making an Important Dogs project. The funds from this campaign will help make this very beautiful calendar exist, and beyond that, the money will be split between all the artists. This year has been rough, but it's always really exciting and uplifting when I see a new project get printed!

This calendar includes Clifford, Wishbone and Beethoven as well as lesser known characters like Spuds McKenzie, or Ladybird from King of the Hill. The contributing artists are Shelby Criswell, Ross Jackson, BB Andersson, Ness Ilene Garza, Liz Yerby, John James Dudek and Cielle Charron (working as a team), Emily Moroz, Eileen Chavez, Ashley Robin Franklin, Ira M. Leigh, Avery Jepsen-Minyard and Tara Stephens.

 

What We Need

The Risograph printing estimate is $420 for the minimum number of 40 calendars, which is the biggest expense. Other expenses include the cost of shipping (for both orders and contributor copies), the cost of printing stickers, the cost of paper, and fees taken by indiegogo.

 While setting up an indiegogo campaign is extra work, my experience from my other campaign was that it makes pre-orders feel organized and easy to fill. 

Right now we've hit our goal for printing and shipping,  but we're hoping to get to $2000!  More sales mean more profit to share between our 12 artists!  


What you Get

Woof, a Calendar — The 2021 Important Dogs Calendar!  It will be a physical object, 11 x 17'' with a clip for binding and hanging on the wall.  Here's a mock-up of the January page with Shelby Criswell's art! It will consist of 13 2-color risograph prints featuring illustrations of Important dogs.  A single calendar costs $30 including US shipping, but you can also opt to get 3 for $60 (Woof Woof Woof! 3 Calendars), just in time for gift season.

Bow Wow A Sticker — A dog sticker for only $5 of support-- It's a 3''x2.5'' die-cute sticker with a little illustration of my dog Elliott in a witch hat with some mushrooms.  You'll get in your snail mail courtesy of the USPS.

Ruff Ruff Dog Support — An uplifting email for $3. I will send you a image of a dog and some supporting words.

Arf Arf, A Fancy Calendar — For $35, you get the phsyical calendar and the sticker mailed to you, as well as an uplifting email with a dog saying nice things.

There are also just two spots (Awoo, calendar & pet portrait, $225) for if you want to get a calendar and a custom pet portrait by me liz yerby, shipped to you in time for christmas. This may be the final commissions I take this year.


The Impact

Times are heavy and silly art is important! Calendar's give you a new little illustration to look forward to each month. It also helps out an array of independent artists who contributed to the project, as any profit will be split between all the artists. Risographs are a '80s copier/screenprint hybrid which work with beautiful and vibrant neon inks, and it's really exciting to see the images come to life in print.  Expect fun dates on the calendar, like 25 July, "Who Let the Dogs Out is released by the Baha Men, 2000." or Squirrel Appreciation day, as well as the dates of full and new moons, and your typical holidays.


This will be my tenth printing project that is an anthology of friend work!  Previous projects included a perfect bound 60+ page book full of comic stories about cats, on an array of colorful papers, with rounded edges. Another project was an anthology of moomin fanart comics with a risograph. This is my second Indiegogo campaign.

 

 

Risks & Challenges

All of the illustrations are complete, and 90% of the design work is complete, but I suppose things could still go wrong!  I've built in a few extra weeks to give our friends at Secret Room Press time to print the calendar, and get it to me for shipping to folks by Christmas. Small challenges might mean printing in different colors than we expected, or that some text is less legible, but I'm ready to make it all work and have a beautiful calendar to share with everyone. I'm hoping you'll bear with us in this small print-run in a technology I'm not used to designing for.  Also, if it builds confidence I should note I run an etsy shop and completed 367 orders, with only 5-star reviews.  I also help run the Portland Zine Symposium, which has a several thousand dollar budget, and organized an art retreat for 11 artists at the Oregon Coast last winter.


Spread the word
If you can't donate, you can also share with your friends about the project! At the top of the page, by the campaign image on the right there's indiegogo's share tools. Even the small tiers help cover printing and then go towards the artists on the project.  Thanks everyone for all shows of support! (The Secret Room Press logo to the right is the logo of our Portland, OR based printers.)

story:
About me

I am a self-taught artist known as Shinji in the art community! I am big fan of fantasy and this is gonna be the theme of my first project - The moon and the Sun, that centers around my personal characters, Yana (elf) and Samuel (wolf/werewolf) and their world, Mooria.

This is is my first project as a freelance artist and I need your help getting funded so that I can cover my costs of printing a first run of these art-books and also to cover my moving to a new home.

The art-book

A4, hard cover, 50 pages, full color

50 Pages full of my sketches and illustrations the past years, including many never before seen works!

20% - older works

80% - totally new works done specially for the book




Bonuses

*$5 - Thanks for supporting the campaign i appreciate it!

*$30 - You will receive an signed copy of the art-book and a bookmark . This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies) ~

*$55 - You will receive a signed copy of the art-book, bookmark and a print. This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies)~

*$75 - You will receive a signed copy of the art-book, bookmark, a print and a colored sketch. This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies)~

*$100 - You will receive a signed copy of the art-book, bookmark, a print,a colored sketch and YOUR CHARACTER IN THE ART-BOOK!!! This includes the cost of shipping (and shipping supplies)~

Shipping

Shipping for all contributors is included in your perk, so no need to send anything additional!

All art-books and perks will be shipped on May 2015!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can spread the word about this campaign to anyone you think might be interested in my sketchbook!

Thanks for checking out my funding campaign!

story:
The Musicians

Gabriel Moreno

I have been writing songs, poems and performing in Gibraltar, Chile, Peru, Naples, Barcelona and London for over 25 years. I started writing songs when I was 13 or 14 in the hope of making people resonate with my creations, just like I resonated with the songs and poems of the artists who I admired. During these 25 years there have been moments of doubt and insecurity but I have never given up my dream of creating decent musical and poetical pieces. Poetry and music have always been my chosen form of expression and I have worked hard during this time to improve and perfect them both. However, I was not alone and I owe a lot of my artistic growth to a series of talented artists and wonderful people I have met along the way. Artists like The Quivering Poets. 

Llevo 25 años componiendo temas y escribiendo poesía. Además he actuado en Gibraltar, Perú, Barcelona, y Londres durante más de 25 años. En este tiempo ha habido momentos de inseguridad y de dudas pero nunca he dejado de intentar de crear piezas decente que resonaran en el alma de los otros tal como resonaban la música y la poesía de los artistas que yo admiraba y aun admiro. La música y la poesía han sido siempre mis medios de expresión e intentado mejorar y perfeccionarlos a la medida de mis posibilidades. Sin embargo mucho del progreso se lo debo a los talentosos artistas que he ido conociendo por el camino. Artistas como Los Poetas Trémulos.

The Quivering Poets

During the recording of my first album in 2015, "Love & Decadence" I gathered a series of musicians to record some of the arrangements I had in mind for the new songs. Little did I know that these musicians would then meet, create thre musical landscapes together and tour in the formation we now know as The Quivering Poets. I was also pleasantly surprised by their synergy both musically and in terms of personality and their willingness to work in this project with the added difficulties of residing in different countries: half of them were in Barcelona and half were in London. They have committed to this project so much and we have become such good friends and musical companions that we have decided to record the whole new album together. This is incredibly exciting for me as I admire both their artistry and their humanity.  

Durante la grabación de mi primer disco en 2015, Love and Decadence, reuní una serie de músicos para grabar los arreglos de mis primeros temas en EP. En ese momento no me podía imaginar que poco tiempo después esos mismos músicos, se conocerían, se llevarían bien, se harían amigos y girarían conmigo y con mis temas durante todo el 2016 y parte del 2017. También me sorprendió lo mucho que se compenetrarían musicalmente y como se comprometieran a mi proyecto musical a pesar de vivir en países distintos: parte de los poetas trémulos residen en Inglaterra y la otra parte en Barcelona. Su unión fue tan fructífera que decidimos grabar todo el siguiente disco junto.

We have the musically and poetically talented Barbara Bartz on violin, the master of composition and arrangement Adam Beattie on double bass, Pablo Yupton the passionate, talented and musical Titan on guitar and the rhythmically virtuous Pablo Campos on drums and percussion.

Contamos con el talento musical y poético de Bárbara Bartz al violín, la maestría en la composición y los arreglos de Adam Beattie al bajo, la pasión y la titánica musicalidad de Pablo Yupton a la guitarra y el virtuosismo rítmico de Pablo Campos a la batería y percusión.

 

The Campaign

Overview

While writing and performing my songs I have been overwhelmed by the great support and love we were receiving from people at the various venues where we performed. We wanted to capture this energy and this sound and put it in an album and that is why we embarked on this adventure. Shaping and embellishing the experience and the sound is essential to me and we want to mould my songs into a wonderful listening experience. Your help will enable us to work with the professionals who can make this happen.

En general

A medida que íbamos tocando en más locales y para más personas nos dimos cuenta de que contábamos con el apoyo y el afecto de la mayoría de nuestra audiencia. Queríamos captar la energía del vivo y ponerlo en un disco y por este motivo empezamos esta Aventura. Mejorar el sonido y la experiencia de la música es esencial para mí y quisiera convertir mis canciones en una maravillosa experiencia auditiva. Tu ayuda nos permitirá trabajar con profesionales que pueden poner estas ideas en práctica.

You will help us to record in a studio, which will be a great step up from my first album where I didn't have this opportunity. I will also for the first time be able to promote the album, so it does reach a wider audience. Most importantly, you also help us to work with some great talent on the songs, our artwork and our sound bringing you a truly wonderful album.

Nos ayudaras a grabar en un estudio, que sera un gran paso adelante desde el primer disco cuando no tuvimos esa oportunidad por falta de dinero. Por primera vez también podremos promocionar el disco y darle una oportunidad para que se escuche y pueda estar en el punto de mira de personas que escuchen este tipo de música. Pero mas importante, podremos crear un buen disco de calidad.

Allocation of Funds

Your contribution will go towards the recording, mixing, mastering and CD pressing of the album, the artwork and the promotion of the album.  

  • recording & mixing ~ £1,800
  • mastering ~ £500
  • CD pressing ~ £1,000
  • artwork ~ £400
  • promotion ~ £800

The donated funds will be used for the above elements in a similar distribution even if we are short of the goal at the end of this campaign.

Destino del Dinero

Tu contribución ira destinada a la grabación, mezcla, pasterización, y producción de los CD, el diseño y la promoción del disco.

  • grabación y mezcla ~ £1,800
  • mastering ~ £500
  • CD’s ~ £1,000
  • diseño ~ £400
  • promoción ~ £800

El dinero donado se usara para lo acordado aun si no conseguimos nuestro objetivo económico en esta campaña.

Exciting Perks!

Wow, we have a number of different types of perks available to you. Depending on what takes your fancy on a given day we have poems, personalised poems tailored to you; we have personalised songs that I write and record for you. 

If you fancy having the Quivering Poets around for a gig in your house, there is a perk for that; if you like a more intimate setting and your neighbours are sensitive to noise there is a perk for that too to have either just me or me with Barbara Bartz to perform in your place.

There will be special perks along the campaign so keep an eye out for The Quivering Campaign!

Recompensas

Wow! Tenemos diferentes tipos de cortesías para ti. Tenemos el disco nuevo, poemas personalizados, canciones personalizadas para tus especificaciones, y grabaciones profesionales.

Si deseas un concierto de los Poetas Trémulos en tu casa o un concierto de guitarra y violín si te bien mejor.

Beyond the Record

The Quivering Poets and I believe that music and storytelling enrichen our lives and create a deeper sense of collectiveness and community. The music and poetry we favour is part of a deeper will to connect people and counteract individuality, selfishness, ruthless capitalism and the laws of the jungle. 

We like to experience the world in a very inclusive way at our gigs and in our everyday lives, there is room for everyone, even the audience on stage. We want to keep creating music that holds merit and has gathers like-minded (and not so similar) psyches together.

It's not so much about the record but the message and to be able to keep delivering the message and the tales.

Más allá del disco

Los Poetas Trémulos y yo creemos que contar historias y escuchar música enriquece nuestras vidas y crean un sentido de comunidad y unidad más profundo. La música y la poesía que preferimos forma parte de una determinación más amplia de conectar a las personas y contrarrestar la individualidad, la imbecilidad, el capitalismo más bestial y las leyes de la jungla.

Nos gusta experimentar el mundo de una manera más inclusiva en nuestros bolos y en nuestras vidas del día a día. Hay lugar para todos en el local, incluso para que la audiencia se una a nosotros en el escenario. Queremos seguir creando música de calidad y que junte a las personas y sus sentimientos

Love and Decadence

Love and Decadence isn't just the title of my debut album that has nearly sold out the initial pressing. It refers to a part of my life which revolves around these opposite poles. With very little resources the album Love and Decadence was born, I am so excited to embark on this new album with The Quivering Poets for all the possibilities it could bring through this campaign.

From Love and Decadence musical nights sprung up with us playing, The Lantern Society was also instrumental in fostering the talent that got swept together by their shared emotion in and outside of music.

Amor y Decadencia

Amor y Decadencia no fue solo mi primer disco debut que ya está casi todo vendido pero también se refiere a una gran parte de mi vida que oscila entre estos dos polos opuestos. Con muy pocos recursos hicimos el disco “Love & Decadence” con la ayuda de Norbert Toth y otros más. Estoy muy ilusionado con este segundo proyecto y por todas las posibilidades que esta campaña podría traer.

Supporting Venues/Events

We would like to say a massive thanks to these wonderful venues to have helped us along the road so far and we have enjoyed many nights in their cradling arms. You will see us performing in these venues regularly so if you are not around London now, not to worry you'll know where to find us.

  • Betsey Trotwood, Farringdon, London - home to The Lantern Society
  • Karamel Restaurant, Wood Green, North London - home to nights such as The Lantern Society, Gabriel & Frank's Poetry Night
  • The Poetry Brothel - a monthly poetry extravaganza that has popped up in various venues
  • New Roots Promotions, Rory Carlile
  • Folklore Productions, Rick Damiani
  • El Coleccionista, Barcelona
  • Old Nuns Head, Nuns Head,
  • Siting Room Sessions, City Pavillion, Matt Fleming

Locales y eventos que nos han apoyado

Queremos agradecer a estos locales y promotores por su apoyo.

  • Betsey Trotwood, Farringdon, London - home to The Lantern Society
  • Karamel Restaurant, Wood Green, North London - home to nights such as The Lantern Society, Gabriel & Frank's Poetry Night
  • The Poetry Brothel - a monthly poetry extravaganza that has popped up in various venues
  • New Roots Promotions, Rory Carlile
  • Folklore Productions, Rick Damiani
  • El Coleccionista, Barcelona
  • Old Nuns Head, Nuns Head,
  • Siting Room Sessions, City Pavillion, Matt Fleming

Other Ways You Can Help

For those of you unable to help us via perks, another great way to help us achieve this album is to share our campaign. There are great Indiegogo sharing tools that you can spread the word with.

Otras maneras de ayudar

Por aquellos de vosotros que no quieran participar mediante las recompensas, otra manera de conseguir que el disco funcione es compartiendo nuestra Campania y pasando los datos a sus contactos. Puedes compartir este Indiegogo mediante las diferentes redes sociales. Gracias.
